description.text:
RemotePermanent or Full-time ContractorCompetitive package

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We're looking for a talented and detail-oriented SEO Content Editor to join our growing team of gambling content specialists. You'll play a key role in shaping and optimising content across English-language gambling projects, including but not limited to those covering casinos, sports betting, esports, and crypto betting.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with freelancers and internal teams (including Editors, SEO, Design, Product, and Affiliation) to publish high-quality, SEO-optimized, and user-focused content that aligns with brand and business goals.Edit and optimize content for search intent, readability, and SEO best practices - including title tags, internal linking, metadata, alt text, and imagery.Audit existing content to identify outdated articles, content gaps, and new opportunities to improve authority and rankings.Regularly update and enhance existing articles to maintain accuracy, freshness, and SEO performance.Commission, brief, and manage content creation from both staff and freelance writers using keyword research, search trends, and competitor analysis.Contribute to ongoing content strategy by identifying trending topics and new keyword opportunities to grow organic traffic.Support the Head of Content with content planning, publishing workflows, and managing the editorial calendar to ensure timely delivery.Stay informed on the latest SEO developments, gambling industry news, and content best practices - using insights to enhance the quality and relevance of published content.Collaborate closely with the wider content and SEO team to maintain consistency, voice, and quality across all published material.

Qualifications

Fluent in the English language, with excellent grammar, spelling, and punctuation skills.Proven experience as an Editor, Content Manager, or similar role within the iGaming industry - ideally with exposure to esports, casinos, and affiliate content.Good to intermediate understanding of SEO, including keyword research, on-page optimization, and familiarity with tools like Ahrefs, Semrush, or similar.Comfortable using WordPress to upload, edit, and publish content.Solid understanding of online gambling terminology, products, player intent, and current industry trends.Strong attention to detail and a high standard for content accuracy, formatting, and SEO compliance.Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.Effective communication and collaboration skills, working well across teams (e.g., writers, SEO, design, and product).A genuine interest in online gambling, esports, and betting — and a desire to stay informed on market developments.Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to contribute ideas and improve workflows and content strategy.Strong problem-solving skills in fast-paced and changing editorial environments.

Preferred Qualifications

Ability to QA and refine AI-generated content while ensuring compliance with quality and tone.Understanding of plagiarism and originality tools (e.g., Copyscape, Grammarly, Originality.ai).Familiarity with crypto betting, blockchain gambling platforms, or Web3 technologies.Working knowledge of Google Search Console, Google Analytics, or similar performance tracking tools.Familiarity with brief templates and systems to streamline and standardize large-scale content production.Understanding of odds formats, betting systems, and user personas within betting ecosystems.

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy33 free paid daysMarket-leading remunerationAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working (work fully remotely and option for weekly coworker space)Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

description.text:
Job Highlights:Contract: Independent ContractorSchedule: Between 9:00 am to 4:00 pm, Ambler, PA, USA, Eastern Time
Job Overview:We are looking for a part-time virtual assistant to help modernize and maintain our existing website. This role will initially require monthly updates to keep our site fresh, functional, and aligned with industry trends. After an initial period, the update frequency will shift to a quarterly schedule while still ensuring our website remains visually appealing and optimized for performance.
Responsibilities:Website Modernization: Implement updates to enhance the look, feel, and user experience of our site, including layout improvements, updated visuals, and mobile responsiveness.Content Updates: Modify website content as needed to reflect the latest company offerings, partnerships, and industry trends.SEO Optimization: Perform quarterly SEO audits and updates to improve search rankings and ensure our website remains competitive in organic search results.Performance Monitoring: Identify and resolve technical issues affecting site speed, navigation, and overall functionality.Collaboration: Work closely with our team to ensure updates align with our branding and business objectives.
RequirementsThis is a part-time, remote position, with working hoursProficiency in website design and maintenance (WordPress, HTML, CSS, or relevant CMS platforms).Strong understanding of SEO best practices and tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Yoast.Experience in UX/UI enhancements to improve visitor engagement.Detail-oriented with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.Prior experience in the parking technology or related industries is a plus but not required.
BenefitsIndependent Contractor Perks:Permanent work from homeImmediate hiringSteady freelance job
Please note that since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an “Independent Contractor” arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.
ZR_26635_JOB

basic_info.title: Apprenticeship Junior ASO & SEO - Digital Marketing

description.text:
At Meetic, a Match Group company, we have been pioneering online dating for over 20 years, leveraging our legacy to reinvent how people meet, connect, and build meaningful relationships across Europe and beyond. As part of Match Group, we manage a diverse portfolio of brands, from iconic names like Meetic, Match, Lexa, and LoveScout to tailored experiences for singles over 50, OurTime, DisonsDemain, Zweizam, and single parents, Even and Stir. 
Our teams design, build, and scale platforms across 20+ countries and 18 languages, ensuring every single finds the right match for their lifestyle and lifestages. We also drive growth for other Match Group brands like The League, OkCupid, Archer, Salams, and Plenty Of Fish, expanding our impact worldwide.
When it comes to dating, the connection starts online, but the real magic happens once you meet in real life (IRL). We think the same is true for creating the best platforms, so we work together IRL 3 days / week in our office, 53 rue de Chateaudun, 75009 Paris.
Role overview :
You will join the Digital Marketing team at Meetic as an ASO & SEO Apprentice, playing a key role in enhancing our apps' visibility across the Apple App Store and Google Play Store. You will support the international rollout of our ASO strategy through project coordination and store optimization efforts. Additionally, you will assist our SEO team in deploying editorial content strategies across multiple European markets, working closely with internal teams and external partners.
When it comes to dating, the connection starts online, but the real magic happens once you meet in real life (IRL). We think the same is true for creating the best platforms, so we work together IRL 3 days / week in our office, 53 rue de Chateaudun, 75009 Paris.

How you’ll make an impact ?Coordinate and launch In-App Events and custom store listings across multiple brands and countriesSupport the execution of the ASO roadmap by collaborating with Product, Brand, Acquisition, and Creative teamsAnalyze app performance through ASO and analytics tools to identify areas of improvementContribute to the SEO content calendar and coordinate production with editorial teams and consultants
We could be a match if :You’re a Master's student in Digital Marketing, Communications, or a related field. You have a solid understanding of ASO, SEOYou are comfortable working in an agile project management environmentYou are fluent in both French and English (written & spoken)You’re often nerding over tech, you’re very well organized, detail-oriented, curious
What’s the team like ?You will report to the ASO & SEO Managers and work within Meetic’s Digital Marketing team, collaborating cross-functionally with the Brand, Product, and Acquisition teamsThe team values collaboration, curiosity, and autonomy, and success in this role means becoming a trusted contributor to our ASO initiatives while learning how large-scale acquisition strategies are run across Europe
Interview Process :A first 20-30 min Zoom conversation with Fatima-Ezzahra ABIDI (Junior Talent Acquisition Specialist)A 45 min Zoom meeting with Alexandre Messuwe (Head of SEO, ASO & Technical measurement)A 90 min onsite or Zoom interview with Alexandre and Soleyne Grossard (SEO Performance Analyst), including a case study. 

Why Match Group? - Work on products that impact millions, collaborating with global and diverse teams, shaping relationships and connections worldwide.-  Benefit from a healthy work-life balance in a flexible and welcoming environment.-  Enjoy a modern Paris office with a rooftop, close to transport and amenities.- Access Edenred lunch vouchers, a discounted ClassPass subscription, premium healthcare with WTW, and our Worklife sustainable mobility package.-  Grow through e-learning, conferences, and knowledge-sharing sessions.-  Thrive in a dynamic, agile tech environment with evolving microservices and a culture of knowledge sharing and autonomy.-  Participate in hackathons and drive innovative projects.-  Join regular social events like breakfasts, lunches, and apéros.-  Use our products for free.
 Meetic, a Match Group company, is an equal opportunity employer and we value the rich dynamics that diversity brings to our company.
 If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please let your Talent Acquisition partner know.
 #Meetic

description.text:
L'entreprise

Chez Yumens, agence conseil en stratégie digitale et filiale de MV Group, nous nous sommes donnés une mission : faciliter l’accès à l’ensemble des leviers digitaux auprès des acteurs économiques pour booster leur croissance. Un challenge qui ne peut réussir qu’avec l’expertise et la motivation de nos équipes !

Pour accompagner notre forte croissance, nous sommes à la recherche de notre futur(e) Référenceu.se SEO à Lyon.

Description Du Poste

Vos missions :

Apporter le meilleur niveau d’expertise pour conseiller et accompagner vos clients et développer leurs business grâce au SEO Améliorer continuellement votre niveau d’expertise parce que c’est ce qui vous permettra de mieux satisfaire vos clients 

Au Quotidien

Vous serez responsable de votre portefeuille clients et de la stratégie de chacun de vos comptes Vous serez responsable du suivi et de l’analyse des performances Vous travaillerez en relation étroite avec les 15 rédacteurs internes de notre pôle contenu Vous appliquerez des méthodes de travail efficaces qui vont vous guider dans votre quotidien 

Pour Cela, Vous Devrez

Comprendre le cœur de métier de vos clients Identifier le positionnement et les best practices des concurrents Utiliser les meilleures solutions du marché (Majestic, SEMrush, SimilarWeb, YourTextGuru, Ranxplorer, Search Console, Wincher, Babbar et bien d’autres) pour maximiser la visibilité des sites de vos clients sur les moteurs de recherche, capter leurs cibles prioritaires et générer du trafic qualifié pour convertir Accélérer leur visibilité sur les top positions avec une stratégie de netlinking personnalisée Les accompagner lors de la création ou la refonte de leur site 

Et vous ?

Vous avez idéalement 2 à 3 ans d'expérience en SEO.

Quelques Pré-requis

Une bonne culture digitale et des connaissances sur les règles SEO imposées par Google Connaissances des outils tels que Google Analytics et Google Search Console Anglais professionnel courant Chez Yumens, quelle que soit l'agence, l'expertise ou les missions, la maîtrise et l’utilisation de l'IA font partie intégrante de nos attentes et de notre quotidien. 

Votre Personnalité Avant Tout

Passionné.e, vous avez une très bonne connaissance du fonctionnement des moteurs de recherche Vous aimez être efficace et faire gagner de l’argent à vos clients Vous avez un bon relationnel, vous êtes autonome et vous aimez travailler en équipe. Pourquoi rejoindre Yumens ? 

Vous Avez Coché Toutes Les Cases (ou Presque) ? Maintenant, C’est à Nous De Vous Convaincre. On Vous Donne 5 Raisons De Rejoindre L’aventure Yumens

Yumens est une filiale de MV Group qui se compose de 10 autres entités aux expertises digitales complémentaires : projets en commun et proximité au sein des locaux permettront d'enrichir vos rencontres et d’échanger avec des profils d’univers différents.La qualité de vie au travail est un élément majeur chez Yumens. En plus de bénéficier de nombreux avantages sociaux (tickets restaurants, horaires flexibles, mutuelle, RTT, participation aux résultats, home office et bien d’autres encore !). Vous travaillerez dans un environnement pensé pour assurer la cohésion, la convivialité et le bien-être au travail.Au cours de l’année, plusieurs événements internes sont organisés pour renforcer la cohésion au sein de l'équipe et du groupe (séminaires, teams buildings, déjeuners d’équipe, etc)Vous bénéficierez de formations régulières en interne pour accélérer votre évolution.Si vous avez le goût pour transmettre votre passion, vous pourrez même devenir formateur au sein de nos écoles 301 et l’Ecole Digitale de la Nouvelle Chance Convaincu(e) ? Alors, rejoignez-nous vite !

MV Group étant engagé dans une politique en faveur de l’intégration et du maintien de l’emploi des personnes en situation de handicap, toutes nos offres d'emploi sont ouvertes aux personnes en situation de handicap.

description.text:
About the Company:Wayfinder Agency is a performance-driven digital marketing agency specializing in helping e-commerce brands, particularly in the tabletop gaming industry, scale profitably through paid media. We partner with a range of clients, from indie creators to 8-figure brands, as well as select B2B and B2C software companies. Entirely remote, our team is collaborative, agile, and deeply committed to driving measurable growth for the brands we support.
About the Role:We are seeking a highly skilled Paid Media Specialist with deep expertise in managing and optimizing campaigns across Google Ads, Facebook/Meta Ads, and Amazon Ads. This role will be instrumental in driving performance for our e-commerce clients, especially those in the tabletop gaming space, by taking ownership of paid media strategy, execution, and ongoing optimization. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment, has strong attention to detail, and communicates clearly with both internal teams and clients. You’ll play a key role in shaping campaign strategy, collaborating with creative teams, and continuously testing to improve results.
This is a Full-Time, remote role.
We are looking for a Paid Media Specialist specifically with these requirements:Advanced experience running paid media campaigns on:Facebook/Meta Ads (well-versed in scaling campaigns).Google Ads (including Performance Max, Shopping, and YouTube campaigns).Amazon Ads (Sponsored Products, Brands, and Display).Solid understanding of e-commerce advertising strategy, funnel optimization, and DTC customer journeys.Experience working with e-commerce brands with ad budgets exceeding $25K/month.Proficiency with GA4, Google Tag Manager, Google Merchant Center, and conversion tracking.Familiarity with Shopify, including handling integrations and generating performance reports.Exceptional attention to detail - able to catch small issues before they become big problems.Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain strategies and performance to both internal teams and clients.Collaborative team player who works well with account managers, designers, and strategists.Ability to take initiative, solve problems proactively, and test new ideas independently.Adaptability to shifting ad trends and platform updates.Open to feedback, continuously learning, and confident without ego.Bonus: Passion or familiarity with tabletop games, board games, TTRPGs, or Kickstarter campaigns.
Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):Plan, build, manage, and optimize paid media campaigns across Google, Facebook/Meta, and Amazon.Analyze campaign performance using KPIs such as ROAS, CPA, CTR, LTV, and conversion rate, and make data-driven decisions to improve results.Collaborate closely with creative and account teams to improve ad creatives, messaging, and landing page performance.Develop and execute testing strategies, including A/B tests, audience segmentation, creative variations, and landing page optimization.Prepare clear and actionable performance reports and insights for internal teams and clients.Stay current with industry trends and platform updates—especially within Google, Meta, and Amazon—and implement best practices accordingly.Support or mentor junior media buyers and help QA other accounts when needed.Participate in strategy calls to help shape direction based on product lifecycles, seasonality, and client goals.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:Ability to grow into a Lead Media Buyer role across multiple accounts, with greater ownership of campaign strategy.Opportunity to step into a Performance Marketing Account Manager position, working directly with clients and leading strategic planning.Option to specialize as a Channel Expert (Google, Meta, or Amazon) and lead best practices across the agency.Potential to take on mentorship responsibilities, including training junior media buyers and supporting QA across teams.Fully remote role with flexible scheduling - we operate async and prioritize performance over presence.12 days of paid time off annually, with flexible holiday swapping based on your region or culture.Access to mental health and sick days - your well-being matters.Paid training and certifications - we invest in your professional development with ongoing learning opportunities.A tech stipend to ensure you have the tools you need to do your best work.Join a collaborative, fast-moving team passionate about e-commerce, gaming, and results-driven marketing.
This Position Is Perfect For You If…
You're performance-driven.You’re obsessed with hitting KPIs, improving ROAS, and making data-backed decisions that drive real results for clients.
You're proactive and resourceful.You take initiative, solve problems independently, and never wait around for direction. You’re always looking for ways to improve performance.
You're detail-oriented.You catch the small stuff others miss. You know that precision is key when building, managing, and optimizing campaigns.


Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

basic_info.title: Synology NAS Implementation Specialist (Network Attached Storage)

description.text:
Job Description – Synology NAS Implementation SpecialistRole OverviewWe are seeking a skilled Synology NAS Implementation Specialist to provide remote technical services for the setup, integration, and validation of Synology SA3410 NAS units. The role involves ensuring hardware readiness, installing and configuring the DiskStation Manager (DSM), integrating with Active Directory, creating classroom-specific shared folders, applying access controls, and verifying system performance. The specialist will also provide knowledge transfer, documentation, and best practices to support long-term system management.Key ResponsibilitiesValidate and confirm hardware components including drives, RAM, NICs, and rail kits. Ensure firmware and DSM are up to date.Install DSM operating system and configure SSD cache and RAID using enterprise SAS HDDs. Create and manage storage volumes based on project requirements.Integrate NAS with the client’s Active Directory for centralized authentication and management.Create classroom-specific shared folders with appropriate role-based access controls for teachers and students.Conduct access testing to validate permissions for different roles. Perform basic system performance testing and optimization.Deliver a best practices guide covering system usage, data protection, and maintenance.Conduct live walkthrough and Q&A sessions with the client’s IT team for knowledge transfer.Provide up to 8 hours of remote expert support during setup, troubleshooting, and performance optimization.Required Skills & QualificationsProven experience with Synology NAS solutions (SA3410 or similar models).Strong knowledge of DiskStation Manager (DSM), RAID configurations, and SSD caching.Hands-on experience with Active Directory integration and role-based access management.Expertise in shared folder setup, permissions, and security configurations.Familiarity with data protection, backup strategies, and system best practices.Strong troubleshooting and performance optimization skills.Excellent communication skills for conducting training and walkthroughs.

Preferred QualificationsRelevant certifications (e.g., Synology Certified, CompTIA Server+, or equivalent).Experience working in educational IT environments or with classroom-specific IT setups.Background in remote support and client-facing IT projects.Job Type & DurationShort-term contract role; estimated 1 business day (8 hours) of remote support for implementation, with possible follow-up for troubleshooting.

description.text:
About Eneba
At Eneba, we’re building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20m+ active users (and growing fast!), provides a level of trust, safety and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We’re proud of what we’ve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you. Join us as we continue to scale, diversify our portfolio, and grow with the evolving community of gamers.
About the Role
We’re hiring a Head of Performance Marketing to lead our user acquisition efforts and help drive Eneba’s next stage of growth. Today, performance marketing is managed by several teams reporting directly to the co-founder. You’ll step in to lead, organize, and scale these teams—starting with influencer marketing and Google Ads, with the potential to expand your scope over time. This is a hands-on and strategic role where you’ll drive meaningful growth through paid media and influencer partnerships, combining data-driven optimization with creative marketing tactics. You’ll be managing significant marketing budgets and helping Eneba scale its reach in a competitive, fast-growing gaming marketplace.
About the Team
You’ll report directly our Co-founder and CMO and work closely with:
- Influencer Marketing and Paid Media teams (initially direct reports)- SEO, Affiliates, Social Media, and Content teams (collaborative partners, possible future reports)- Data & Analytics teams (for real-time performance tracking and experimentation)
Responsibilities
Own and lead Eneba’s influencer strategy and paid media performance across key global markets.Manage large-scale marketing budgets efficiently, optimizing for spend vs. payback ratios.Scale the influencer marketing function, both strategically and operationally, across YouTube, Twitch, TikTok, and other platforms.Lead and develop the Paid Search team (Google Ads), driving efficient user acquisition at scale.Drive a data-led, experimental growth approach, constantly iterating on campaigns and creative tactics.Partner cross-functionally with Product, Analytics, Creative, and Content teams to align marketing and business goals.Develop creative, hackish strategies tailored to a low LTV product, optimizing across acquisition channels.Mentor and grow a high-performing marketing team, eventually expanding your leadership scope.
Must-have Requirements
Experience in B2C (eCommerce, D2C, SaaS) companies managing significant paid media budgets and driving strong year-over-year growth.Strong influencer marketing leadership experience (minimum 2+ years), managing large budgets and long-term partnerships.Good understanding of Google Ads performance optimization, even if not hands-on daily.Proven people manager, leading and motivating multi-functional teams.Highly data-driven, with a creative growth mindset and a track record of building scalable user acquisition strategies.Comfortable working in fast-growth, high-pressure environments; self-driven and hungry to prove success.
Nice-to-have Requirements
Experience with affiliate marketing, SEO, PR, and social media growth tactics.Exposure to international growth, ideally in English-speaking markets like the US, UK, or Australia.Hands-on experience working with low LTV digital goods or gaming marketplaces.
What's in it for you?
Full ownership of performance marketing in a high-budget environment, with the autonomy to shape teams and strategy.The opportunity to scale one of Europe’s top gaming marketplaces and drive millions in revenue growth.Work across multiple products (digital goods marketplace and play-to-earn projects).A dynamic and fast-paced growth culture where your leadership makes an immediate impact.
What it’s like to work at Eneba
*Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options program.*Opportunity to help scale a unique product.*Various bonus systems: performance-based, referral, additional paid leave, personal learning budget.*Paid volunteering opportunities.*Work location of your choice: office, remote, opportunity to work and travel.*Personal and professional growth at an exponential rate supported by well-defined feedback and promotion processes.
*Please attach CV's in English.*To find out about how we handle your personal data, make sure to check out our Candidate Privacy Notice https://www.eneba.com/candidate-privacy-notice

description.text:
RemotePermanent or Full-time ContractorCompetitive package 

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We’re looking for a talented and driven Content Editor – iGaming to join our growing team.

In this role, you'll be responsible for producing and editing high-quality, engaging content focused on the gambling industry. From casino and sports betting to industry news and game reviews, you'll help shape content that informs and captivates our audience.

Responsibilities

Editing and optimizing pages according to SEO guidelinesWriting, editing, and publishing a variety of gambling content on our WordPress CMS to a high standardBuilding content briefs across various topics and markets with thorough keyword and competitor analysisOptimize content for search engines by conducting keyword research, implementing on-page SEO techniques, and tracking performanceDaily collaboration with in-house or freelance writers, setting deadlines, giving feedback, and setting tasks

Qualifications

Ideally 2+ years of professional experience in igaming content writing and editing.Strong research and analytical skillsExcellent command of English and the ability to write clearly and concisely for a specific audienceFamiliarity with Google Search Console, Ahrefs, and other SEO toolsA good understanding of SEO and content best practices, and how to write for the webExperience working with WordPress CMSExcellent organizational and time-management skills

Preferred Qualifications

Experience/understanding of UX design & CROExperience/understanding of the affiliation business model

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy33 free paid daysMarket-leading remunerationAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

description.text:
About the Company:eTraining Inc. is a forward-thinking eLearning company dedicated to delivering high-impact workplace safety training and certification programs. With over 14 years of experience, we help mid-to-large companies elevate their safety standards through engaging, effective online education. We operate as a fully remote team and take pride in our open, collaborative, and no-micromanagement culture, where motivated professionals are trusted to take ownership and drive results.
About the Role:We are seeking a highly motivated, experienced  E-learning Head of Growth with a strong background in lead generation and funnel optimization. This role is key to driving qualified leads, increasing brand visibility, and supporting course sales through multi-channel marketing efforts. The ideal candidate will thrive in a remote, entrepreneurial environment and excel at building scalable systems, collaborating cross-functionally, and using data to inform strategy.This is a Full-Time remote position.

We are looking for an E-learning Head of Growth specifically with these requirements:Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.3-5+ years of B2B marketing experience, ideally in eLearning, online training, or course-based businesses.Proven success in generating qualified leads and driving course/program sales.Expertise in building and optimizing full marketing funnels (lead magnets, landing pages, email flows).Proficiency with ABM (Account-Based Marketing) and multi-channel outreach.Strong copywriting skills for landing pages, email sequences, and conversion-focused content.Skilled in content strategy - including content calendars, blogs, LinkedIn, webinars, and SME-driven content.Hands-on experience with HubSpot Marketing Hub, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, LinkedIn, and SEO best practices.Familiarity with light website editing, CMS updates, and A/B testing tools.Comfortable analyzing and reporting on key marketing KPIs, campaign performance, and lead quality.A plus: experience using AI tools for content creation, SEO, or funnel optimization.Strong project management skills; able to take initiatives from strategy to execution with minimal oversight.Bonus: industry knowledge in safety training or certification.

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):Own and manage the marketing funnel, developing lead magnets, landing pages, and email flows to attract and convert high-quality leads.Manage or directly execute paid media buying, and evaluate media buyers to ensure ROI-positive ad spend.Identify and recruit Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to collaborate on authority-building content like blogs, webinars, and podcasts.Research and identify where our ICPs (VPs of Safety at mid-to-large companies) spend time online, and ensure our presence in those spaces.Take ownership of the marketing technology stack (HubSpot, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, etc.), ensuring smooth integration and accurate lead tracking.Lead conversion rate optimization efforts on key landing pages, crafting compelling copy, running A/B tests, and improving funnel performance.Regularly meet with sales and operations stakeholders to align on campaigns, monitor lead quality, and support course launch initiatives.Act as a strategic liaison between sales and operations to ensure marketing aligns with business needs and supports growth.Gather market feedback to inform campaign strategy and help shape new course development.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:Be the first dedicated marketer in a well-established, 14-year-old company - with full ownership over the marketing function.Huge potential for growth in title, compensation, and bonus opportunities as the business scales.Work in a collaborative, remote-first culture that values independence, trust, and results.Paid training and 3+ weeks of vacation annually.Covered travel expenses for company-related events or meetings.Flexibility in how you work - as long as you're driving results, you’ll have room to manage your own schedule.The chance to make a real impact and grow alongside a company investing heavily in marketing for the first time.
This Position Is Perfect For You If…
You’re resourceful and solutions-oriented.You love figuring things out, whether it’s optimizing a funnel, troubleshooting tech issues, or navigating new tools and strategies.
You communicate clearly and collaborate with ease.You’re confident working cross-functionally with sales and operations, and you keep the team aligned through thoughtful communication.
You’re driven by results and always looking to improve.You focus on outcomes, not just activity. You seek feedback, analyze performance, and continuously test and iterate to drive better results.
You’re highly independent and can self-manage.You’re comfortable owning your role from end to end, managing your time, and consistently delivering without micromanagement.Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.
Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):Own and manage the marketing funnel, developing lead magnets, landing pages, and email flows to attract and convert high-quality leads.Manage or directly execute paid media buying, and evaluate media buyers to ensure ROI-positive ad spend.Identify and recruit Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to collaborate on authority-building content like blogs, webinars, and podcasts.Research and identify where our ICPs (VPs of Safety at mid-to-large companies) spend time online, and ensure our presence in those spaces.Take ownership of the marketing technology stack (HubSpot, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, etc.), ensuring smooth integration and accurate lead tracking.Lead conversion rate optimization efforts on key landing pages, crafting compelling copy, running A/B tests, and improving funnel performance.Regularly meet with sales and operations stakeholders to align on campaigns, monitor lead quality, and support course launch initiatives.Act as a strategic liaison between sales and operations to ensure marketing aligns with business needs and supports growth.Gather market feedback to inform campaign strategy and help shape new course development.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:Be the first dedicated marketer in a well-established, 14-year-old company - with full ownership over the marketing function.Huge potential for growth in title, compensation, and bonus opportunities as the business scales.Work in a collaborative, remote-first culture that values independence, trust, and results.Paid training and 3+ weeks of vacation annually.Covered travel expenses for company-related events or meetings.Flexibility in how you work - as long as you're driving results, you’ll have room to manage your own schedule.The chance to make a real impact and grow alongside a company investing heavily in marketing for the first time.
This Position Is Perfect For You If…
You’re resourceful and solutions-oriented.You love figuring things out, whether it’s optimizing a funnel, troubleshooting tech issues, or navigating new tools and strategies.
You communicate clearly and collaborate with ease.You’re confident working cross-functionally with sales and operations, and you keep the team aligned through thoughtful communication.
You’re driven by results and always looking to improve.You focus on outcomes, not just activity. You seek feedback, analyze performance, and continuously test and iterate to drive better results.
You’re highly independent and can self-manage.You’re comfortable owning your role from end to end, managing your time, and consistently delivering without micromanagement.Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.
Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

description.text:
Fully RemotePermanent or full-time ContractorCompetitive package

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We are excited to be on the hunt for a talented and motivated individual to join our team as an Content Manager (Web 3) who will be involved in all aspects of delivering Content.

In this role, you will be responsible for auditing and ensuring the global quality of all content across our projects. This role is pivotal in leading and executing SEO strategy, managing large-scale global campaigns, and overseeing all content within WordPress. The ideal candidate will be a key point of cross-team communication, working closely with RMs and editors and reporting directly to the hiring manager.

Strong Web3 knowledge and experience managing content across international audiences is essential.

Responsibilities

Audit all content across Provider SEO sitesLeverage Web3 knowledge to inform and level-up content strategyDevelop and enforce editorial guidelinesHelp manage SEO strategy and executionOversee content management and site updates in WordPressCoordinate communications between Key StakeholdersMaintain high standards for content quality and consistencyRegularly report to the hiring manager

Qualifications

Proven experience with large international and/or Web3-focused campaignsDeep understanding of Web3, blockchain, or project ecosystemsExceptional content management and editorial skillsSignificant experience developing and implementing SEO strategiesAdvanced proficiency with WordPressStrong cross-team and remote communication skillsCapability to manage multiple projects and priorities

Nice To Have Requirements

Further experience in the project or Web3 industryFamiliarity with web analytics and reportingPrevious experience managing or leading teams

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy30 free paid daysMarket-leading remuneration and bonuses availableAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working (work fully remotely and option for weekly coworker space)Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

description.text:
About us
At Eneba, we’re building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20 million active users (and growing fast!), providing a level of trust, safety, and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We’re proud of what we’ve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you.
About the Role
We’re hiring a PR Growth Partner to lead the development of omni-channel campaigns that drive both brand trust and business outcomes. This is a hybrid PR and growth role — not just about generating awareness, but building campaigns that deliver tangible, measurable impact.
You’ll join the Brand Authority team within the Content division and work cross-functionally with Influencers, Partnerships, Product, SEO, and Newsletters to bring compelling, creative narratives to life. From product launches to strategic collaborations, you’ll own the entire campaign lifecycle — from ideation and forecasting to rollout and reporting.
About the Team
You’ll report directly to the Content Marketing Manager and collaborate closely with:
Product Leads, Partnerships, Influencers, Newsletters, SEO, and ContentExecutive Team and external consultants on strategic communication projectsInternal writers and designers to shape narratives and briefs
Responsibilities
Own the full lifecycle of PR Growth Campaigns — from strategy and narrative development to execution and analysisLaunch creative, trust-focused initiatives across channels like Influencers, Product, Newsletters, SEO, Partnerships, On-site banners, and paid mediaTranslate product or business milestones into compelling stories and angles with measurable bottom-line impactForecast campaign results, define KPIs (e.g. GMV, ROAS, new users), and iterate based on insights from tools like Mixpanel and GABuild and maintain strong media relationships, securing coverage in high-value outlets and platformsDevelop cross-functional campaign roadmaps and briefs that guide internal and external collaborators toward unified executionContribute to Eneba’s B2B positioning project in collaboration with the executive team and external advisorsHelp build a scalable playbook for trust-based and milestone-driven communication campaigns
Requirement
Must-Have
4+ years of experience in PR, communications, or growth-related marketing roles, ideally within B2C or B2B eCommerce, SaaS, or digital productsHands-on exposure to B2B comms, brand positioning, and internal-external alignmentTrack record of launching creative, multi-channel campaigns that go beyond awareness and deliver measurable business resultsStrong creative thinking and growth hacking mindset — you see what others miss and bring bold ideas to lifeExcellent storytelling and narrative-building skills; you know how to package product features or business milestones for multiple audiencesStrategic planning and performance analysis capabilities — from roadmap creation to post-launch reportingDeep understanding of how to coordinate XFN marketing (Influencers, SEO, Product, Partnerships, Newsletters, etc.)Comfortable owning high-level initiatives while executing hands-onFamiliar with performance tools like Mixpanel, GA, or similar analytics platforms
Nice to Have
Experience working in gaming, digital marketplaces, or trust-first consumer productsExisting relationships with media and editorial outlets relevant to our target marketsFamiliarity with localization strategy, landing page messaging, and visual storytelling
What’s in It for You?
Full ownership of high-visibility, cross-functional campaigns with measurable business impactA chance to shape Eneba’s trust narrative and drive results in both B2C and B2B segmentsDirect involvement in company-wide strategic initiatives — including future partnerships and long-term positioningJoin a strong, autonomous marketing team with the resources and freedom to innovatePotential to grow into a leadership role managing newsletters, PR, and campaign contributors
What it’s like to work at Eneba
Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options programOpportunity to help scale a unique and fast-growing productAccess to performance-based bonuses, referral bonuses, additional paid leave, and learning budgetsPaid volunteering opportunitiesWork where and how you want — remote, office-based, or a mix of bothClear feedback and promotion processes supporting fast personal and professional growth

description.text:
Our Vision & Products

🚀 EverAI — Building the Future of AI Companionship

One of the Top 15 Largest & Fastest-Growing AI Companies in the World

30+ Million Users in under 2 years — Help Us Reach 100M first, 500M next

At EverAI, we’re shaping what it means to connect with AI. With 30+ million users and counting, we're not just building products — we're creating entirely new categories.

Our flagship product is the world's largest AI girlfriend/boyfriend platform, redefining relationships for millions. And we’re only just getting started.

Up next? We’re scaling our second product to revolutionize the creator economy. Think best-in-class AI content engines for video and image generation — designed to put world-class tools in every creator’s pocket.

All of this is governed by our proprietary moderation system, EverGuard — an internal AI designed to ensure everything we build is safe, ethical, and human-first.

Our Team

We are an enthusiastic, passionate and hardworking team of 70 people. Our founding team has strong entrepreneurial experience building and scaling web products from 0 to IPO.

Alexis Soulopoulos [CEO]

 10+ years in Tech Executive Leadership Co-Founder Mad Paws Holdings (from 0 to IPO) Forbes 30 under 30 + Deloitte TechFast50 ’22 & ‘23

Michael Monin [Co-founder & CTO]

 10+ years as CTO / COO (web2/web3), 1+ year in AI/LLM Serial-entrepreneur: MTK Digital (exited / 0->$20m revenue) and Zipchat (AI Chatbot for E-commerce brands)

Thomas Lacroix [Co-founder & CMO]

 8+ years in Customer Acquisition & E-commerce Growth Serial-entrepreneur: Curatible (sold to Blackstone) and MTK Digital (exited / 0->$20m revenue)

Maruša Fasano [CFO/Legal]

 25+ years in Finance, Strategy, M&A Ex-CFO/M&A @Curatible (exited to Blackstone) Ex-President of the Board @SotremoSA (exited) Co-founder/CFO @SoftOne (exited)

Your Role

This is a hands-on role for someone who can execute fast, iterate with creative and funnel inputs, and scale what works. You’ll inherit high-performing campaigns and work directly with our CMO to double down on growth.

You’ll then also have the opportunity to test and scale new channels (TikTok, Meta, Snapchat, Native, ASA) depending on performance and market constraints.

Your Responsibilities

Campaign Ownership and Scaling

Take the lead on one or two paid acquisition channels across direct-buy and programmatic networks (e.g., ExoClick, TrafficStars, TrafficJunky), with potential to expand scope based on performanceContribute to building scalable acquisition funnels — from execution to iteration — with aggressive growth targets in mindRun high-velocity testing loops (creatives, audiences, placements) to improve CAC and LTV

Performance Analysis and Strategy

Monitor performance daily using tools like Voluum, GA4, and internal dashboardsDrive decision-making through deep analysis of CPA, ROAS, retention, and cohort behaviorBuild and maintain internal reporting frameworks that guide strategic shifts and tactical moves

Creative & Funnel Optimization

Own the creative briefing process: define hooks, formats, and angles based on performance patternsCollaborate closely with the content and product teams to launch and iterate on high-converting landing pagesImplement systems to reduce creative fatigue and increase speed of testing

Partnership Management & Media Strategy

Build strong relationships with traffic sources and negotiate premium placements and custom dealsExplore new acquisition opportunities (networks, formats, tools) and build internal evaluation criteriaStay ahead of ecosystem changes (platform rules, algorithm shifts) and adapt strategy accordingly

Automation & Scaling Systems

Identify opportunities to streamline acquisition processes through automation and internal toolsCreate SOPs, playbooks, and experiment pipelines for scaling campaigns efficiently

Challenges You’ll Tackle

Scale existing campaigns to 3x+ budget while maintaining CAC/ROAS goalsContribute to growing the user base from 30M to 100M users in the next 12 monthsExecute 0-to-1 testing in new channelsImprove conversion through landing page testing and funnel iterationOwn both creative input and analytical feedback loops

Your Qualifications

Hard Skills

Must-Haves

4–10+ years in performance marketing or user acquisitionProven track record managing $500K to $1M+/month in paid media spendFull ownership of campaign execution, results, and optimizationExperience with Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, ASA, or native platformsAnalytical fluency: GA4, Voluum, tracking setups, dashboardsStrong creative instincts: can write briefs, analyze hooks, and iterate fastExperience optimizing landing pages and funnel conversionComfortable with NSFW content and running campaigns on adult networks

Nice‑to‑Haves

Past exposure to subscription models and CAC/LTV frameworksFamiliarity with DSPs and programmatic environmentsExperience in sensitive or regulated verticals (e.g. dating, femtech, telehealth)Track record of scaling UA for mobile apps

Soft Skills

🗣 Strong communication & collaborative skills (perfectly fluent in English)

🧢 Goal-oriented, ownership and commitment

⚡️ Doer mindset - we are moving fast and need people who can balance execution, planning, and strategy

🎯 Obsessive about speed, performance and iteration

🧢 Humble - willing to learn, open to feedback

🍭 #NSFW - Comfortable building products based on uncensored models and content

Why EverAI?

📈 Exponential Growth: From 30M+ users in 18 months, to 100M next — and 500M beyond

🚀 Track Record of Category-Creating Innovation: We consistently launch world-first AI applications — setting the pace, not following it

🌍 Global Impact: Top-tier user growth, real-world adoption, and cultural relevance

🧠 Proven Leadership: A senior team that’s launched, scaled, and exited & IPO’d multiple scale ups — now fully focused on reshaping AI companionship

👥 Elite Remote Team: 100% remote and built to win — world-class talent from Tier 1 tech companies, with a culture of ownership, velocity, and radical creativity

🛡️ Ethical Core: Our AI ecosystem is governed by EverGuard, our proprietary AI moderation technology, ensuring responsible development at scale

What We Offer

✍️ We prefer a B2B contract but we can be flexible, as long as you’re in it for the long haul

📍 Full-remote (you work from the place that suits you best)

🏝️ 4 weeks PTO

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Annual gathering to get to know each other better

💆‍♀️ Wellbeing budget up to 200$

📚 Learning budget

💻 Company laptop

⚡️ GPT-4, Mistral and Hugging Face Pro plan

🎯 Top Tier Talent Is Our Multiplier

We’re a fully remote group of A-players from Tier 1 tech, led by an exec team who’ve launched, scaled, and exited multiple companies. We move fast, and care deeply about what we build — and who we build it with.

We’re looking for exceptional talent ready to ship & distribute world-first AI products at scale, fast, and co-create with us this category-defining business.

If that’s you — reach out and apply!

Compensation Range: €72K - €100K

description.text:
Description Du Poste

Overview :

On ne cherche pas un simple media buyer junior – on cherche le bras droit d'un des meilleurs talents Growth d'Europe. Quelqu’un capable de gérer et analyser des campagnes Meta Ads, de manipuler les données (exports, BP, P&L) avec précision, tout en étant le bras droit opérationnel du Head of Growth. On cherche un profil analytique, structuré, talentueux, qui a déjà démontré sa capacité à gérer plusieurs projets simultanément et à délivrer avec rigueur et impact.

Pourquoi rejoindre Reach :

REACH est un accélérateur e-commerce spécialisé dans l’hyper-croissance. On emmène les marques de 1M€ à 30M€+ de chiffre d’affaires par an avec un modèle 100% à la performance.

Après 8 ans d’expérience aux États-Unis et 50 millions d’euros dépensés en publicités, on a développé un playbook unique pour scaler des marques DTC.

Quelques résultats récents :

 De 100K€ à 1.9M€ par mois en 90 jours  De 10K€ à 800K€ par mois en 9 mois  De 200K€ à 600K€ en 6 mois 

Pourquoi on a besoin de toi :

REACH se développe rapidement et le volume de projets stratégiques augmente fortement (CRO, CRM, BFCM, nouveaux lancements). On cherche un Analyste Acquisition & Growth capable de soutenir le Head of Growth sur deux axes :

 Exécution & analyse paid media (Meta Ads, reporting, BP/P&L).  Organisation & suivi opérationnel (rétro-planning, coordination inter-équipes, relances clients). 

Tu travailleras en direct avec Jordan, notre Head of Growth, qui a plus de 7 ans d'expérience en e-commerce et qui est responsable des performances exceptionnelles sur toutes les marques du portefeuille. C’est l’opportunité d’être au cœur de la stratégie growth et de contribuer à la réussite des marques DTC les plus ambitieuses.

Tes missions :

 Exécuter et optimiser des campagnes Meta Ads (mises en place des campagnes, budgets, audiences, reporting).  Sortir, analyser et exploiter des exports Business Manager (CPA, ROAS, LTV, MER).  Faciliter la construction des BP & P&L marketing pour le compte du Head of Growth.  Prendre ownership absolu des rétro-plannings pour les projets (CRO, CRM, campagnes spéciales).  Sourcer, booker, et coordonner nos agences partenaires (CRO, CRM, etc.) et suivre leurs livrables.  Récupérer et intégrer les inputs clients (P&L, assets, informations clés) dans le temps impartis.  Assurer la coordination avec les pôles internes (CRM, data, ops, créa) pour livrer à temps. 

Profil recherché :

 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en acquisition digitale (Meta Ads) en agence ou chez l'annonceur.  Solide maîtrise de Google Sheets/Excel (index, pivot, lookups, modélisation simple).  Ultra-organisé, rigoureux, capable de suivre plusieurs projets en parallèle.  Excellente communication, français impeccable, anglais professionnel.  Connaissance des fondamentaux e-commerce / DTC (CAC, AOV, LTV, CR, MER). 

Rémunération :

 Fixe : 40 000 € – 50 000 € par an (selon profil).  Variable : 5 000 € – 10 000 € par an (indexé sur les résultats et la qualité d’exécution). 

La rémunération est ajustable en fonction du profil.

Ce rôle est pour toi si :

 Tu sais auditer un export Meta et proposer des actions concrètes.  Tu sais construire des BP à partir d'exports bruts et suivre les écarts réel vs prévision.  Tu es direct, transparent, no-bullshit.  Tu veux voir l’impact direct de ton travail sur la croissance des marques.  Tu incarnes la culture REACH : performance, transparence, et humain. 

Opportunités de développement :

REACH accélère fortement et ce rôle peut rapidement évoluer :

 Devenir Growth Strategist avec la gestion directe de comptes stratégiques. Manager à terme une équipe de 5+ personnes Prendre des responsabilités dans Reach Ventures (holding M&A) pour contribuer à le growth de nouvelles marques DTC (horizon 2026). 

Étapes de recrutement :

 Entretien vidéo via Workable pour avoir plus d’informations sur ton parcours et ton profil. Appel de 30 minutes avec Anne-Gaëlle (Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist) afin de valider les attentes.Appel de 1 heure avec Jordan (Head of Growth) afin de tester tes compétences techniques avec un cas pratique, et valider un fit humain. Entretien de 30 minutes avec Alessandro (CEO), pour discuter de ton background, tes ambitions et répondre à tes questions. Café avec Jordan (Head of Growth) et Alessandro (CEO) pour valider le fit final et cadrer la collaboration.

description.text:
Job Title: Healthcare Specialist – AI TrainerJob Type: Contract (Part-time or Full-time)Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer's team as a Healthcare Specialist – AI Trainer and help shape the next generation of healthcare AI. In this pivotal remote role, you'll leverage your healthcare expertise to improve the accuracy and compliance of AI-driven solutions by curating, evaluating, and refining real-world data and medical workflows.
Key Responsibilities:Source and curate authentic healthcare documents, including patient forms, administrative records, and clinical protocols.Design realistic, context-driven queries that mirror everyday healthcare scenarios for robust AI training.Critically review AI-generated outputs to ensure compliance with healthcare standards, accuracy, and proper use of medical terminology.Deliver clear, actionable feedback to data science teams to continually enhance model performance.Collaborate cross-functionally to align AI solutions with evolving healthcare documentation and regulatory requirements.Maintain thorough documentation of review processes and insights to support transparency and quality assurance.Champion best practices for data privacy and security in handling confidential patient and institutional information.
Required Skills and Qualifications:Minimum 3 years’ professional experience in healthcare administration, clinical roles, or health information management.Advanced written and verbal communication skills, with a passion for clarity and accuracy.Demonstrated knowledge of healthcare workflows, processes, and documentation standards.Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational abilities.Proven ability to provide constructive, structured feedback in a fast-paced, remote work environment.Awareness of healthcare compliance, privacy, and regulatory requirements.Tech-savvy mindset and adaptability to evolving AI tools and platforms.
Preferred Qualifications:Experience collaborating with AI, machine learning, or digital health technology projects.Certification in Health Information Management (RHIA, RHIT) or equivalent credentials.Exposure to healthcare data privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR).

description.text:
The Company
TaskHuman is organizing the world’s human expertise, making coaching in 1000+ skills instantly accessible to you in a multitude of forms. Whether you connect live with a specialist on a 1:1 video call, message directly in-app, join a group session, or learn via coach-generated content, our value of human connection is the foundation of every interaction at TaskHuman.
The Opportunity
We’re looking for a hands-on, technically fluent Growth Marketer to drive rapid experimentation and growth loop execution to scale our acquisition and engagement programs. You will be instrumental in executing our growth strategy launching high-impact growth initiatives with speed and autonomy.This is a role for someone who loves to ship, test, and refine. In our B2B2C environment, your user activation and engagement work directly drives client success, making every conversion and retention win doubly important.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and optimize lifecycle-based growth programs across user onboarding, activation, re-engagement, and retention.Launch and scale growth loops and automated campaigns, using event-based triggers and conditional logic.Own the execution and iteration of experiment-driven campaigns, partnering with Product, Analytics and Data Science to rapidly test hypotheses and analyze funnel performance.Partner closely with BI/Analytics team to define success metrics, interpret campaign performance data, and translate insights into actionable optimizations for future campaigns.Operate and manage the marketing tech stack including Iterable, to support fast, self-serve execution across journeys and nudges.Collaborate with engineering and data teams to integrate rich custom event payloads into user workflows, enabling highly personalized, metadata-driven messaging experiences.Maintain execution velocity by owning backlog delivery of growth marketing experiments, ensuring rapid test cycles and continuous campaign optimization.Partner with internal teams including Product, Design, Customer Success, and Coaching Experiences to ensure aligned messaging, go-to-market enablement, and thematic consistency across touchpoints.Guide the structure and QA of AI-generated content for use in dynamic emails and in-product experiences.
Requirements:
3-6+ years experience in growth marketing, lifecycle marketing, or CRM/automation roles, preferably in a startup or fast-paced growth environment.Strong technical fluency with tools and systems like Iterable (or Braze), and event-driven trigger frameworks.Deep experience executing event-based lifecycle automations using custom user properties, branching logic, and dynamic content blocks.Familiarity with working inside JSON-based data structures for dynamic & personalized messaging.Track record of executing growth experiments and interpreting performance through funnel, cohort, and lifecycle metrics.Highly autonomous and self-directed, able to move quickly and make tradeoffs in ambiguous or fast-changing environments.Strong communicator and collaborator across technical and non-technical teams.Experience and appetite for working in a fast-paced technology and innovation environment are highly preferred.Genuine interest in the mission of TaskHuman and being a part of something bigger than any one person or business group.Experience operating in a B2C, B2B2C, or marketplace product environment
TaskHuman provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

description.text:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesOwn. Take full ownership of your product’s marketing strategy. You’ll lead user acquisition end-to-end, from setting goals to launching campaigns and scaling what works to maximize performance.Create. Generate new ad concepts and out-of-the-box growth-hacking ideas, formulate testable hypotheses, coordinate implementation across channels like Google, Meta, and TikTok, and provide sharp feedback to continuously raise the bar.Analyze. Monitor performance through BI dashboards and campaign data. Ensure acquisition efforts achieve target KPIs, and turn insights into bold, data-driven decisions that fuel growth.Collaborate. Work closely with the product team to understand user motivations and help shape monetization and growth strategies that align with user behavior and long-term success.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

description.text:
AutoStore™ holds a simple yet powerful vision: to store and move things for everyone, everywhere. Founded in Norway, we've grown into a global technology company. AutoStore uses advanced software to automate and orchestrate order fulfillment. Our goal is to ensure orders arrive faster than ever, with minimal environmental impact. That’s how we help brands exceed customer expectations.

We have more than 1600 systems in nearly 60 countries, and we grow continuously as a community of employees, partners, customers, suppliers, and connected technologies. Automation should make life easier, and by listening carefully to our community, we innovate to meet the industry’s most complex needs. With AutoStore™, brands gain speed, efficiency, and improved workplaces. And much more floor space.

AutoStore – moving things forward.

The Role:

The Regional Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for executing B2B and Account Based Marketing (ABM) strategies tailored to the EMEA region. In this role you will work closely with the global performance marketing team, local & global sales, and local stakeholders to execute targeted campaigns, optimize digital channels, and drive high-value engagement with key accounts.

This role is focused on the EMEA region, and applicants must be fluent in English as well as one of the following: German, French, Italian, or Spanish. Germany fluency is preferred. This employee can reside in the UK, France, Spain, Italy, Germany, Austria, Norway, or Poland. Residence in Germany or Austria is preferred.

Key Tasks and Responsibilities:

Understand global marketing/GTM strategy and adapt to fit the norms of the EMEA region. Execute across ABM, Social, Email, and Content campaigns.Develop multi-channel B2B campaigns across disciplines. Optimize digital spend for lead generation, pipeline acceleration, and account engagement.Track campaign performance and develop insight into what is working and what isn’t. Make changes as necessary to optimize programs.Create and optimize regional landing pages in a way that resonates with target groups.Work closely with local sales teams to ensure marketing and sales efforts are in concert.Provide regular reporting and insights to regional leadership and the global digital marketing team.


Key Qualifications:

3–5+ years in B2B digital marketingExpertise in running digital marketing campaigns such as paid media, social, email, content, and abm campaigns.Proficiency in LinkedIn Ads, Google Ads, marketing automation platforms (HubSpot), CRM (Salesforce), and ABM platforms (6sense).Data-driven and strategic mindset, experienced in aligning marketing with salesFluent in English as well as one of the following: German, French, Italian, or Spanish. Germany fluency is preferred.Bachelors Degree in Marketing or a related field


We Offer:

A creative, safe, and solid workplace in a business experiencing tremendous growth – Norway's first unicorn company listed on the Oslo Stock ExchangeA company culture where we recognize and applaud everyone's contributions in making decisionsCompetitive compensation and benefits


Show your interest in the position by registering your CV and application as soon as possible. Certificates and diplomas are attached to the application. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

Application deadline: May 15th 2025 - applications are processed on an ongoing basis

jobs.description:
AutoStore™ holds a simple yet powerful vision: to store and move things for everyone, everywhere. Founded in Norway, we've grown into a global technology company. AutoStore uses advanced software to automate and orchestrate order fulfillment. Our goal is to ensure orders arrive faster than ever, with minimal environmental impact. That’s how we help brands exceed customer expectations.

We have more than 1600 systems in nearly 60 countries, and we grow continuously as a community of employees, partners, customers, suppliers, and connected technologies. Automation should make life easier, and by listening carefully to our community, we innovate to meet the industry’s most complex needs. With AutoStore™, brands gain speed, efficiency, and improved workplaces. And much more floor space.

AutoStore – moving things forward.

The Role:

The Regional Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for executing B2B and Account Based Marketing (ABM) strategies tailored to the EMEA region.
