description.text:
L'entreprise

ESCP Business School Paris est l'école de commerce de renommée mondiale, fondée en 1819, qui forme les leaders responsables de demain. Ancrée au cœur de Paris, elle propose une pédagogie innovante et multiculturelle, s’appuyant sur un réseau de six campus européens. Reconnue pour l’excellence de ses programmes en management, elle favorise l’engagement, l’ouverture internationale et l’accompagnement personnalisé des talents tout au long de leur parcours.

Description Du Poste

Lancée en 2024 par ESCP Business School, ESCP Extension School est une structure de formation innovante et inclusive. Sa mission : accompagner les actifs – en poste, en mobilité ou en reconversion – dans leur montée en compétences, face aux grandes transformations du monde professionnel.

ESCP Extension incarne l’engagement d’ESCP Business School à démocratiser l’accès à une formation de haut niveau et à répondre aux enjeux de société, par une pédagogie résolument tournée vers l’action et l’impact.

Sous La Responsabilité De La Direction De L’Extension School, Vous Serez Chargé De Définir, Mettre En Œuvre Et Piloter La Stratégie Marketing Et Communication Afin De Renforcer La Visibilité Et L’attractivité De L’Extension School En France Et à L’international. Vos Principales Missions S'articuleront Autour De Différents Axes

Stratégie de marque et positionnement

Définir et piloter la stratégie de marque en cohérence avec les ambitions nationales et internationales de l’Extension School et de l’ESCP.Garantir la cohérence de l’identité visuelle, du ton éditorial et de la charte graphique sur l’ensemble des supports.

Communication institutionnelle et promotion

Concevoir, mettre en œuvre et coordonner des campagnes de communication (print, digital, médias).Valoriser l’Extension School auprès des cibles internes (participants, personnel, professeurs) et externes (candidats, partenaires, entreprises).Rédiger et superviser des contenus variés : communiqués de presse, newsletters, brochures, rapports annuels…Développer de nouveaux outils de communication, notamment digitaux.

Stratégie marketing

Définir et piloter la stratégie marketing en lien avec les objectifs de développement.Assurer une veille concurrentielle et sectorielle régulière.Développer, avec l’équipe commerciale, des stratégies d’acquisition et de fidélisation (SEO/SEA, emailing, social media, CRM, salons…).Optimiser la visibilité et l’e-réputation de l’école sur les plateformes digitales et éducatives.Produire et superviser les supports marketing (flyers, bannières, visuels, vidéos, etc.).Garantir la mise à jour et l’animation du site web.Suivre et analyser les indicateurs de performance (KPI, ROI, taux de conversion, trafic web).Gérer la relation avec les agences externes.

 Événementiel et relations presse

Organiser et promouvoir les événements clés : journées portes ouvertes, forums, conférences, cérémonies, masterclass…Développer et entretenir des relations avec les médias, agences et prestataires.

Coordination et management

Encadrer à terme une équipe (chargé(e) de communication, chargé(e) de marketing).Collaborer étroitement avec l’équipe Brand & Communication d’ESCP, ainsi qu’avec les directions programmes, admissions, alumni, fondation, relations entreprises et internationales.

Pilotage budgétaire

Élaborer et suivre le budget marketing et communication.Optimiser les investissements et assurer un reporting régulier.

Promotion de l’Extension School

Contribuer activement à la promotion des programmes de l’Extension School à travers des actions collectives et partenariales.

Profil recherché

Titulaire d’une formation supérieure en marketing, communication, digital ou école de commerce, vous justifiez de 5 à 8 ans d’expérience en marketing et communication, idéalement dans un contexte éducatif, institutionnel ou international.

Vous possédez d’excellentes qualités rédactionnelles et un sens affirmé de la synthèse.

Vous maîtrisez les principaux leviers du marketing digital (SEO/SEA, CRM, analytics, réseaux sociaux) et savez les mobiliser pour accroître visibilité et performance.

Votre parcours témoigne de solides compétences en gestion de projets complexes, avec une capacité à travailler en transversalité et à coordonner ou encadrer une équipe.

Créatif et force de proposition, vous alliez sens de l’innovation et rigueur budgétaire afin de concevoir et déployer des actions à la fois pertinentes et efficaces.

description.text:
About MarbleMarble is a climate tech venture studio. We partner with scientists, engineers, and operators to create companies solving hard climate problems in the world's largest industries. Our first 10 companies are building transformative products across energy, industry, agriculture, and climate resilience. 100% have been successful in raising follow-on to date. We are looking to partner with exceptional individuals to create our next venture.
About The RoleWe are hiring a Junior Marketing Analyst (apprentice) to join the Marble team and support our recruitment and marketing activities.
You will work directly with senior team members, Partners, and brilliant founders on a mission to turn the tide on the climate crisis. This role offers a unique opportunity to bridge the gap between developing cutting-edge climate technologies and effectively communicating their impact to our target audiences.
You will also gain exposure to the journey of building startups, including thesis development, venture building, and founder support.
Location: Paris.Language: English fluency, French fluency is preferred.Contract Type: Apprenticeship (Contrat d’Apprentissage). Please keep in mind that candidates eligible for apprenticeship will be prioritised.Duration: 12 months for apprenticeshipStart date: mid-September 2025
Responsibilities
The Junior Marketing Analyst internship is focused on three main pillars:Video Production & Content Creation: You'll create marketing visuals using Canva (Figma and Adobe PS experience is a plus), repurpose long-form video content into high-impact, viral-ready video content, with strong expertise in editing tools such as DaVinci Resolve or After Effects. You'll support us in maintaining our digital asset library (photos, videos, templates, brand materials) and will monitor news in relevant sectors for content opportunities.Ad Campaigns and Analytics: You will support the launch and optimisation of targeted paid marketing campaigns across Google Ads, LinkedIn, and X. You'll maximise deliverability through backend optimisation on our website by implementing effective SEO strategies. You'll analyse marketing performance data and maintain comprehensive KPI dashboards to track campaign effectiveness and generate actionable insights.Inbound and Outbound Talent Acquisition: You will support us in optimising Marble's talent pipeline by ensuring seamless coordination between our outbound marketing efforts and CRM systems while maintaining tracking metrics and building targeted lists to strengthen our reach. Your focus would be on enhancing Marble’s visibility by optimising job postings across platforms, establishing presence in qualified forums and communities (Slack channels, LinkedIn groups), and benchmarking lead management tools.
RequirementsThe Junior Marketing Analyst position is an exciting opportunity for a tech-savvy, creative individual passionate about climate tech and startup ecosystems:
Currently enrolled in a degree or certification program eligible for an apprenticeship (Contrat d’Apprentissage)Demonstrated experience in video editing (DaVinci Resolve, After Effects, or equivalent), with a strong portfolio of high-quality visual content. Proficiency in graphic design tools such as Canva, with Figma and Adobe Photoshop considered strong advantages.Solid understanding of paid media platforms, including Google Ads, LinkedIn, and X, with experience in campaign setup, targeting, and optimisation.Strong visual and creative sense, with proven ability to maintain brand coherence across all content formats.Comfortable with photography and videography; hands-on experience highly valued.You thrive in fast-paced environments (startups, agencies, research labs, NGOs, etc.) where you've demonstrated quick adoption of new tools and processes, adapting to new platforms and workflows.You are fluent in English (French is a plus).
Your ability to learn on the job is more important than ticking every single box. However, we would especially love to hear from you if this sounds like you:
You are passionate about climate tech, startups, and venture capital (VC). You are familiar with some climate deeptech startups.You know what it takes to market things well and can execute end‑to‑end: from ideation to design, ads, and launch.You move quickly and proactively. You're quick to recognise when things aren't on track and seamlessly transition into problem-solving mode.You are highly organised, able to juggle competing priorities.You have impeccable attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication. When it comes to representing Marble, your communications, both written and spoken, are top-notch.You can quickly understand and transform complex technical concepts into engaging content forms. You have worked with tools like Slack, Notion, Canva, Figma, CapCut, Descript, etc.You are a people person. You are approachable, empathetic, and generous, with a high level of emotional intelligence. People feel energised around you.
What We OfferA monthly compensation aligned with French legal standardsOffice located at Station F in Paris. Flexible remote days are possible1 week of vacationMeal vouchers (Swile), 50% transport refundExposure to our network of top founders, investors, and advisorsWorking with the brightest, most driven individuals you’ll meetRapid learning curve and personal development
Application Form
You will be asked for:Your LinkedIn profile + a CV (please make sure to include your portfolio within the CV)A few short questions about you (this role does not require a PhD-level expertise; your evaluation as a candidate will be dependent on your portfolio)

We believe that a diverse group of minds is key to solving the climate crisis. We strongly encourage women and people of colour to apply. Studies have shown that under-represented candidates are less likely to apply for an opportunity unless they feel they meet every single qualification. We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive and mission-driven company. If you’re excited about Marble but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with what you read on our website, we encourage you to apply anyway!

description.text:
RESPONSABLE E-COMMERCE SENIOR

CDD H/F

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Reconnue comme la première entreprise de cosmétiques fondée au Japon, et classée au 5ème rang mondial des groupes de beauté, Shiseido incarne l’excellence absolue dans le domaine des soins, du maquillage et des parfums. La réputation de l’entreprise, fondée en 1872, s’appuie sur plus de 150 ans de recherche et d’innovation au service de la Beauté.

Les marques du Groupe sont aujourd’hui distribuées dans plus de 120 pays et régions. Shiseido emploie environ 36 000 collaborateurs de près de 100 nationalités et a généré un chiffre d’affaires de 6,7 milliards d’euros en 2024.

Guidés par la mission de l’entreprise « Beauty Innovations for a Better World », les collaborateurs de Shiseido sont animés par des valeurs qui illustrent son héritage unique : « People First », « Diversity », « Art & Science », « Japanese », « Uncompromising Quality » et « Omotenashi ».

Shiseido EMEA, basé à Paris, couvre les activités mondiales des marques de parfum Issey Miyake, Narciso Rodriguez, Zadig&Voltaire, Max Mara, Shiseido Fragrances et Serge Lutens ; des marques de soin Ulé et Gallinée ; ainsi que les activités et la distribution régionales de plusieurs marques du Groupe : Clé de Peau Beauté, Drunk Elephant, NARS, Shiseido Ginza Tokyo et Tory Burch. La région compte également un centre d’innovation européen (EIC) dédié à la recherche et au développement ainsi que 2 sites de production basés dans le Loiret.

ORGANISATION

Reporte au Directeur eBusiness EMEA.

Management d’une équipe de 4 personnes

Localisation : Paris 75008 puis Neuilly Sur Seine à partir de Janvier 2026

ROLE ET RESPONSABILITES

En tant que Responsable Senior eCommerce, dans le cadre d'un remplacement de congé maternité, vous serez en charge de la gestion de la marque Clé de Peau Beauté, ainsi que de Shiseido, Serge Lutens et de notre site interne. Vous aurez un rôle essentiel dans le développement et la mise en œuvre de stratégies eCommerce efficaces pour maximiser la visibilité et les ventes en ligne de nos marques.

Responsabilités

Définir les stratégies eCommerce pour l’ensemble des marques de son portefeuille en collaboration avec les équipes de Brand Holding et les parties prenantes clés (Performance, Supply, Logistique, Digital IT, Media, etc.).Pilotage de CPB en direct avec une agenceAnalyse de la performance et pilotage du P&L: Maîtrise des indicateurs clés de performance (KPI), optimisation du chiffre d’affaires et de la rentabilité.Co-construire un plan d'animation Accompagner les équipes eCommerce locales dans le pilotage de leur stratégie eCommerce Maîtrise des leviers d’acquisition et de conversion: Expertise en SEO, SEA, social ads, affiliation et campagnes CRM pour attirer et engager les clients.Vision orientée expérience utilisateur (UX): Capacité à optimiser le parcours client et à recommander des actions pour améliorer la satisfaction et la fidélisation.Identifier les leviers de croissance pour les différentes marques tout en veillant à maintenir un équilibre entre les ambitions commerciales et l'image de marqueRapport sur la performance (mensuel, ponctuel, etc.)Responsable de l'E-Merchandising, vous veillerez à ce que les nouveaux lancements soient effectués dans les délais, tout en garantissant la qualité des sites web, leur performance et la mise en place de nouvelles fonctionnalités (filtres / upsell / Cross sell / search ...)Gestion de divers projets transversaux depuis l'élaboration du business case jusqu'à la mise en œuvre opérationnelle (en collaboration avec les équipes finance / légale / logistique ...)Moteur sur l'innovation (avec une approche test and learn)

QUALIFICATION REQUISE

5 à 7 ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire, avec une expertise avérée dans le secteur des cosmétiques ou du luxe.Excellentes compétences en gestion de projet, capacité à gérer plusieurs marques en même temps.Maîtrise des leviers d’acquisition et leur orchestration pour augmenter le trafic et les conversions.Leadership et management d’équipe : Encadrer, motiver et faire monter en compétence des équipes pluridisciplinaires.Optimisation de l’expérience utilisateur (UX/UI) Proposer des parcours clients fluides et innovants, intégrer les bonnes pratiques UX/UI.Maîtrise des outils e-commerce et analytics: maitrise de Shopify et Salesforce souhaitable, outils de tracking, analytics et gestion de contenu.Excellentes compétences en communication et coordination transversale pour collaborer efficacement avec les équipes internes (marketing, IT, supply, service client) et les partenaires externes.Veille stratégique et culture de l’innovation digitale; Rester à l’affût des tendances, challenger les méthodes et initier de nouveaux projets.Autonomie, rigueur, proactivité Maîtrise de l’anglais indispensable 

ENGLISH BELOW

eCommerce Manager Senior CDD

Reporting to the EMEA eBusiness Director.

Management of 4 people

Role And Responsibilities

As a Senior eCommerce Manager, you will be directly responsible for managing the Clé de Peau Beauté brand as well as Shiseido, Serge Lutens and our Internal Website. You will play a key role in developing and executing effective eCommerce strategies to maximize the visibility and online sales of our brands.

Key Responsibilities

Brand Management: ensure direct management of the CPB brand and oversee eCommerce strategies for three other brands, in collaboration with Brand Holding teams and key stakeholders (Supply and logistic teams, Digital IT, Media …) Monitor and adapt EMEA e-commerce strategy, assess opportunities by providing competitive analysis, strategies and tactics. Identify opportunities for growth and profit while ensuring the right balance between commercial ambitions and brand image. Be responsible of the DTC P&L and the sales targets definition and follow-up Co-construct an animation plan with the markets, to ensure business KPIs and website performance Proactively support and govern local E-commerce / Digital teams on their strategy Report on performance (monthly, ad-hoc, etc.) Analyze sales and performance data to identify opportunities for improvement and growth for each channels: SEO, CRM, SEA, … Maintain stakeholder relationships with the EMEA & Global brand teams as well as with other E-Business team members Responsible of E-Merchandiser to ensure new launches are done on a timely manner and the quality of the websites and ensure website performance and new features implementation Lead various transverse projects with Third parties or internal stakeholders (as Supply chain, Finance, Purchasing teams, etc.) and ensure follow-up from business case to operational implementation Be proactive to lead and support innovation and test & learn projects

Required Qualifications

Experience: Minimum 5-7 years’ experience in a similar role with proven expertise in the cosmetics or luxury sector.Skills: Excellent project management and leadership skills, ability to manage multiple brands simultaneously.Knowledge: Strong understanding of eCommerce tools, digital platforms, and market trends. Confidence developing and overseeing eCommerce-focused digital marketing strategies. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders (team work, sense of hearing, etc.) Experience with Salesforce suite Passionate about digital and e-Business and have strong general knowledge of web and mobile best practices Autonomy, rigor, proactivity and ability to partner cross functionnaly to drive results) Languages: Fluent in English (mandatory)

jobs.description:
RESPONSABLE E-COMMERCE SENIOR

CDD H/F

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Reconnue comme la première entreprise de cosmétiques fondée au Japon, et classée au 5ème rang mondial des groupes de beauté, Shiseido incarne l’excellence absolue dans le domaine des soins, du maquillage et des parfums. La réputation de l’entreprise, fondée en 1872, s’appuie sur plus de 150 ans de recherche et d’innovation au service de la Beauté.

Les marques du Groupe sont aujourd’hui distribuées dans plus de 120 pays et régions. Shiseido emploie environ 36 000 collaborateurs de près de 100 nationalités et a généré un chiffre d’affaires de 6,7 milliards d’euros en 2024.

Guidés par la mission de l’entreprise « Beauty Innovations for a Better World », les collaborateurs de Shiseido sont animés par des valeurs qui illustrent son héritage unique : « People First », « Diversity », « Art & Science », « Japanese », « Uncompromising Quality » et « Omotenashi ».

Shiseido EMEA, basé à Paris, couvre les activités mondiales des marques de parfum Issey Miyake, Narciso Rodriguez, Zadig&Voltaire, Max Mara, Shiseido Fragrances et Serge Lutens ; des marques de soin Ulé et Gallinée ; ainsi que les activités et la distribution régionales de plusieurs marques du Groupe : Clé de Peau Beauté, Drunk Elephant, NARS, Shiseido Ginza Tokyo et Tory Burch. La région compte également un centre d’innovation européen (EIC) dédié à la recherche et au développement ainsi que 2 sites de production basés dans le Loiret.

ORGANISATION

Reporte au Directeur eBusiness EMEA.

Management d’une équipe de 4 personnes

Localisation : Paris 75008 puis Neuilly Sur Seine à partir de Janvier 2026

ROLE ET RESPONSABILITES

En tant que Responsable Senior eCommerce, dans le cadre d'un remplacement de congé maternité, vous serez en charge de la gestion de la marque Clé de Peau Beauté, ainsi que de Shiseido, Serge Lutens et de notre site interne. Vous aurez un rôle essentiel dans le développement et la mise en œuvre de stratégies eCommerce efficaces pour maximiser la visibilité et les ventes en ligne de nos marques.

Responsabilités

Définir les stratégies eCommerce pour l’ensemble des marques de son portefeuille en collaboration avec les équipes de Brand Holding et les parties prenantes clés (Performance, Supply, Logistique, Digital IT, Media, etc.).Pilotage de CPB en direct avec une agenceAnalyse de la performance et pilotage du P&L: Maîtrise des indicateurs clés de performance (KPI), optimisation du chiffre d’affaires et de la rentabilité.Co-construire un plan d'animation Accompagner les équipes eCommerce locales dans le pilotage de leur stratégie eCommerce Maîtrise des leviers d’acquisition et de conversion: Expertise en SEO, SEA, social ads, affiliation et campagnes CRM pour attirer et engager les clients.Vision orientée expérience utilisateur (UX): Capacité à optimiser le parcours client et à recommander des actions pour améliorer la satisfaction et la fidélisation.Identifier les leviers de croissance pour les différentes marques tout en veillant à maintenir un équilibre entre les ambitions commerciales et l'image de marqueRapport sur la performance (mensuel, ponctuel, etc.)Responsable de l'E-Merchandising, vous veillerez à ce que les nouveaux lancements soient effectués dans les délais, tout en garantissant la qualité des sites web, leur performance et la mise en place de nouvelles fonctionnalités (filtres / upsell / Cross sell / search ...)Gestion de divers projets transversaux depuis l'élaboration du business case jusqu'à la mise en œuvre opérationnelle (en collaboration avec les équipes finance / légale / logistique ...)Moteur sur l'innovation (avec une approche test and learn)

QUALIFICATION REQUISE

5 à 7 ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire, avec une expertise avérée dans le secteur des cosmétiques ou du luxe.Excellentes compétences en gestion de projet, capacité à gérer plusieurs marques en même temps.Maîtrise des leviers d’acquisition et leur orchestration pour augmenter le trafic et les conversions.Leadership et management d’équipe : Encadrer, motiver et faire monter en compétence des équipes pluridisciplinaires.Optimisation de l’expérience utilisateur (UX/UI) Proposer des parcours clients fluides et innovants, intégrer les bonnes pratiques UX/UI.Maîtrise des outils e-commerce et analytics: maitrise de Shopify et Salesforce souhaitable, outils de tracking, analytics et gestion de contenu.Excellentes compétences en communication et coordination transversale pour collaborer efficacement avec les équipes internes (marketing, IT, supply, service client) et les partenaires externes.Veille stratégique et culture de l’innovation digitale; Rester à l’affût des tendances, challenger les méthodes et initier de nouveaux projets.Autonomie, rigueur, proactivité Maîtrise de l’anglais indispensable 

ENGLISH BELOW

eCommerce Manager Senior CDD

Reporting to the EMEA eBusiness Director.

Management of 4 people

Role And Responsibilities

As a Senior eCommerce Manager, you will be directly responsible for managing the Clé de Peau Beauté brand as well as Shiseido, Serge Lutens and our Internal Website. You will play a key role in developing and executing effective eCommerce strategies to maximize the visibility and online sales of our brands.

Key Responsibilities

Brand Management: ensure direct management of the CPB brand and oversee eCommerce strategies for three other brands, in collaboration with Brand Holding teams and key stakeholders (Supply and logistic teams, Digital IT, Media …) Monitor and adapt EMEA e-commerce strategy, assess opportunities by providing competitive analysis, strategies and tactics. Identify opportunities for growth and profit while ensuring the right balance between commercial ambitions and brand image. Be responsible of the DTC P&L and the sales targets definition and follow-up Co-construct an animation plan with the markets, to ensure business KPIs and website performance Proactively support and govern local E-commerce / Digital teams on their strategy Report on performance (monthly, ad-hoc, etc.) Analyze sales and performance data to identify opportunities for improvement and growth for each channels: SEO, CRM, SEA, … Maintain stakeholder relationships with the EMEA & Global brand teams as well as with other E-Business team members Responsible of E-Merchandiser to ensure new launches are done on a timely manner and the quality of the websites and ensure website performance and new features implementation Lead various transverse projects with Third parties or internal stakeholders (as Supply chain, Finance, Purchasing teams, etc.) and ensure follow-up from business case to operational implementation Be proactive to lead and support innovation and test & learn projects

Required Qualifications

Experience: Minimum 5-7 years’ experience in a similar role with proven expertise in the cosmetics or luxury sector.Skills: Excellent project management and leadership skills, ability to manage multiple brands simultaneously.Knowledge: Strong understanding of eCommerce tools, digital platforms, and market trends. Confidence developing and overseeing eCommerce-focused digital marketing strategies. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders (team work, sense of hearing, etc.) Experience with Salesforce suite Passionate about digital and e-Business and have strong general knowledge of web and mobile best practices Autonomy, rigor, proactivity and ability to partner cross functionnaly to drive results) Languages: Fluent in English (mandatory)

description.text:
About Remote

Remote is solving modern organizations’ biggest challenge – navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.

We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.

If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!

What This Job Can Offer You

As a Knowledge Management Specialist within the Customer Experience (CX) Operations team, you will take ownership of maintaining and evolving critical areas of the Remote knowledge base. You will play a pivotal role in improving the accuracy, accessibility, and strategic value of knowledge content that enables Remote’s teams to deliver exceptional support and compliant guidance at scale. While contributing to operational excellence today, you’ll also help shape the future of our knowledge systems by identifying opportunities for improvement, driving updates in collaboration with subject matter experts, and leveraging data to maximise impact.

You’ll work closely with product, legal, compliance, and customer-facing teams to ensure Remote’s knowledge remains a reliable, scalable source of truth across a globally distributed workforce.

What you bring

Experience: Strong operational background with experience in knowledge management, content strategy, or technical writing. Proven ability to manage structured content in a fast-paced environment.Initiative & Impact: Demonstrated ability to proactively identify automation opportunities, drive process improvements, and lead projects that align operations with product roadmaps and company values.Systems Knowledge: Familiarity with content management systems, AI-enabled knowledge tools, and CRM platforms.Collaboration Skills: Strong cross-functional collaboration experience, particularly working with Legal, Product, Ops, or Customer Support teams.Content Quality & Maintenance: Ability to ensure knowledge assets are well-written, up-to-date, and aligned with business and regulatory needs.Analytical Thinking: Comfort using data and metrics to evaluate knowledge effectiveness and identify content gaps.Initiative & Autonomy: Demonstrated ability to independently own domains and drive initiatives from planning to execution with minimal oversight.Adaptability: Thrive in dynamic, fast-changing environments where priorities shift regularly.Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication in English; ability to simplify complex ideas for broad audiences.It's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus


Key Responsibilities

Knowledge Ownership: Manage and maintain assigned knowledge domains, including product guides, process documentation, and compliance-focused content.Content Creation & Maintenance: Create, revise, and optimise knowledge articles to ensure clarity, accuracy, and accessibility for global users.SSoT Alignment: Ensure documentation is treated and maintained as a Single Source of Truth (SSoT), reducing reliance on tribal knowledge or outdated material.Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with Product, Legal, Ops, and Support teams to reflect feature changes, policy updates, and operational needs within the knowledge base.Data-Informed Improvements: Use analytics to monitor article performance, identify gaps, and optimise for usability and deflection.Content Processes: Help evolve templates, workflows, and SOPs to scale knowledge management practices across teams.Knowledge Integrity: Proactively monitor legal and product change logs and contribute to update cycles that keep content current and compliant.Project Contributions: Participate in mid-scale projects related to new product launches, regional expansions, or compliance updates.Mentorship & Support: Provide guidance to junior team members and act as a connector between content creators and consumers across the organisation.


Practicals

You'll report to: Senior Director Business OperationsTeam: CX OperationsLocation: For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritise applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify;Start date: As soon as possible


Remote Compensation Philosophy

Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $35,350 to $99,450. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Application process

Interview with recruiterInterview with future managerInterview with team members (no managers present)Bar Raiser Interview Prior employment verification check 


Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

description.text:
Paris Office

At EF Language Abroad, we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we've helped millions of students discover new places, embrace diverse cultures, and gain fresh perspectives.

We offer immersive short-term and long-term language courses and programs across different languages in the countries where they’re spoken. Together, our global staff help students from around the world develop the language skills they need to achieve their dreams.

Are you ready for a dynamic role in a truly international environment? Are you passionate about digital marketing and strongly goal-oriented?

As the Head of Marketing you will be at the heart of our mission to connect with more learners, working in a dynamic atmosphere while shaping our digital future.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Unleash your creativityAnalyze dataDesign targeted campaigns

The everyday working language in our Paris office is French, however, this role requires excellent command of the English language as well to communicate with Global Leaders and Stakeholders. Full fluency (speaking, reading, writing) in both languages is required. Please submit your CV in English. CVs in French will not be considered. 

Your key responsibilities will include: 

You will drive a high-performing marketing team and own the marketing strategy, balancing performance marketing, brand storytelling, and offline activation to drive demand and revenue growth.

Manage a team of 10+ marketers, fostering a culture of growth, creativity, performance, and data-driven decision-makingDevelop and execute innovative digital strategies to enhance brand awareness and engage our audience in new ways.Manage paid campaigns, SEO/SEM, email marketing, and social media to turn traffic into leads and followers into brand ambassadors.Work closely with product, sales, and global marketing teams to align your vision with our objectives.Use data to measure performance, refine strategies, and exceed expectations.Ensure our content and messaging resonate with the local audience while maintaining the brand’s global identity.Oversee marketing budgets, ensuring optimal allocation of resources.Collaborate with agencies, media, and influencers to expand our reach.Stay ahead of market trends, customer feedback, and competitor actions.Organize events, webinars, and sponsorships to bring the EF brand to life.Define and execute a full-funnel marketing strategy that combines performance marketing, brand building, and offline activations to drive business growth.Own the lead generation and customer acquisition strategy, ensuring an optimal marketing mix across paid digital, organic, brand, and partnerships.

What we are looking for: 

5-10 years of experience in marketing, both digital and offlineMinimum 5 years of experience leading a teamPassionate about marketing and cutting-edge concepts in digital marketingData-driven and results-oriented – you love both spreadsheets and creative ideasA natural leader, you are comfortable in a dynamic and collaborative environmentExperienced in creating engaging campaigns and generating leadsStrong understanding of the French digital marketProven ability to lead multi-channel marketing strategies (performance, content, CRM, social, offline, and brand activations).Strong analytical mindset, able to connect marketing activities to lead generation and revenue impact.Experience in high-growth, competitive industries (e.g., travel, education, consumer services).Deep understanding of the French media landscape, including digital, influencer marketing, and traditional media.Fully fluent in French, used daily in the officeFully Fluent in English, required for global meetings

What EF offers: 

Work in the heart of Paris Opportunities to travel internationallyDiscounts on EF programs for Staff and Staff Friends and FamilyFree use of EF Hello: a premium Language Learning AppTuition Reimbursement for continued EducationBe part of a mission-driven company that transforms lives through educationTeam events, kick-offs, and Holiday Parties

At EF Language Abroad we are dedicated to our mission of opening the world through education, harnessing the power of language learning to deepen the connection between people across the globe.

Ready to open the world through education? Apply now!

About EF Education First

Openness to the world and cultural understanding are key qualities for a successful journey. Since 1965, we have helped millions of learners travel, discover new cultures, and live unique experiences.

Our immersive educational programs—focused on languages, travel, cultural exchange, and academic learning—turn dreams into international opportunities.

By joining EF, you become part of a multicultural community active in over 50 countries, with hundreds of schools and offices worldwide. Our mission is to open the world through education. No matter your background or passions, we welcome you and hope you will share this vision with us.

EF is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, committed to inclusion and belonging, regardless of origin, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, or experience.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, with regional headquarters in Boston, London, São Paulo, Tokyo, Zurich, and more.

EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. All positions are subject to criminal background and/or reference checks, as applicable.

EF is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, committed to inclusion and belonging, regardless of origin, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, or experience.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, with regional headquarters in Boston, London, São Paulo, Tokyo, Zurich, and more.

EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. All positions are subject to criminal background and/or reference checks, as applicable.

description.text:
About Rimini Street, Inc.

Rimini Street, Inc. (Nasdaq: RMNI), a Russell 2000® Company, is a global provider of end-to-end enterprise software support and innovation solutions and the leading third-party support provider for Oracle, SAP and VMware software. The Company offers a comprehensive portfolio of unified solutions to run, manage, support, customize, configure, connect, protect, monitor, and optimize enterprise application, database, and technology software. The Company has signed thousands of contracts with Fortune Global 100, Fortune 500, midmarket, public sector and government organizations who selected Rimini Street as their trusted, proven mission-critical enterprise software solutions provider, achieving better operational outcomes and realizing billions of US dollars in savings used to fund AI and other innovation investments.

To learn more, please visit www.riministreet.com, and connect with Rimini Street on X, Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

Position Summary

For our Regulatory Research Analyst we are looking within their Tax, Regulations and HR/Payroll team for an independent country research specialist with experience in EMEA countries, for Finance, tax scope and some particular countries including also HR/PAYROLL. For countries not supported on localisations by the vendor, Rimini provides VAT only updates.

You will work fully remote, and rarely will have engagement with clients. The role is focused on research and interaction with the Business Analysts and other researchers.

Responsibilities:

Ensuring up to date awareness of legislative changes in assigned countries through a variety of sources, such as governmental websites, agencies, and third-party companies and in country expertsUnderstanding of the legislative process of the countriesInterpreting and documenting new and changed legislation for specific countries, in our internal source repositoryOrganizing and communicating information, clearly disclosing the details needed by product specialists to make necessary system changesPrepare comparative analysis of changes to e-file specification releases from various taxing jurisdictions by sourcing, verifying, and documenting those changesCommunicate effectively with tax jurisdictions on file specifications and changes to various regulatory processesMaintain internal goals and processes required to deliver timely and accurate legislative and regulatory updatesPerform job function through adherence to ISO processes

Must have requirements:

Must be bi-lingual at a minimum –English and another EMEA languageStrong problem solving and analytical skillsSignificant knowledge of international pay practices, compensation and benefit practices, country specific filing requirements, transaction tax (VAT, GST, etc.) and/or financial accountingMust be able to prioritize and work independently5+ years work experience in the tax, financial accounting or HR/payroll fields in the International arenaProven ability to research effectively from a computer through the internet and have knowledge of business computer applications including Microsoft OfficeResearch skills that go beyond government sites, can include social media, subscriptions, etc. Able to compile comprehensive information into meaningful summaries / documentationTax advisor background, not so much accountingTechnical understanding of ERP-Tax / Accounting / HR / Payroll workflows would be an advantageAble to understand VAT, e-invoicing, working with technical documentation and XML files such as digital tax forms etcCould be trained but would be nice to have: good understanding of tools like excel, SharePoint, google and word translate, pdf generation. Other tools used, training will be provided (AbbyFineReader, Deepl, Inoreader, beyond compare)Work under pressure on multiple tasksSelf-starter, resourcefulness, pro-active and a team player

Location

Remote - France

Why Rimini Street?

We are looking for talented, passionate people to help us build our future at Rimini Street. We hire only the best, the most extraordinary professionals and provide compensation, bonuses, and benefits to match the skills of our top-performing team members. Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy growing together, and get excited about learning new skills? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a true impact as part of a team of extraordinary professionals? This is the place for you.

Our work is challenging and meaningful. We start and end each day with a sense of achievement and purpose guided by our core values, the Four Cs:

CompanyWe dream big and innovate boldly. 

ColleaguesWe work with extraordinary people who create a culture of mutual respect and collaboration. 

ClientsWe relentlessly pursue solutions that help clients achieve their goals. Our unmatched client care is rooted in our passion for exceptional service. 

CommunityWe believe in leaving the world a better place than we found it. With the Rimini Street Foundation, we’ve made positive impacts in six continents for over 425 charities. 
Accelerating Company Growth

Nasdaq-listed under ticker symbol RMNI since October 2017 Over 5,900+ signed contracts to date, including Fortune 500 and Global 100 companiesOver 2,000 team members in 23 countriesUS and international recognition for industry leadership and philanthropic efforts. See all of our awards and recognitions here: https://www.riministreet.com/company/awards/ 

Rimini Street is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

To learn more about how Rimini Street is redefining the enterprise software support industry, visit http://www.riministreet.com

Please Note: Rimini Street does not accept resumes submitted by recruiting/staffing firms unless specifically requested by Human Resources. Unsolicited resumes will be ineligible for referral fees.

description.text:
About UsAt Chekin.com, we are redefining the guest check-in process with the most comprehensive automation software in the industry—from booking confirmation to check-out. As we scale rapidly across international markets, we're looking for talented professionals to join our collaborative, high-growth team.
Role:We’re hiring a full-time RevOps Specialist to help us transform data into insight, action, and automation. This role is ideal for a full-stack data professional passionate about enabling marketing, sales, and product teams with powerful data infrastructure, automation, and analytics.
You will design and own end-to-end marketing data pipelines, orchestrate RevOps automations using tools like Make.com, and support decision-making with clear and actionable dashboards.
Key ResponsibilitiesData Architecture: Build and scale data infrastructure across tools like BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, ensuring reliable ingestion, modeling (e.g., dbt), and storage.Analytics & Insights: Define and calculate marketing/sales KPIs such as LTV/CAC, attribution, funnels, cohorts, and turn them into insights for growth and optimization.Dashboards: Design compelling visual dashboards in Looker Studio, Tableau, or Power BI for different teams—Marketing, Product, Finance.RevOps Automation: Use tools like Make.com, n8n, Python to automate CRM workflows, AI-powered lead scoring, and data sync across platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Facebook Ads).Web & Product Analytics: Implement and manage Google Analytics 4, including server-side tagging and real-time dashboards.Collaboration: Partner cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, Product, and Legal to support rapid experiments and compliance (e.g., GDPR-ready data pipelines).
What We’re Looking ForTechnical SkillsStrong command of SQL, cloud databases (BigQuery preferred), and modern ELT tools (e.g., Fivetran, Airbyte)Familiar with dbt and modular data modelingExperience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems, including custom workflowsHands-on with Make.com, n8n, and optionally Python for AI-driven automationExperience with web analytics and marketing data across multiple channels
Soft SkillsClear communicator with the ability to tell a story with dataComfortable working in a remote-first, fast-paced startup environmentBias toward outcomes over tasks, fast iteration, and experimentationStrong problem-solving mindset and adaptability to ambiguity
Experience3+ years in a similar data or RevOps role, ideally in SaaS, B2B/B2C, or high-growth environmentsProven success in supporting marketing, sales, or product with data-led decisions and automations
EducationBachelor's or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related fieldFluent or professional English required (written and spoken)
Culture & Work EnvironmentWe are a fully remote company with a diverse, international team. Our culture is fast-moving, transparent, and impact-driven. You’ll work alongside creative professionals who value autonomy, ownership, and continuous learning.

description.text:
Chez Teliosa, notre mission est de rendre la thérapie plus accessiblePourquoi la thérapie ?615 millions de personnes souffrent de grave problème de santé mentaleLe covid a empiré les chosesDes personnes en grande souffrance n’arrivent pas à trouver la bonne personne pour les aider.
Qu’est-ce qu’ont fait ?On aide les thérapeutes à aider plus de monde
Comment on le fait?On a créé un programme qui donne aux thérapeutes les outils, les connaissances et l’accompagnement nécessaire pour réussir
En 3 ans, on est passés de 0 à2000 thérapeutes accompagnés5 millions € de CA/an - 70 % de net profitUne équipe de 15 personnes
En 2025, on veut :Grossir à 10 million € de revenuAider 1000 thérapeutes
Vous postulez pour la partie francaise : https://teliosa.com/
Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) Customer Success Manager (CSM) pour notre formation.
Ta mission sera :Animer des sessions live sur Zoom pour aider nos élèves thérapeutes à développer leur activité (business et marketing)Répondre aux questions de nos élèves sur le groupe Facebook privéFavoriser une énergie positive dans les échanges pour générer un maximum d'avis et témoignages positifsCollecter les retours sur notre programme pour l'améliorer en continu
Les choses sur lesquelles tu travailleras :Stratégie marketing pour thérapeutesDéveloppement du mindset entrepreneurialCréation et customisation de sites internet avec LeadpagesUtilisation stratégique des réseaux sociaux pour développer son activité gratuitementOptimisation SEOConfiguration et amélioration des fiches Google My BusinessMise en place de campagnes Google Ads et Facebook Ads
Ce job est fait pour toi si :Tu as une expérience dans la relation client, l'accompagnement d'entrepreneurs ou de thérapeutesTu t’intéresses au marketing digitalesTu aimes partager ton savoir et voir les autres réussir grâce à tes conseilsTu es à l'aise avec les outils digitals et les réseaxu sociauxTu as des bases en Google Ads et Facebook AdsTu es dynamique, positif(ve) et sais créer une ambiance motivanteTu es bienveillant(e) et coachable
Ce n'est pas fait pour toi si :Tu n'aimes pas le contact humain et l'animation de groupeTu préfères travailler sur des projets ponctuels sans suiviTu n'es pas à l'aise avec les outils digitauxTu n'as pas d'intérêt pour le secteur du bien-être et de la thérapie
Les choses cools que tu auras :L'opportunité d'aider des thérapeutes à développer leur activité et avoir un impact positifL'opportunité de progresser et de te perfectionner dans de multiples domaines complémentaires (marketing digital, techniques de vente, gestion de la relation client)Beaucoup d'autonomie dans ton travailRejoindre une équipe dynamique et passionnéeLa possibilité de travailler à distance (100% télétravail)Un environnement de travail stimulant et en constante évolutionL'accès à une communauté engagée de professionnels du bien-être
Chez nous, pas de CV ni de lettre de motivation, seules les skills comptent !
Il suffit de remplir ce questionnaire et nous vous recontacterons :https://3pvzkf2zd8p.typeform.com/to/l0YduVsJ

description.text:
Correlation One Develops Workforce Skills For The AI Economy

Enterprises and governments work with us to develop talent and close critical data, digital, and technology skills gaps. Our global programs, including training programs and data competitions, also empower underrepresented communities and accelerate careers.

Our mission is to create equal access to the data-driven jobs of the future. We partner with top employers and government organizations to make that a reality, including Amazon, Coca-Cola, Johnson & Johnson, the U.S. State Department, and the U.S. Department of Defense.

Our skills training programs are 100% free for learners and are delivered virtually by industry experts to minimize traditional barriers to career advancement. We take pride in fostering supportive, human-led, group learning environments that build technical proficiency and confidence in participants.

Join us and let's shape the AI Economy together!

Your impact 

We are currently adding Lead Instructors: Cloud Support Specialist to our Expert Network, in anticipation of projects that will launch this year and next year. This is a proactive hiring effort, where you will participate in our interview process and be added to our Expert Network. Once approved for our Expert Network, our team will be able to share various opportunities for you to support projects, programs, and our learners.

If you are already a member of our Expert Network, you do not need to apply to this role. You are already in our system.

If you are currently participating in a Correlation One program as a learner, please note that, in line with our policy, we can only consider your application once your learner engagement is completed successfully (graduated).

Job Summary

Lead Instructors at Correlation One are responsible for delivering high-quality, live, virtual instruction and partnering with company personnel to drive exceptional learning outcomes. Their main focus as educators is to conduct large synchronous online lectures on technical content, training anywhere from 100 to 8,000+ diverse Fellows at a time, depending on the program. This role involves preparing and leading virtual classroom sessions, collaborating with operations personnel, and contributing to the overall success of the program.

Virtual Classroom Leadership

Prepare and lead virtual classroom sessions for a range of Fellows, which may vary in size from 200 to 8,000+.Deliver instruction on skills tailored to Learners' needs, including math, verbal reasoning, and technical problem-solving.Oversee the management of class time Q&A and monitor chat flow, and overall class energy and engagement dynamics

Collaboration

Collaborate closely with Correlation One operations personnel to ensure smooth program delivery and adherence to schedules.Be flexible in contributing to classes during weekdays and/or weekends, as program schedules vary.Assist in lesson design, development, and improvement which may include tracking edits, suggestions, or changes to curriculum as needed 

Expectations

In addition to the core responsibilities, Lead Instructors are expected to adhere to the following expectations:

Professionalism

Interact professionally with Fellows, Correlation One staff, additional contractors, and guest speakers, maintaining a high level of courtesy and respect.

Lecture Preparation

Diligently and adequately prepare for lectures to ensure the delivery of high-quality content. 

Dynamic Online PresenceResponsiveness And Empathy

Be highly responsive and empathetic to Fellows, providing thoughtful answers and assistance throughout the lessonAdjust the lesson pace and presentation to meet the needs of diverse Fellows while also maintaining responsibility for timely delivery of the prepared content.Exhibit an energy, pacing, and ability to make complex topics accessible and maintain strong learner engagement

Communication

Communicate respectfully, recognizing that online or written communication may lack tone.Maintain extra communicative contact with Correlation One personnel.

Positive Attitude

Foster a healthy learning environment by maintaining a positive attitude and promoting a culture of learning.

Course Improvement

Contribute to course improvement by providing thoughtful and transparent feedback to the Correlation One team.

Your Expertise

6-8 years of professional work experience in Cloud Support, Cloud Engineering, Software Engineering, DevOps, etc..Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software engineering, Computer engineering, Information systems, Network administration, or Cybersecurity or equivalent professional experienceCertifications: CompTIA Network+, Linux+, AWS Certified Cloud PractitionerMust be an Amazon Authorized Instructor (AAI) Teaching experience with adult learnersA desire to support students in expanding their careers and transitioning into technical rolesFluent in English; professional verbal and writing skills

Where you are

This role is remote.

Compensation

The compensation range for this position is specific to location and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions. These factors include (but are not limited to) location, experience, education and skill sets.

Correlation One’s Commitment 

Correlation One is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. Correlation One provides a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Employment decisions at Correlation One are based solely on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We encourage applicants to bring their unique skills, experiences, and outlook to our work environment.

Correlation One is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Correlation One strives to provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities to enable them to access the hiring process. If you need an accommodation to access the job application or interview process, please contact candidates@correlation-one.com.

#priority

Correlation One’s Commitment 

Correlation One is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. Correlation One provides a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Employment decisions at Correlation One are based solely on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We encourage applicants to bring their unique skills, experiences, and outlook to our work environment.

Correlation One is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Correlation One strives to provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities to enable them to access the hiring process. If you need an accommodation to access the job application or interview process, please contact candidates@correlation-one.com.

basic_info.title: STAGE - Assistant chef de produit acquisition

description.text:
STAGE DE 6 MOIS
Le Groupe Le Monde est le premier groupe média indépendant en France. Il compte plus de 900 journalistes et repose sur un réseau unique de correspondants à l'étranger.
Il rassemble des titres prestigieux tels que Le Monde, M le magazine du Monde, Télérama, Courrier international, Le Monde Diplomatique, La Vie, et le site du HuffPost. Les titres publiés couvrent l'actualité internationale, économique, culturelle et politique. Chacun de ces titres est la référence dans son domaine, et tous partagent les mêmes valeurs de rigueur et d'indépendance.
Leader dans le secteur du numérique, le Groupe Le Monde est présent sur une pluralité de supports : papier, site Internet, mobile et tablette, et réuni chaque mois 24.4 millions de lecteurs, dont 13,4 millions de visiteurs uniques par mois sur le Web.
En nous rejoignant, vous vous inscrivez aussi dans un groupe médias attentif à l'égalité femmes-hommes et à l'équilibre vie personnelle/vie professionnelle, soucieux de faire évoluer vos compétences et engagé dans la transition environnementale.
Nous croyons que chaque collaborateur doit pouvoir évoluer sereinement tout au long de sa carrière. Face aux défis, temporaires ou durables, nous sommes là pour accompagner chacun, y compris les personnes en situation de handicap. Ainsi, nous mettons en œuvre des actions en faveur de l’emploi des personnes en situation de handicap en nous appuyant sur nos relais internes (RH, service de prévention et de santé au travail, référente handicap…).
VOTRE EXPERIENCE CHEZ NOUS
Le Service Acquisition de la Direction des Abonnements recherche son/sa futur(e) stagiaire pour une période de 6 mois à compter de septembre 2025Au sein du pôle Acquisition de la Direction des Abonnements, et sous la responsabilité des Acquisition Managers, vous participez à l’élaboration et la mise en place des actions marketing d’acquisition dans le but d’accroître le nombre d’abonnés numériques du Monde.
Vous collaborez avec les autres services (UX-Design, Audience, Fidélisation, Produit, Rédaction, Communication, etc.) pour la mise en œuvre des projets dans lesquels vous êtes impliqué(e).
VOS MISSIONS :GrowthParticiper à l’élaboration des opérations de recrutement sur le site et les applications via différents leviers (display, emailing, push, réseaux sociaux, search).Elaborer et piloter différentes campagnes marketing fil rouge et/ou promotionnelles et assurer le suivi pour optimiser les performancesEffectuer des bilans réguliers de performance des actions marketing menées.Proposer des AB tests en s’appuyant sur l’analyse des données des outils analytics (Amplitude, Piano Analytics) afin d’optimiser les leviers de recrutement et le parcours utilisateur.Suivre les différentes KPIs d’acquisition tout au long du parcours utilisateurs pour maximiser les conversions et limiter les frictions.
Achat médiaParticiper à la mise en place des campagnes de génération de trafic et de recrutement d’abonnés numériques, notamment sur les réseaux sociaux (Meta Business, Spotify, Amazon Ads, Snapchat Ads, TikTok Ads, Pinterest Ads, Apple Search Ads, Google Ads, etc.).Suivre les campagnes de mise en avant de contenus sponsorisés sur les réseaux sociaux et autres leviers d’acquisition avec un objectif d’optimisation des performances.Analyser quotidiennement les indicateurs de performance (clics, coûts, conversions, etc.) et proposer des recommandations d’optimisation de vos campagnes aux équipes concernéesEffectuer des bilans hebdomadaires et mensuels de performance des campagnes
VeilleEffectuer une veille constante des acteurs de l’abonnement afin d’alimenter les différentes équipes sur les bonnes pratiques du secteurEffectuer une veille constante de la publicité digitale sur les différents réseaux sociaux pour comprendre les tendances et proposer de nouvelles stratégies à adopter
LE PROFIL RECHERCHE :De formation supérieure (min. Bac +4/5) dans le domaine du marketing, du numérique ou de la data, vous faites preuve de rigueur et d’autonomie.Vous êtes à l’aise avec les chiffres et avez un fort esprit d’analyse et de synthèse.Dynamique et motivé(e), vous disposez de bonnes qualités relationnelles.Culture du digital et intérêt pour le secteur des médias.Curiosité pour les pratiques d'acquisition d'abonnés numériques.
Informations complémentaires : Type d'offre : StageDurée : 6 moisDate de début : à partir de septembre 2025Société : Groupe Le MondeLieu du stage : 67/69 Avenue Pierre Mendès-France, 75013 ParisIndemnité de stage : gratification légale, accès au restaurant d’entreprise, prise en charge de 50 % du titre de transport

description.text:
Are you a strategic thinker with a passion for data-driven marketing and team leadership?Do you thrive in fast-paced environments where you can shape strategy, optimize performance, and empower your team to deliver exceptional results? If so, this opportunity is for you.
We’re looking for a Head of User Acquisition to lead and grow our performance marketing function. In this role, you’ll drive lead generation, own and optimize the performance marketing budget, manage campaign execution, and lead a cross-functional team to achieve ambitious growth targets.
Excited? Let’s see what it takes 💛
What you will do:
Contribute to building and executing the company’s marketing strategy, identify growth opportunities.Develop and implement a lead generation strategy.Oversee daily task planning for the entire performance marketing team.Supervise Asana: task reviews, prioritization, team consultations.Plan and manage performance team sprints.Maintain the budget file: update actual investments monthly.Plan, defend, and manage the annual performance marketing budget.Manage the team: weekly check-ins, 1:1s, prioritization, feedback, and development.Build effective team communication and provide mentorship.Onboard new team members: training, 360 reviews, probation support, onboarding process.Participate in recruitment: job postings, interviews, preparing role responsibilities.
What you need to succeed in this role:
4+ years of experience in performance marketing.At least 1-2 years in a Team Lead or Head role.Hands-on experience in managing and scaling paid campaigns (Google, Meta, Bing).Experience working with international markets, especially English-speaking ones (USA, Canada, EU).Proficient in analytics tools (GA4, Looker Studio, Google Sheets, Hotjar).Experience in budgeting: annual budget planning, tracking actual spend.Understanding of the sales funnel, lead generation strategies, and attribution models.Confident use of Asana (or similar project management tools): sprint management, task reviews, prioritization.Team management experience: check-ins, 1:1s, feedback, development, prioritization control.At least Upper-Intermediate (B2) level of spoken and written English (working with international markets, platforms, analytics).Strong organizational skills: ability to manage multiple processes simultaneously.Results-oriented mindset and independent decision-making ability.Openness to feedback and ability to give it effectively.
Benefits:
Business hours.Opportunity to work fully remotely.Inclusive international environment.Compensation in USD.Good bonuses for referring friends.Paid intensive training and probation.Work-life balance.Responsive management interested in your growth and long-lasting cooperation.Greenhouse conditions for self-development.
*The items listed in this section may vary depending on the terms of your engagement. Certain benefits and conditions typically apply to employees; independent contractors may not be eligible for all of these. The specific terms, including compensation, benefits, and work conditions, will be clearly defined in your agreement if selected.

description.text:
Full-time · Remote-first (CET ±3h) · People & Growth
Design and deliver learning experiences that help a fully remote team grow, upskill, and collaborate better — async-first.
HiCareer is supporting a remote-first SaaS company in hiring a Learning & Development Specialist. The company has grown to 200+ employees across Europe and North America, and now wants to take a more structured approach to learning and professional development.This role is about making learning work in a distributed environment: building training content, enabling managers to coach effectively, and creating engaging async learning formats.
📚 What You’ll DoDesign and run learning programs for remote employees (onboarding, leadership, upskilling)Build self-paced, async-first training modules that fit distributed work stylesSupport managers with tools and guidance for coaching their teamsOrganize knowledge-sharing sessions and peer learning initiativesPartner with People Ops to align learning with company goals
🌟 What Success Looks Like in 6 MonthsA refreshed onboarding program that helps new hires ramp up fasterClear learning paths for at least two core skill areas (e.g. leadership, product knowledge)Async training modules in place that employees actually use and enjoyManagers feel supported with coaching frameworks and materials
✅ What They’re Looking For3+ years in L&D, HR, or training design (remote or international orgs a plus)Strong understanding of digital/async learning methods and tools (LMS, Notion, Loom, etc.)Able to design engaging content (slides, docs, videos) for self-paced learningExcellent communicator in English; facilitation skills for live sessions also valuedCuriosity and adaptability to work across different functions and cultures
🌍 The SetupRemote-first, employees across Europe and North AmericaPeople team of 5, working closely with managers in Product, Engineering, and SalesCET ±3h preferred working hours
📧 How to ApplyApply via HiCareer and share a few lines about why this role matches your strengths.
------
Due to high interest, we may not reply to everyone individually — but feel free to use our Career Assistant to evaluate the match. You can also explore more roles via HiCareer’s platform.

description.text:
— A propos
Elevate est un cabinet de conseil Data & IA.👉 Notre mission, c’est d’accélérer la mise en œuvre opérationnelle des stratégies Data & IA de nos clients.👉 Pour cela, on intervient à la croisée du conseil et de la mise en œuvre opérationnelle en délivrant un accompagnement bout-en-bout.👉 On accompagne plus de 300 grandes entreprises de tous secteurs d’activité, depuis nos bureaux en France et à l’International.
Nos expertises :DATA STRATEGY - On accompagne les décideurs dans la définition de leur Vision et Stratégie Data & IA.Stratégie data : roadmap, identification de cas d’usage, management de transition,…Organisation data : modèles organisationnels, upskilling, reskilling,…Monétisation data : retail media, data sharing,…Data & AI Maturity AssessmentTransformation & Change : Data & AI Day, Hackathon, formations,…DATA MARKETING - On optimise les performances marketing et commerciales grâce à la donnéeMesure d’audience : digital analytics, tracking, …Personnalisation de l’expérience client : AB Testing, Personnalisation, E-Merchandising,…Optimisation des campagnes publicitaires : MMM, Attribution/Contribution Marketing…Segmentation client et scoring : RFM, clustering,machine learningDashboarding, Reporting, et Pilotage OmnicanalDATA TECH - On accompagne nos clients dans la conception, la mise en œuvre, le passage à l’échelle et l’optimisation de leurs infrastructures techniques data et de leurs cas d’usage IAConstruction de pipelines de données robustes et scalablesMise en place d’architectures cloud modernes : GCP, AWS, AzureImplémentation de solutions de gouvernance des données : qualité, sécurité, complainceAI & Gen AI : Gen AI Factory, AI for : e-commerce, customer service, content…

— Descriptif de posteDans le cadre du développement de l’équipe Marketing, nous recrutons un.e Growth Marketer en stage / alternance pour accompagner Marie, Communication & Marketing Lead.
Tu évolueras dans une entreprise à taille humaine, avec des missions à la fois stratégiques et opérationnelles.
— Parmi vos missions 🛠
En tant que Growth Marketer, tes missions consisteront à co-construire puis mettre en place la stratégie marketing orientée Lead Generation suivante :
CRM / Marketing Relationnel — Animation et développement de nos bases de contacts (40%)Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des mécaniques d’embasement :ScrappingAcquisition / intégration de bases de contactsConcevoir et mettre en œuvre des mécaniques d’activation et d’engagement de la base de contacts :Campagnes LinkedIn, emailing,…
Lead Generation via Contenus & Copywriting (40%)Contribuer à la production de contenus auprès des cibles prospects / clients : articles de blog, livres blancs, landing pages…Contribuer à la production d’une newsletter LinkedInContribuer aux emailing externes
Lead Generation via Événements (20%)Participation à l’organisation des événements externes à destination de nos clients (Invitations, Contenu, Lieu, Format, Audience, Logistique, …)
— Profil recherché 
Tu es actuellement dans un parcours Master 2 d’une école de communication ou école de commerce et tu disposes d’une première expérience en stage.
Tu disposes également des hard skills suivantes :Maîtrise de la notion de génération de Leads et de tunnel de conversionBonne connaissance du marketing orienté clientD’excellentes capacités rédactionnellesPremière expérience avec un outil d’Emailing et back-office d’un site
Niveau soft skills, on attendra de toi :Une excellente communication écrite et orale sont indispensables.Rigueur & OrganisationMindset orienté business
— Qui pourrait t'accompagner ? 🤝
Marie, Lead Communication & Marketing : après 3 ans chez CMI France sur le poste de Responsable de la Communication, elle rejoint Elevate en 2022.
Elle mène, avec Aurélien, le co-fondateur d’Elevate, la communication digitale externe & interne de l’agence ainsi que la partie évènementielle !
Si tu cherches une experte de couture (ouverte, rabattue simple, rabattue double, avec lisières superposées ou surjetée normale) Marie est LA personne à qui t’adresser. Coco Chanel ou Yves Saint-Laurent peuvent aller se rhabiller ! 🦸 ♀️
— Le processus de recrutement
🔎 Entretien de découverte : un échange avec notre équipe Talent, conçu pour te donner l’occasion de te présenter et de mieux te connaître.📚 Entretien technique : une rencontre avec une personne de l’équipe Marketing, incluant un test de compétences et des mises en situations.🎯 Entretien final : une discussion approfondie avec l’un des co-fondateurs de l’agence. Cet entretien vise à évaluer tes capacités de structuration, d’analyse et de synthèse à travers une ou deux études de cas.
— Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Elevate c’est avant tout ⛺Rejoindre un cabinet de conseil à taille humaine.Une entreprise fondée autour de la formation et la montée en compétences de chaque membre de l’équipe.Un management humain et respectueux de toutes et tous.De la place pour les initiatives innovantes et créatives.Une politique de télétravail flexible et basée sur le choix !Des parcours de carrières adaptés à chacun.esDes bureaux en plein Paris 🇫🇷
— Nos équipes témoignent 🤝
Nous avons à cœur d’écouter, valoriser et respecter l’avis de nos Elevaters. Nous vous encourageons à lire les avis de chacun et chacune sur notre page Glassdoor pour avoir plus de détails sur les coulisses de notre aventure 🙂
Notre page Glassdoor : https://www.glassdoor.fr/Pr%C3%A9sentation/Travailler-chez-Elevate-Agency-EI_IE4481244.16,30.htm

Chez Elevate, nous valorisons la diversité et l’inclusion. Handi Accueillante, Elevate développe une politique active d’emploi et d’insertion des personnes en situation de handicap. Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures et garantissons un processus de recrutement dénué de toutes formes de discriminations. Par ailleurs, si vous avez besoin d’un dispositif spécial à l’emploi (situation de handicap) ou d’une autorisation de travail sur le territoire français, faites-nous en part le plus tôt possible pour que les démarches administratives ne ralentissent pas votre arrivée chez nous !
