basic_info.title: Chargée de Marketing Opérationnel Rabanne Americas - H/F

description.text:
Description du poste :

 The International Operational Marketing Executive facilitates the operational & strategic integration between the brand & the markets, ensure flawless communication between the brand & the markets. He promotes the perspectives of growth for the brand in markets.  Scope: Americas Ce que vous aurez à faire 1. Contribute to Marketing Plan elaboration
- Have in-depth knowledge of brand performance in the markets to provide starting discussion point with the International marketing development team and assess brand needs
- Follow monthly brand net revenues & sell-out performance for markets
- Elaboration of Annual Brand Performance Book 
- Provide feedback & challenge the brand & markets for the next year Marketing Plan
- Help Brand to gather specific market analysis on specific business issues (competition range extensions, retail trends), in order to contribute to resolve marketing plan key decisions (on Promo, GWPs, sets…)
- Responsible for developing Brand and Launch guidelines

 2. Manage the worldwide brand animation: 
- Gather local marketing plans for all markets to have general view of the brand´s activities
- Support Local teams in the elaboration and implementation of their landed marketing plans & launch strategies. And follow-up of the local media plans.
- Propose and coordinate tailor-made/tactical local projects, in a test & learn approach to be then roll-out in other markets
- Contact point for IMR approvals and requests that are under Brand Team responsibility 
- Manage the local requests and assures rest of brand’s team collaboration / validation when required
- Insure the global coherency for all the elements of a 360° strategy (Retail, Digital, communication, development teams)
  3. Communication and Coordination 
- Coordinate with all internal departments all deliverables related to Marketing plans (Annual Brand book, Launch book, tailor-made animation guidelines, mock-ups, lab samples etc…) to assure accuracy, homogeneity and deadlines 
- Send Brand communications to markets about Marketing plans, Launch plans updates and retailer’s presentations 
- Guarantee market alignment and knowledge exchange by proactively contacting local marketing teams and sharing relevant information

 4. Insights and Best Practices
- Produce Launch Reports: consolidating individual reports into a single document 
- Cross-Region fertilization (best practices or special requests) amongst markets 
- Aware of specific needs per region (retailer profile, legal restrictions)   
5. Operations oriented activities 
- CPS analysis: challenge consolidated region figures vs brand expectations. Back & forth with internal teams (marketing development & engineers).
- CPS analysis: referent participant of CPS meeting
- Catalogue maintenance: product line by market and exceptions
- Define Launch guidelines retro-timing, in accordance with CNP: deadlines and responsibilities 
6. Retail Expertise
- Gather retail trends & shopping experience analysis on a regular basis (competition best practices, innovation, art of gifting, animation trends…), to improve brand’s visibility & shopping experience
- Follow-up of brand’s distribution & permanent visibility template with key markets informatio   

Description du profil :

 Experience: 
At least 2-3 years of experience in operational or trade marketing, in international or local positions, ideally acquired in the beauty industry. 
Education:
Master Degree, major in Marketing ideal
 
Languages:
French and English fluent, Spanish would be a plus.
 
 Competencies:
- Strong knowledge of USA/LATAM markets and trends 
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with strong leadership
- Ability to manage operational project keeping a very strategic and logn-term vision
- Result-oriented, self-starter personality with an interest to propose and test new ideas
- Very curious, polyvalent and autonomous
- Strong analytical and project management skills;
- Flexible and reactive, good management of stress
- Olfactive, Fashion and/or Design sensibility  

Nous proposons :

 An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture Opportunities for learning and development An international company with many opportunities for career development Competitive compensation and benefits

description.text:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About The Role 🖥️
Based in our Parisian office and reporting to the Director of HRBP Manager, you will join a team of five HR Business Partners, all fully dedicated to developing Vestiaire Collective on a global scale.

As an HRBP, your role will be to:

Collaborate with managers and department heads to align HR initiatives with business objectives

Support managers in managing complex employee relations and resolving conflicts

Develop and implement initiatives aimed at improving employee engagement and talent retention

What You Will Do 👜

Organizational Development Oversee the organizational development of Marketing and Commercial teams Ensure the application of our global HR strategy and policies, while respecting operational requirements Collaborate with other People Partners (Learning & Development, Legal, Talent) to build, continuously improve, and deploy processes related to the employee experience



Be a true partner to your teams

 Drive change management to support employees and managers in implementing new initiatives Support team performance and achievement of objectives by providing HR expertise and ensuring compliance with legal and contractual rules Monitor workplace climate, actively identify early warning signs, and maintain a regular on-site presence Maintain contact and collaborate with occupational health services to ensure individual employee follow-up



Team Development

 Support managers during performance reviews or sensitive situations Help leaders develop and strengthen their skills Conduct annual salary and compensation reviews, ensuring equality and equity Contribute to the annual performance review process, ensuring it remains dynamic and adapted to the company’s evolution



Who You Are ⭐

Full proficiency in English, French is not required but considered a bonusYou thrive in a dynamic, results-oriented environmentYou genuinely enjoy helping others and have a strong interest in peopleExcellent IT skills, particularly in Excel and HRISSolution-oriented with strong analytical skillsDirect communication and influencing abilitiesFoundational understanding of HR payroll and legal processesSelf-starter with initiative; ideally 3+ years of HR experience to succeed in this role(Bonus) Experience working with marketing and commercial teams



What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive Compensation And Benefits Package
As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Research indicates that people from underrepresented backgrounds—including women, people with disabilities, and other marginalized communities—often hesitate to apply for roles unless they meet every single requirement.

At Vestiaire Collective, we believe that talent comes in many forms, and we're committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. Your unique perspective could be exactly what our team needs, so we encourage you to apply even if you don't tick every box.

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer 
Beware of Scams
Vestiaire Collective only contacts candidates via official emails ending in @vestiairecollective.com or no-reply@hire.lever.co . We never use WhatsApp, Telegram, or similar apps for job offers, nor will we ever request payments or banking details.

If you receive a suspicious message, please report it to talentacquisition@vestiairecollective.com

jobs.description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About The Role 🖥️
Based in our Parisian office and reporting to the Director of HRBP Manager, you will join a team of five HR Business Partners, all fully dedicated to developing Vestiaire Collective on a global scale.

As an HRBP, your role will be to:

Collaborate with managers and department heads to align HR initiatives with business objectives

Support managers in managing complex employee relations and resolving conflicts

Develop and implement initiatives aimed at improving employee engagement and talent retention

What You Will Do 👜

Organizational Development Oversee the organizational development of Marketing and Commercial teams Ensure the application of our global HR strategy and policies, while respecting operational requirements Collaborate with other People Partners (Learning & Development, Legal, Talent) to build, continuously improve, and deploy processes related to the employee experience



Be a true partner to your teams

 Drive change management to support employees and managers in implementing new initiatives Support team performance and achievement of objectives by providing HR expertise and ensuring compliance with legal and contractual rules Monitor workplace climate, actively identify early warning signs, and maintain a regular on-site presence Maintain contact and collaborate with occupational health services to ensure individual employee follow-up



Team Development

 Support managers during performance reviews or sensitive situations Help leaders develop and strengthen their skills Conduct annual salary and compensation reviews, ensuring equality and equity Contribute to the annual performance review process, ensuring it remains dynamic and adapted to the company’s evolution



Who You Are ⭐

Full proficiency in English, French is not required but considered a bonusYou thrive in a dynamic, results-oriented environmentYou genuinely enjoy helping others and have a strong interest in peopleExcellent IT skills, particularly in Excel and HRISSolution-oriented with strong analytical skillsDirect communication and influencing abilitiesFoundational understanding of HR payroll and legal processesSelf-starter with initiative; ideally 3+ years of HR experience to succeed in this role(Bonus) Experience working with marketing and commercial teams



What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

description.text:
ABOUT BEDROCKBedrock is a media-tech venture, formed as a JV between M6 and RTL Group (part of Bertelsmann). The company is the trusted strategic streaming partner of leading entertainment companies in Europe, operating their full streaming services and delivering state-of-the-art experience to their audiences.With 15+ years of streaming expertise and 450 skilled professionals in 10 countries, Bedrock has become the premier strategic streaming platform in Europe.At Bedrock, we love challenges, whether they're related to features, scaling, performance or peak traffic. We believe that learning new tricks is a journey and sharing them with peers is definitely part of the fun.

Bedrock is looking for a Product Manager with a strong background in Product Management (3+ years) to join our team and contribute to the product strategy, roadmap, and implementation of our platform's advertising monetization capabilities.
You'll be instrumental in the design and delivery of solutions that enable broadcasters and media companies to optimize their advertising revenue and enhance the user ad experience.
This is an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives on turning complex problems into impactful solutions, and who is curious about the Advertising ecosystem (display, video, audio, programmatic, etc.).While prior experience in advertising tech (Ad Servers, SSPs, DSPs…) is a plus what matters is your solid experience in Product Management and your interest in the Ads domain.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
This role offers significant learning opportunities as you help define flexible, scalable solutions supporting diverse ad formats and targeting strategies. You'll operate within a dynamic and evolving ecosystem, ensuring our platform effectively integrates with key third-party advertising systems and addresses our clients' specific business challenges, ultimately reinforcing their trust in our solutions.
As a Product Manager, you will :
Drive Product Strategy: Contribute to the development of our Ads monetization roadmap and help align it with business goals and client needs to maximize advertising revenue.
Build impactful Ad Products: Support the product discovery process and feature delivery within the advertising domain. Contribute to the design and delivery of flexible, configurable tools that allow clients to effectively manage their ad inventories, formats, and targeting strategies.
Assist with Ad Ecosystem & Integration Strategy: Participate in defining and streamlining the platform's integration strategy with Ad Servers, programmatic platforms (SSPs, DSPs), and other ad technologies used by our clients. Help ensure robust connectivity and leverage ecosystem capabilities.
Represent Client & User Needs -Advertising-: Contribute to translating broadcasters' ad monetization strategies into scalable and reliable product features. Help promote solutions that balance platform consistency with necessary customization and configurability. Ensure a high-quality, non-intrusive user ad experience.
Leverage data : Work closely with Data Science/BI teams to define advertising KPIs, analyze platform and client data (e.g., fill rates, click-through rates, RPMs) to derive actionable insights. Participate in defining, prioritizing, and analyzing experiments (A/B tests) to validate hypotheses and optimize ad performance.
Collaborate across teams  Partner with Engineering, UX/UI, Data, Architecture, and Go-To-Market to ensure smooth execution from discovery to deployment. 


WHAT WE’ RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally in a B2B SaaS/PaaS environmentStrong ownership mindset, capable of managing products from idea to launch and beyond
Curiosity about Ads monetization models and advertising technology — experience in the field is a plus, but not a must
Analytical skills and a data-informed approach to decision-making
Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teamsand to influence cross-functional teams and build consensus
A proactive, structured, and adaptable working style
Excellent communication and presentation skills : Ability to clearly articulate complex concepts, strategies, and trade-offs to diverse audiences, including executives, technical teams, and clients. 

Beyond technical skills, we are looking for talents with:
Excellent team player who fosters collaborationAbility to adapt to changing environments and challengesStrong focus on client satisfaction and delivering high-quality serviceInnovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvementFluent in English
LIFE AT BEDROCKYou'll join an enthusiastic, friendly and close-knit team in a fast-growing tech company with more than 10 years' experience and a strong network of media shareholders.Work flexibility and brand-new office spaces with a great location.A top-notch tech expertise : documentation, support, R&D, management seniority…Work Evolutions & opportunities within the company, as well as training.Strong human connections knowledge sharing: Last Friday Talks, Demos, Meet-Ups, HR Roadshows

description.text:
Job Opportunity: Marketing Director – Global Pharma (Life Sciences)
Sector: Life Sciences | Specialization: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing / Contamination ControlAre you a strategic marketing leader with a passion for innovation in the pharmaceutical industry?
An established global player in the Life Sciences sector is seeking a Marketing Director – Global Pharma to lead its international marketing strategy for contamination control solutions in pharmaceutical manufacturing environments.
This is a high-impact leadership role, perfect for a results-driven professional who thrives at the intersection of strategy, innovation, and execution. You'll shape global go-to-market strategies, oversee portfolio development, and lead a high-performing team across key regions.
What You’ll Do:As Marketing Director – Global Pharma, you will:🌍 Strategic LeadershipDevelop and execute long-term marketing strategies for the global pharmaceutical segment in alignment with executive leadership.Define customer segmentation, market positioning, and competitive differentiation.Identify inorganic growth opportunities (e.g., partnerships, M&A) to support market expansion.🧪 Portfolio & Innovation ManagementOversee the global portfolio of contamination control solutions for pharmaceutical manufacturers.Drive the innovation pipeline in collaboration with R&D, Regulatory, and Technical teams.Manage the full product lifecycle, including global launches, phase-ins/outs, and updates driven by compliance.🚀 Commercial ActivationCollaborate with Sales, Regional Marketing, and Communications teams to drive brand awareness and lead generation through effective campaigns and customer engagement strategies.Ensure a consistent value proposition and aligned messaging across all markets.📊 Customer & Market InsightMaintain deep knowledge of customer workflows, market dynamics, and the competitive landscape.Lead market research and customer insight initiatives.Build strategic relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and support thought leadership efforts.👥 Team LeadershipLead and develop a global team of 8+ marketers, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and innovation.Provide mentorship and drive cross-functional alignment between Portfolio, Commercial, and Segment teams.What You BringAdvanced degree (MBA or MSc in Marketing, Chemistry, Microbiology, or related field).10+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical or life sciences manufacturing industry.8+ years in marketing or related leadership roles, with proven success in global B2B environments.Experience managing large, diverse, and international teams.Ability to turn complex strategy into clear, actionable plans with measurable outcomes.Strong commercial acumen, with a track record of leading successful product launches and market expansions.Outstanding communication, analytical, and cross-functional collaboration skills.Comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a strong sense of ownership and urgency.
Why Join?Shape global strategy in a critical growth area of the life sciences industry.Join a mission-driven organization focused on supporting safe medicines and cleaner production environments.Work in a collaborative environment with strong support from sales, technical, and digital teams across multiple global hubs.Make a measurable impact on a rapidly growing segment and develop your leadership career on an international stage.
Ready to lead the future of pharma marketing on a global scale?
Apply now to take the next bold step in your career.
All applications will be handled in strict confidence.

description.text:
Responsable Marketing (H/F) – CDILieu : Paris | Type de contrat : Temps plein
Parlons d’amour.Chez adopte, nous faisons presque tout en interne.C’est notre différence : nous sommes notre propre agence.
Nous apprenons constamment de nouveaux métiers, nous nous inspirons des créations les plus innovantes, et surtout, nous nous consacrons au plus beau des sujets : l’Amour. Et ce sujet est sans limite.
À propos du posteRattaché(e) à la Directrice Marketing & Communication du groupe, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le développement et le rayonnement de la marque. Votre mission sera de piloter et d’exécuter des projets marketing et communication, avec un fort accent sur le digital, l’influence et l’animation de communautés.
Vos missionsDéfinir et mettre en œuvre la stratégie marketing et communication digitale en cohérence avec les objectifs business de l’entreprise.Superviser le positionnement de la marque et son rayonnement à travers une stratégie d’influence, de partenariats et d’activation des communautés.Piloter et challenger la production de contenus (éditorial, social media, campagnes digitales), en garantissant leur cohérence et leur impact.Manager une équipe dédiée (chefs de projets, alternants, stagiaires) et coordonner les agences et prestataires externes.Définir, suivre et optimiser les budgets marketing alloués aux différentes campagnes.Suivre les stratégies de croissance organique et payante (social ads, partenariats stratégiques, brand content).Suivre et analyser les performances via des KPI avancés (ROI, LTV, CPA, engagement, croissance des communautés) et proposer des recommandations stratégiques.Identifier les tendances et opportunités de marché pour renforcer la compétitivité et l’innovation de la marque.
Ces missions ne sont pas exhaustives et pourront évoluer selon les projets du pôle marketing.
Profil recherchéFormation supérieure en marketing, communication ou équivalent, idéalement diplômé(e) d’une école de commerce ou de communication de renom (HEC, ESSEC, ESCP, Sciences Po, CELSA, Dauphine, ESSEC, ou équivalent).Minimum 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle en CDI, avec une expertise confirmée en marketing digital, gestion des réseaux sociaux et relations influenceurs.Solide maîtrise des plateformes sociales et compréhension approfondie de leurs codes et dynamiques.Capacité démontrée à évoluer dans un environnement très dynamique, en gérant simultanément plusieurs projets stratégiques.Excellentes compétences relationnelles et managériales, créativité affirmée, sens de l’organisation et esprit analytique.Aptitude à travailler en collaboration avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires et à piloter efficacement des prestataires externes.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?Chez adopte, vous travaillerez aux côtés d’une équipe passionnée et engagée, dans une culture fondée sur la collaboration et l’exigence. Vous bénéficierez d’un cadre stimulant, favorisant à la fois la performance, la créativité et le développement professionnel.
Prêt(e) à rejoindre l'aventure ?Envoyez-nous votre CV !

Prêt(e) à rejoindre l'aventure ?Envoyez-nous votre CV !

description.text:
Description De L'entreprise

Nous sommes Saatchi & Saatchi France, l’agence certifiée « Great Place to Work » de Paris.

Chez Saatchi & Saatchi, nous sommes persuadés que de meilleures conditions de travail permettent de faire du meilleur travail. Nous y croyons tellement, que nous avons décidé d’en faire notre positionnement : 𝗴𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘀𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗴𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗰𝗲𝘁𝗼𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸.

Notre mission collective : tirer les marques vers le haut en tirant nos talents vers le haut.

Et c’est aussi pour ça que de grandes marques telles que SFR, Playstation, Matmut, Burger King, Visa ou P&G nous font confiance depuis de nombreuses années !

https://www.saatchi.fr/

Descriptif du poste

Saatchi&Saatchi recherche un Content Project Manager en CDI dès maintenant.

Votre Rôle

En tant que Content Project Manager, vous serez l’interlocuteur(trice) principal(e) pour la gestion des projets de contenus destinés à la marque Peugeot France.

Vous interviendrez sur différentes typologies de dispositifs (CRM, DCO, Social media pour les acquisition et fidélisation…) en pilotant la production des contenus de bout en bout, de la réception du brief à la livraison finale.

PRINCIPALES MISSIONS

 Réception et cadrage des briefsRecueillir les briefs de la marque locale (Peugeot France) concernant les enjeux de communication, les messages clés, les tonalités, et les formats de contenus attendusÉchanger avec le client pour clarifier les objectifs marketing et éditoriauxIntégrer les contraintes spécifiques selon les campagnes (DCO, CRM anti-attrition, prospection JCP, etc.) Coordination éditoriale et créativeBriefer les rédacteurs et les équipes créatives en interneIntégrer et respecter les valeurs, charte graphique et rédactionnelle de PeugeotS’assurer de la cohérence entre les contenus produits et la stratégie de marque Suivi de production et livraisonPlanifier et superviser les différentes étapes de production éditorialeRéaliser les aller-retours avec les équipes internes et le clientAssurer la qualité et la pertinence des livrables avant envoi client Suivi opérationnel de la diffusionAccompagner la mise en œuvre effective des contenus sur les différents canaux (emailing, display, social, etc.)Collaborer avec les équipes média, data et techniques si nécessaire (internes Publicis pour Stellantis).S’assurer de la conformité des contenus en post-livraison (formats, messages, cohérence)

Qualifications

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

Compétences 

Première expérience en gestion de projets éditoriaux dans une agence de communication ou en environnement similaireBonne culture du marketing digital (CRM, DCO, au service de campagnes d’acquisition et fidélisation)Très bonne capacité à briefer et encadrer des profils créatifsSens de la coordination, du détail et du calendrierFrançais et Anglais courants obligatoires

Soft Skills

Excellentes qualités relationnelles, sens du service clientProactivité, rigueur et esprit d’équipeÀ l’aise avec les environnements dynamiques et multitâches

Informations complémentaires

Viva La Différence !

Cette philosophie de Publicis Groupe témoigne depuis toujours de notre engagement pour la diversité et de la conviction que nos talents sont notre plus grande richesse et notre meilleur atout.

Nous valorisons ainsi toutes les singularités, sans distinction d’âge, de sexe, de couleur de peau, d’origine sociale, de religion, ou d’orientation sexuelle… seules la compétence et l’énergie comptent ! Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures qualifiées et seront ravis d’accompagner tout au long du processus de recrutement, de manière personnalisée un.e candidat.e en situation de handicap qui en ferait la demande.

Publicis France est engagé pour l’égalité des chances et l’équité d’opportunités pour tous et toutes.

Votre Rôle

Vous interviendrez sur différentes typologies de dispositifs (CRM, DCO, Social media pour les acquisition et fidélisation…) en pilotant la production des contenus de bout en bout, de la réception du brief à la livraison finale.

PRINCIPALES MISSIONS

 Réception et cadrage des briefsRecueillir les briefs de la marque locale (Peugeot France) concernant les enjeux de communication, les messages clés, les tonalités, et les formats de contenus attendusÉchanger avec le client pour clarifier les objectifs marketing et éditoriauxIntégrer les contraintes spécifiques selon les campagnes (DCO, CRM anti-attrition, prospection JCP, etc.) Coordination éditoriale et créativeBriefer les rédacteurs et les équipes créatives en interneIntégrer et respecter les valeurs, charte graphique et rédactionnelle de PeugeotS’assurer de la cohérence entre les contenus produits et la stratégie de marque Suivi de production et livraisonPlanifier et superviser les différentes étapes de production éditorialeRéaliser les aller-retours avec les équipes internes et le clientAssurer la qualité et la pertinence des livrables avant envoi client Suivi opérationnel de la diffusionAccompagner la mise en œuvre effective des contenus sur les différents canaux (emailing, display, social, etc.)Collaborer avec les équipes média, data et techniques si nécessaire (internes Publicis pour Stellantis).S’assurer de la conformité des contenus en post-livraison (formats, messages, cohérence)

Qualifications

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ :

Compétences 

Première expérience en gestion de projets éditoriaux dans une agence de communication ou en environnement similaireBonne culture du marketing digital (CRM, DCO, au service de campagnes d’acquisition et fidélisation)Très bonne capacité à briefer et encadrer des profils créatifsSens de la coordination, du détail et du calendrierFrançais et Anglais courants obligatoires

Soft Skills

Excellentes qualités relationnelles, sens du service clientProactivité, rigueur et esprit d’équipeÀ l’aise avec les environnements dynamiques et multitâches

Informations complémentaires

Viva La Différence !

Cette philosophie de Publicis Groupe témoigne depuis toujours de notre engagement pour la diversité et de la conviction que nos talents sont notre plus grande richesse et notre meilleur atout.

Nous valorisons ainsi toutes les singularités, sans distinction d’âge, de sexe, de couleur de peau, d’origine sociale, de religion, ou d’orientation sexuelle… seules la compétence et l’énergie comptent ! Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures qualifiées et seront ravis d’accompagner tout au long du processus de recrutement, de manière personnalisée un.e candidat.e en situation de handicap qui en ferait la demande.

Publicis France est engagé pour l’égalité des chances et l’équité d’opportunités pour tous et toutes.

description.text:
Simple Life is the #1 AI-powered health coaching app for adults who want to lose weight and enjoy a healthier lifestyle—without the stress or extremes. Our mission is to empower people to feel their best every day. By challenging traditional, restrictive approaches, Simple offers a more sustainable method grounded in ease, personalization, and real-life support.

Simple has had over 17 million downloads and more than 300,000 5-star reviews, having helped millions lose weight successfully and sustainably. Simple has earned recognition as Best Virtual Coach and one of the Top 100 AI companies — all thanks to a dedicated global team driving real impact.
With SIMPLE as a partner in their pocket, users feel cared for and empowered to embrace — and stick to — new healthy habits. To learn more, visit simple.life.
We are seeking a high-energy, results-driven Influencer Marketing Manager to handle and scale our influencer campaigns across the US & UK markets.
This is a remote, full-time position. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a can-do attitude, and can manage high volumes of influencer partnerships, we'd love to hear fromyou!
What You'll do:Develop and execute high-volume influencer campaigns.Manage large-scale influencer collaborations, ensuring strong content performance and brand alignment.Negotiate influencer partnerships, securing the best rates and ROI-driven deals.Track and analyze key performance metrics to optimize campaigns.Foster positive, long-term relationships with influencers for ongoing collaborations.Ensure attention to detail in contracts, content approvals, and campaign execution.Stay ahead of social media trends, algorithm updates, and high-performing content formats.
What we look for:Proven experience managing high-scale influencer campaigns in the US & UK markets.Ability to handle multiple influencer activations simultaneously.Strong negotiation skills to secure high-impact partnerships.Data-driven mindset, with the ability to analyze and optimize campaign performance.Positive energy & can-do attitude, thriving in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.Excellent communication and relationship-building abilities.Understanding of social media algorithms.Knowledge of weight loss products or health & wellness is a plus.
Nice to Have:Experience with Looker Studio, Superset.Experience with whitelisting and paid social amplification.Familiarity with influencer marketing platforms and tools.
Join us at Simple and make a real impact in the world of health and wellness!

basic_info.title: Chargé(e) de CRM, Data & Email Marketing (F/H)

description.text:
Au cœur de notre stratégie de fidélisation client, tu travailleras sur la gestion CRM, l’automation marketing, l’analyse de données et l’optimisation des campagnes email/SMS, dans un contexte d’amélioration continue et potentiellement de migration CRM.

Tes Missions

CRM & Bsport

Créer et mettre à jour les offres commerciales, segments clients, et fiches établissements dans notre outil CRM (bSport ou autre). Mettre en place, tester et optimiser des scénarios automatisés (emails, SMS) pour retenir, fidéliser et faire progresser les clients. Maintenir une base de données propre : désabonnements, bounces, enrichissement, segmentation intelligente. Aider à mettre à jour les contenus CRM sur l’application (offres, événements, etc.). 

Campagnes Email & SMS Marketing

Rédiger des contenus engageants pour les emails et SMS (avec l’aide d’un agent IA si besoin). Créer les visuels à partir de templates et intégrer les campagnes dans l’outil d’emailing. Gérer les listes d’envoi, paramétrer les UTMs pour le tracking, programmer les envois et suivre leur validation. 

Data & Reporting CRM

Extraire et analyser des données clients (via bSport, datalake, CRM…). Identifier des segments pertinents et insights actionnables. Suivre la performance des campagnes (ouverture, clic, conversion, désabonnement). Contribuer au suivi des KPIs CRM (LTV, churn, clients à risque/VIP, satisfaction, NPS…). Formation bac +3 à bac +5 en marketing digital, data, CRM ou communication. À l’aise avec Excel, notions de base en SQL ou outils BI (Looker, Tableau…) appréciées. Esprit analytique, rigueur, et goût pour l’optimisation continue. Intérêt pour les sujets bien-être, sport et tech. Une première expérience en CRM, marketing automation ou emailing est un plus. 

Premier call avec l'équipe RH

Entretien dans les bureaux

Case Study

description.text:
Title: French Speaking Product Marketing Manager – Digital Solutions Europe

Location: Remote within EU

Department: Marketing

Reports To: Product Marketing Director (based in Europe)

Functional Group: Digital Solutions

About FoodChain ID

FoodChain ID (www.foodchainid.com) is a global leader in food safety, quality, and sustainability solutions. Our Digital Solutions division helps agribusinesses, manufacturers, and retailers navigate regulatory complexity and unlock value through trusted, data-driven insights.

About The Role

We’re looking for a strategic and execution-focused Product Marketing Manager to support our Digital Solutions (Agricultural Solutions, Supplements, Packaging) portfolio across Europe, with a particular focus on French-speaking markets. You will drive product positioning, go-to-market strategies, and campaign execution for digital solutions focused on agricultural solutions, packaging and supplements.

This is a remote role within the EU and requires full professional fluency in French.

Key Responsibilities

Market Strategy & PositioningDefine the product positioning and messaging for digital solutions across European markets, with specific focus on French-speaking regionsIdentify local regulatory drivers and competitive dynamics to inform go-to-market approachesGo-to-Market ExecutionPlan and execute launches for new solutions in collaboration with commercial teamLocalize and adapt global messaging to resonate with regional and market-specific needsSales EnablementCreate localized sales tools: pitch decks, one-pagers, value propositions, objection-handling guidesDeliver training and support to regional sales and customer-facing teamsCampaign Support & Demand GenerationSupport campaign execution targeting ag input suppliers, distributors, and cooperatives across EuropeTrack campaign performance and support optimization based on engagement dataVoice of CustomerLead customer interviews and gather market insights to refine personas, positioning, and product roadmap inputsCross-functional CollaborationWork closely with Product, Sales, Regulatory, and the broader Marketing team to align priorities and initiatives
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in marketing, or a related field (Master’s a plus)5+ years’ experience in B2B product marketing, preferably in agricultural solutions, packaging or supplementsNative or fluent French speaker; professional English requiredProven success in launching products and creating regional market demandExcellent communication skills and project management abilitiesExperience working in a matrixed, global environment

Nice to have

Experience with the following tools: SalesForce, PowerBI, Wordpress, ChatGPT

Performance Indicators

Pipeline generation across European marketsMarketing-sourced lead generation and conversionCampaign ROI and pipeline contributionMQL to Pipeline conversionEffectiveness of localized positioning and messaging

Note: This is a remote role with a preference for candidates based in France or neighboring EU countries. The ability to travel occasionally for team meetings or customer engagements is expected.

Powered by JazzHR

description.text:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

🤩 Why is your role important?

As Qovery’s first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You’ll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

🚀 What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery’s value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery’s Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you’ll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

💡 About you

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathize with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here’s What Will Help You Succeed

Experience in B2B SaaS — ideally in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder’s mindset — you’ve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you’re eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills — you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious — you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature — you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive — in a small team, you’re comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

🎯 What You’ll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

💥 Our Talent Acquisition Process

We’ve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery’s values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

We’re committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

description.text: Chief Technology Officer (CTO) | Full-Time | International Software CompanyWe are a trusted recruitment partner, committed to connecting world-class professionals with leading global organizations. On behalf of a well-established international software company, we are seeking a visionary and highly skilled Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to drive innovation and lead the company’s technology strategy. This is a full-time executive position offering a unique opportunity to shape the future of cutting-edge software solutions.About the RoleAs CTO, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of technology strategy, development, and innovation within the organization. You will play a pivotal role in aligning technology initiatives with business goals, building scalable systems, and ensuring the company remains at the forefront of industry advancements. The role requires a balance of technical expertise, leadership excellence, and strategic vision.Key ResponsibilitiesDefine and lead the company’s overall technology vision, strategy, and roadmap.Oversee the design, development, and delivery of software products, ensuring high performance, security, and scalability.Drive innovation by staying ahead of emerging technologies, tools, and industry best practices.Collaborate with executive leadership to align technology initiatives with business strategy and growth objectives.Lead, mentor, and scale high-performing engineering and technology teams across international locations.Establish best practices for software development, architecture, and DevOps processes.Manage budgets, resources, and vendor relationships to ensure efficient delivery of technology solutions.Ensure compliance with global data protection, cybersecurity, and regulatory standards.QualificationsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (MBA is a plus).12+ years of progressive experience in software engineering and technology leadership.Proven track record as a CTO, VP of Engineering, or equivalent senior technology leadership role in an international software company.Strong expertise in software architecture, cloud infrastructure, and product development.Demonstrated ability to scale teams, systems, and processes in high-growth environments.Exceptional leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.Fluency in English is required; additional languages are an advantage.What’s OfferedExecutive leadership role with global impact in a leading international software company.Competitive compensation package, including performance-based incentives.Opportunity to drive innovation and shape technology strategy on a global scale.Collaborative leadership culture and strong organizational vision.Professional growth within a dynamic and fast-evolving industry.Apply NowIf you are a forward-thinking technology leader ready to make a lasting impact in the software industry, we encourage you to apply and join a company committed to innovation and excellence.

You will play a pivotal role in aligning technology initiatives with business goals, building scalable systems, and ensuring the company remains at the forefront of industry advancements. The role requires a balance of technical expertise, leadership excellence, and strategic vision.Key ResponsibilitiesDefine and lead the company’s overall technology vision, strategy, and roadmap.Oversee the design, development, and delivery of software products, ensuring high performance, security, and scalability.Drive innovation by staying ahead of emerging technologies, tools, and industry best practices.Collaborate with executive leadership to align technology initiatives with business strategy and growth objectives.Lead, mentor, and scale high-performing engineering and technology teams across international locations.Establish best practices for software development, architecture, and DevOps processes.Manage budgets, resources, and vendor relationships to ensure efficient delivery of technology solutions.Ensure compliance with global data protection, cybersecurity, and regulatory standards.QualificationsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (MBA is a plus).12+ years of progressive experience in software engineering and technology leadership.Proven track record as a CTO, VP of Engineering, or equivalent senior technology leadership role in an international software company.Strong expertise in software architecture, cloud infrastructure, and product development.Demonstrated ability to scale teams, systems, and processes in high-growth environments.Exceptional leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.Fluency in English is required; additional languages are an advantage.What’s OfferedExecutive leadership role with global impact in a leading international software company.Competitive compensation package, including performance-based incentives.Opportunity to drive innovation and shape technology strategy on a global scale.Collaborative leadership culture and strong organizational vision.Professional growth within a dynamic and fast-evolving industry.Apply NowIf you are a forward-thinking technology leader ready to make a lasting impact in the software industry, we encourage you to apply and join a company committed to innovation and excellence.

basic_info.title: Chargé(e) de marketing omnicanal et data client (F/H)

description.text:
Filiale du Groupe Manutan, Casal Sport est leader en France depuis 45 ans, dans la vente de matériel et d’équipements de sport aux collectivités, établissements scolaires et clubs sportifs, avec pour mission de « Stimuler la pratique du sport ensemble ». Nous sommes une équipe de plus de 120 collaborateurs passionnés, dynamiques et performants, basés à Altorf (67) à 20km de Strasbourg (Gare TER puis 7 minutes à pied) Casal Sport cherche un(e) Chargé(e) de marketing omnicanal et data client. Mission principale
Sous la responsabilité du Responsable Marketing Client, vous êtes chargé(e) d’analyser en profondeur la dynamique de notre parc client pour identifier les leviers de croissance sur nos marchés stratégiques : collectivités, enseignement, clubs. Vous êtes également garant(e) de la coordination des opérations marketing client mensuelles sur l’ensemble des canaux de vente et de communication (e-commerce, forces de vente terrain, service client, réseaux sociaux…).Votre rôle s’articule autour de cinq piliers :L’analyse des comportements et de la performance client à partir de données concrètesL’identification des problématiques par typologie client, canal et zone géographiqueLa mise en œuvre (avec l’équipe marketing) d’actions correctrices ou d’accélérationLa coordination et l’adaptation des opérations du plan marketing clientLa garantie d’une mise à jour et de l’enrichissement de la base de données en continu
Responsabilités
Analyse du parc client et diagnostic businessAnalyser l’évolution du parc par typologie de clients : nouveaux, fidèles, dormants, perdus à travers les différents tableaux de bords et KPIs mis à dispositionMettre en évidence les causes possibles à partir des données disponibles : chiffres d’affaires, devis, fréquence d’achat, panier moyen…Traduire ces constats en actions en collaboration avec l’ensemble des parties prenantes (service marketing client, responsable nationale des ventes, marketing de l’offre…)Suivre les résultats des actions et les ajuster selon les retours marché pour maximiser la performance
Coordination des opérations marketing clientAssurer la mise en œuvre des opérations prévues dans le plan marketing mensuel par marché (collectivités, enseignement et associations sportives)Veiller à la cohérence et à la déclinaison des actions sur tous les canaux :Digital (site, emailings, bannières)Print (catalogue, outils d’aide à la vente)CRM (campagnes commerciales, ciblage)Réseaux sociaux (contenus, campagnes sponsorisées)Coordonner les opérations avec les équipes opérationnelles : marketing, commerce, création, service client.
Suivi de la performance et amélioration continueProduire et mettre à jour les tableaux de bord de pilotage clientAssurer le reporting régulier des KPIs relationnels : activation, fidélisation, taux d’attrition, réachatÊtre force de proposition sur les outils à optimiser (CRM, BI, tableaux de suivi, base de données client)
Collaboration avec le gestionnaire de la base clientTravailler étroitement avec le gestionnaire de la base client, garant de la qualité, de la structuration et de la qualification des données Participer à l’amélioration continue des données utilisées pour les ciblages, segmentations et analyses, et en suivre les indicateurs de qualité
Ce que ce poste vous offre :
Un rôle central dans le pilotage de la stratégie client au sein d’une organisation structuréeUn fort niveau de responsabilité dans l’analyse et la prise de décisions marketingUne exposition à des projets stratégiques dans un environnement B2B omnicanal, avec un lien direct entre les actions menées et les résultats commerciaux
Un cadre stimulant pour les passionné(e)s de sport, où votre esprit d'équipe et votre affinité avec cet univers feront toute la différence. Ici, votre amour du terrain se transforme en levier de performance marketing !

basic_info.title: Professional Service Consultant - Woman / Man / Non Binary

description.text:
🌀 The Company

Filigran, founded in October 2022, stands out in the cybertech ecosystem for its commitment to revolutionizing cyber threat management with a proactive approach. Its mission is to develop innovative open-source solutions designed to anticipate cyber threats, identify security gaps, and strengthen organizational security posture.

Filigran solutions are now trusted by over 6,000 public and private organizations worldwide.

🎯 The Role

We’re looking for a Customer Training Consultant to join our Customer Success team and play a key role in designing and delivering our training programs.

In this role, you’ll focus on creating impactful learning experiences for our customers, developing training materials, and delivering both standard and tailored sessions. You’ll work closely with our Content Manager, Revenue, and Product teams to scale training initiatives and ensure customers can confidently and effectively use our platforms OpenCTI and OpenBAS.

💼 Your Responsibilities

Design and build a scalable library of training content (agendas, slide decks, demo datasets, hands-on workshops) for OpenCTI and OpenBAS. Deliver training sessions to customers (remotely and on-site). Continuously improve training content based on platform updates and feedback. Document training delivery processes and propose scalable models for future services. Develop learning paths and certification programs to support different user profiles and maturity levels. Contribute to building a customer education strategy that scales with our growing community. 

🤝 Who You’ll Work With

Reporting to: Head of Customer SuccessCollaboration with: Content Manager, Revenue, and Product teamsClose interactions with: Public and private sector customers globally, including cybersecurity and threat intel teamsEnvironment: Fully remote, async-friendly, and collaborative

🧬 Profile We’re Looking For

Proven experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI), SOC, or adjacent cybersecurity rolesStrong communication and presentation skills, ideally with experience in delivering trainingComfortable working in both strategic and technical contextsAutonomous, structured, and curious mindsetFluent in English (French is a plus)Bonus: Experience building training path and educational content in a tech/SaaS environment

🌍 What We Offer

A unique opportunity to build a function from scratch with direct impact on customer successA collaborative, open-source-driven culture with real-world mission impactFlexible work environment (fully remote)The chance to work with major cybersecurity teams across the globe — public institutions, critical infrastructure, and strategic enterprises

🌱 Why Join Filigran? More than just a job.

We’re a fast-growing, global, and fully remote company on a mission to empower defense teams to be proactive — through open-source solutions that uncover threats and drive action.

⭐ What we believe

We believe we do work that matters — uniting defenders into a global community to make security more open, resilient & collaborative.

💻 How we work

That belief fuels how we work — with focus, clarity and high standards. Always with care and respect, never with ego.

🧭 What guides us

That focus and care is grounded in our CORE values: Cohesion, Openness, Responsibility, and Equity — the compass that guides our decisions, collaborations, and growth, even when no one’s watching.

💰 Compensation & Benefits

Competitive pay + equity — everyone shares in our successRemote-first, flexible, and balanced — work that fits your lifeYour setup, your choice — pick the gear that works for you

🌍 Equal Employment Opportunity

We enable cybersecurity through inclusion — from code to culture.

At Filigran, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of our people make our products and our team stronger. We welcome talent of every background, identity, and lived experience — regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

What matters here is what you bring — not what you look like, where you’re from, or how you identify.

🚀 Ready to Join Us?

Apply now and help us build the future of the cybersecurity ecosystem — together.

basic_info.title: Volunteer: Marketing + Communications Volunteer Placement (online and in-person) in Peru

description.text:
Location: Talara, Peru

Duration: Minimum 2 weeks, maximum 6 months

Start Dates:Project is on-going, and you can join at any time, depending upon availability

Cost for the in-person placement: from $1466 USD for the first 2 weeks + from $608 for each week thereafter

Cost for the online placement: from $1081 USD for the first 2 weeks + from $415 for each week thereafter

Benefits:

Gain personal hands-on experience working with a growing Peruvian NGO.Work alongside experienced +amp; passionate professionals and local communitiesLearn from our educational seminars given by our Directors on topics including but not limited to: international development, NGO/social enterprise creation and management, marketing and outreach, research techniques and more.IMPACT - your financial contribution helps fund our projects and it also sponsors food for a family in need which has been affected by COVID19. In appreciation the family will, with our help, plant a tree in your name. A thank you photo will be sent to you during your placement.Live and work in a north Peru surfing hot-spot (relevant to the in-person placement)Keywords: Engineering, field work, sustainable development, community development, serious internship.

Please note: This opportunity is designed to give you the contacts and experience to help further your career. You are not replacing any member of staff, but helping alongside them, whilst learning new skills. Simply click the APPLY Button to submit your application, and ask as many questions as you need.

Introduction

This project is with a surfing-inspired sustainable development non-profit (NGO) driving the development of poor Peruvian coastal communities through a path of sustainability. We develop environmental, educational, infrastructure and socio-economic projects working hand in hand with local communities and international interns.

As a Multidisciplinary Academic Team, We Not Only Carry Out Our Own Social And Scientific Projects That We Constantly Need Support With, But We Also Welcome Interns From Universities Around The World To Come And Carry Out Their Own Bachelors/masters/PhD Research With Us In Lobitos. Volunteer Interns Are Welcomed To Develop Their Own Research Project As Part Of Their Application If It Can Be Aligned With Our Work And Focus. The Benefits Of Carrying Out a Research Project With Us Are:

Enhance your CV and gain professional hands-on experience managing sustainable projects in an international development NGO, having a real and positive impact on a vulnerable community.Carry out a successful and impactful research project work alongside experienced +amp; passionate people from a range of disciplines.Receive ongoing guidance throughout the research process from our experienced team; from before you set off for Peru, during your volunteer internship with us and when you get back to university afterwards.Live and work in a surfing paradise in northern Peru, the land of endless summer.

As a Marketing +amp; Communications Intern, You Will Be Given Ownership Of The Organizations Outreach Projects, Working Alongside Directors And Other Interns To Promote Our Development Initiatives. The Daily Activities And Tasks May Vary Depending On Current Projects. These May Include But Are Not Limited To:

 Social media content creation 

As organizations seek to expand their presence online, keeping up our involvement on social media is important to promote our many programs. As a Marketing and Communications Intern, you will gather the needed content for exciting, engaging social media posts on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter. Coordination and communication with all other intern teams is necessary to ensure accurate representation from all areas. This role also includes the applications for and management of various online fundraising platforms.

 Photography and videography 

Having enticing graphical elements for all aspects of our communications is important to engage previous, current, and future interns, donors, and partners. In this intern role, you will help in capturing these photos through involvement in community events, planting days, organized photoshoots for partners, and many more photo opportunities. You should also be able to properly use our wildlife camera in order to capture the great biodiversity of the Lobitos area. This is a great opportunity to utilize and develop keen creative skills.

 Coordination of the design of promotional material for us and its partners 

Having many partnerships and projects ongoing, it is important to keep all promotional material organized and prepared for implementation. This involves communication between the directors and partners to ensure accuracy. In addition, you will design merchandise material for us and its partners. A key eye for details and creativity is important.

 Communication with our team at home and abroad 

Up-to-date communication with our supporters, both in Lobitos and around the world, is essential to the growth of our organization. You will play a role in our engagement with the Lobitos community, organizing and promoting workshops and other in-person community events. Yet you will also take part in the communication with our current and potential global donors. This may include the creation of newsletters and the orchestration of webinars, global calls, and online fundraising events.

Online Program

You Can Take Part In This Position Through Our Online Program As Well As a Discounted Financial Contribution. The Online Activities For This Project May Include (but Are Not Limited To):

Marketing research for upcoming initiativesContent curation for all forms of social media and marketingCreation of graphic elements to be used onlineImplementation of exciting visual elementsMonitor engagement on our online channelsImplementation of marketing and communication goals

In addition, youll be able to take part in the following online educational seminars, given by our Directors:

NGO/Social enterprise creation and managementOutreach and Business DevelopmentSustainability perspectives from a local "on the ground" development organizationInternational environmental and social sustainability standardsResearch methods and community engagement

Please note: all information above is subject to change. Please check the most up to date information on the Global Nomadic website when applying. Simply follow the link on the Apply Button above.

basic_info.title: Head of Solution Engineering and Architecture (liquidity, brokerage, crypto)

description.text:
Our hiring partner, a leading fintech innovator specializing in liquidity, brokerage, and digital assets solutions, is seeking a Head of Solution Engineering to lead and scale their global technical solutions team.This is a pivotal leadership role, responsible for shaping solution design, driving seamless product integration, and ensuring exceptional technical support for institutional clients. The ideal candidate will bring deep expertise in trading technologies, liquidity infrastructure, and risk management systems, combined with strong leadership skills and a client-focused mindset.
Location: Remote - European time zone
Key ResponsibilitiesLead, mentor, and grow a high-performing team of Solution Engineers.Provide technical leadership in customer engagements, pre-sales activities, and solution design.Serve as a key technical advisor during the sales cycle, clearly articulating product capabilities and value.Collaborate with Sales, Product, and Development teams to define, deliver, and implement optimal client solutions.Oversee client integrations and deployments, ensuring smooth, timely, and effective onboarding.Ensure all solutions are aligned with liquidity flows, execution models, risk parameters, and infrastructure compatibility.Develop and maintain technical documentation, guidelines, and training materials for internal and client use.Gather client feedback, market insights, and proactively suggest product enhancements.Establish KPIs and performance metrics to measure technical support, integration efficiency, and client satisfaction.Represent the company in technical discussions with institutional clients and external stakeholders.
Key QualificationsExtensive background in financial technology, trading platforms, and enterprise SaaS solutions.Proven track record leading technical teams in solution engineering, pre-sales, or technical sales.Strong expertise in:Liquidity aggregation, order routing, execution models.FIX protocol and API-based trading systems.Market infrastructure across FX, CFDs, and digital assets.Familiarity with institutional-grade platforms such as MetaTrader, cTrader, OneZero, PrimeXM, or proprietary OMS/EMS.Exceptional communication and presentation skills—able to translate technical concepts into clear business value.Strong client-focused mindset, with the ability to manage complex integrations and deliver superior client experiences.Proactive problem-solver with strong stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration skills.
What’s on OfferCompetitive salary package with performance-based incentives.Opportunity to lead a strategic global function within a high-growth fintech environment.Exposure to cutting-edge trading technologies across traditional and digital asset markets.Career advancement opportunities in a dynamic and innovative company.
This role is ideal for a seasoned fintech leader who combines deep trading technology expertise with strategic leadership capabilities and a passion for delivering best-in-class client solutions.

Key QualificationsExtensive background in financial technology, trading platforms, and enterprise SaaS solutions.Proven track record leading technical teams in solution engineering, pre-sales, or technical sales.Strong expertise in:Liquidity aggregation, order routing, execution models.FIX protocol and API-based trading systems.Market infrastructure across FX, CFDs, and digital assets.Familiarity with institutional-grade platforms such as MetaTrader, cTrader, OneZero, PrimeXM, or proprietary OMS/EMS.Exceptional communication and presentation skills—able to translate technical concepts into clear business value.Strong client-focused mindset, with the ability to manage complex integrations and deliver superior client experiences.Proactive problem-solver with strong stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration skills.
What’s on OfferCompetitive salary package with performance-based incentives.Opportunity to lead a strategic global function within a high-growth fintech environment.Exposure to cutting-edge trading technologies across traditional and digital asset markets.Career advancement opportunities in a dynamic and innovative company.
This role is ideal for a seasoned fintech leader who combines deep trading technology expertise with strategic leadership capabilities and a passion for delivering best-in-class client solutions.

basic_info.title: Head of Marketing (EMEA, United Kingdom, Ireland)

description.text:
About The Role

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many. This is a future with more voices rather than fewer.

About The Role

We are searching for a marketing leader to drive our up-market growth across the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. As the Head of Marketing, EMEA, you will lead marketing's contribution to our regional business goals.

This is a pivotal leadership role. You will sit on the EMEA Senior Leadership Team (SLT), serving as the voice of marketing and a key architect of our regional strategy. You will lead through a combination of direct team management and cross-functional influence to ensure Marketing exceeds its overall pipeline goals. Your mission is clear: build a world-class marketing function that delivers predictable, scalable pipeline and drives revenue.

What You'll Do

Set the Regional Strategy: As a member of the EMEA SLT, co-own the regional revenue targets and develop the overarching marketing strategy to drive market penetration and meet our growth goals.Lead & Develop Your Team: Directly lead, coach, and inspire a high-performing regional team focused on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and local campaigns, fostering a culture of accountability and impact.Represent Marketing Results: Take accountability for total regional marketing performance. You'll do this by building exceptional partnerships with global functional teams—including Partner, Events, Brand, and Performance Marketing—to rally the cross-functional team behind EMEA’s strategic priorities.Immerse in the Data: Hunt for funnel insights to refine marketing strategies for distinct customer segments and countries. Conduct frequent analysis on program performance to scale efforts, ensure an efficient marketing mix, and achieve KPIs.AI Reflexivity: You lead the team from the front when it comes to pushing the boundaries of AI usage to drive efficiency and impact.Communicate & Influence: Communicate insights, learnings, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels on a regular cadence, ensuring alignment and celebrating progress.Be the Voice of the Region: Translate our global brand campaigns into locally resonant "expressions" that connect with customers across EMEA, providing critical market feedback back into global teams.


What You'll Bring

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work
