description.text:
At Matter Labs, we believe freedom drives progress and prosperity. We don’t see ourselves as a company, but as a team aligned around a single mission: to advance personal freedom for all (see ZK Credo).

To achieve this goal, we’re building zkSync — a credibly neutral, fully open source technology stack and network on top of Ethereum, which is owned and governed by its community. We use advanced cryptography called zero-knowledge proofs to scale Ethereum infinitely without compromising on security or decentralization. With a world-class team, a community of over 1M supporters across Twitter + Discord, and hundreds of millions $ in funding, we have abundant resources to accomplish the mission.

The Role

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead the product marketing function for Matter Labs by owning end-to-end GTM for ZKsync, covering messaging, competitive insights, sales enablement, and developer education. Produce technical content (white papers, tutorials, videos) and maintain a continuous feedback loop with pilots and the community. Establish and track key metrics to optimize campaigns and expand the ZKsync ecosystem.

What You Will Be Doing

Go-to-Market Strategy: Design and execute comprehensive GTM plans for ZKsync product and feature launches, covering messaging, outreach playbooks, developer education programs, and ecosystem partner coordination.Competitive & Market Insights: Conduct ongoing competitive analyses, market intelligence, and end-user research to inform product positioning, feature prioritization, and technical content strategy.Sales Enablement: Build and maintain up-to-date sales collateral: one-pagers, datasheets, verticalized slide decks (e.g., “Blockchain for Payments,” “Private Transactions for Institutions”), case studies, and competitor battle cards, so BD and sales teams can articulate value and close deals.Messaging & Positioning: Develop concise, differentiated product messaging tailored to each target segment (developers, enterprises, DeFi users), and ensure consistent technical messaging across all channels.Educational Resources: Lead creation of high-impact developer-focused content such as videos, tutorials, white papers, implementation guides, sample code repositories, and case studies that demonstrate ZKsync’s value proposition to technical decision-makers.Customer & Community Feedback Loop: Gather and synthesize insights from pilots, early adopters, and developer communities, then channel them back into product and marketing priorities.Metrics & Reporting: Define, track, and report on key metrics such as developer sign-ups, integrations, MQLs, conversion rates, documentation usage, on-chain activity, churn, and community growth to measure marketing impact and continuously optimize campaigns.

What We Look For In You

Technical Marketing ExcellenceProven ability to translate complex, unique features into clear value propositionsExperience creating technical documentation and developer education programsTrack record of successful Web3 or Web2 enterprise product launches and developer activationsTechnical UnderstandingSolid grasp of blockchain technologyAbility to understand and explain technical products to non-technical audiencesFamiliarity with Web3 development tools and frameworksCompetitive Analysis & PositioningStrong product marketing fundamentals and GTM strategy developmentAbility to identify and articulate competitive differentiationProficiency in benchmarking product capabilities against competing solutions.Data-driven approach to measuring engagement and content effectivenessCross-functional LeadershipStrong collaboration skills with engineering, product, marketing and communications teamsAbility to coordinate complex launches across multiple stakeholdersExperience working in fast-paced technical environmentsContent CreationDistill complex blockchain concepts into concise, audience-appropriate value statementsExcellence in creating technically-oriented marketing materials and documentationUse data, benchmarks, and real-world examples to reinforce credibility and impactAbility to develop compelling educational content and presentation materialsAgility & AdaptabilityPivot strategies and tactics based on early feedback or new informationMake clear decisions in ambiguous contexts, surfacing risks and contingency optionsRealign cross-functional plans under tight deadlines and changing requirements
Working at Matter Labs

At Matter Labs, you have the freedom to work how you want, when you want, and from where you want. All positions are 100% remote (with optional travel to team and/or industry events). We operate in lean and nimble teams, with no time tracking and minimum bureaucracy. We move fast. Only results matter. We will provide you with everything you need to learn, grow, and be productive.

Our results-only environment means anyone who believes in our mission can join us, regardless of background, sexual orientation, race, gender, and age. Both our team and community are made up of people from diverse backgrounds. That's why, out of politeness and respect, we refrain from opinions on politics, religion, or sex at the workplace.

We designed our culture around the tenants of freedom and ownership. This ethos will underpin our positive-sum community as we evolve toward full decentralization.

What We Offer

 Competitive compensation Equity and token package Premium coverage for health, dental and vision insurance 16 weeks of parental leave Flexible paid time off Company closure weeks 1-2x per year $2000 USD work equipment stipend $300 USD monthly co-working allowance Company offsites 1-2x per year $500 USD learning & development stipend 401k plan for US Employees

Don't meet every single requirement? That's ok. At Matter Labs, we think big with a long-term view and encourage you to apply even if you don't think you check every box in the job description.

If this role resonates with you, please apply now.

Read more about working at Matter Labs here.

Important: We are remote-first, operating in the timezones between UTC-5 (Latam and Atlantic Coast) to UTC+7 (South-East Asia).

Please click here for our applicant privacy notice.

To all recruitment agencies: Matter Labs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Matter Labs employees, or any other organisation location. Matter Labs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Read our full policy here.

description.text:
Rattaché(e) à la Direction Communication et en lien avec la partie Création de Contenus, vous aurez en charge l’ensemble des stratégies de nos comptes réseaux sociaux, la mise en œuvre de celles-ci ainsi que l’animation quotidienne de nos communautés. 
Vos missions :Concevoir les stratégies organiques et payantes de chacun de nos comptes réseaux sociaux (Facebook, Instagram, Linkedin) pour nos différentes marques, sur le plan stratégique et opérationnel afin de développer les communautésCréer les lignes éditoriales en lien avec chaque réseauProgrammer, poster, animer et modérer quotidiennement l’ensemble de nos pages avec du contenu créatif et pertinent en respectant l’image de chaque marqueAnalyser, suivre les KPIs et faire des reportings sur l’activité et l’impact des actions menéesAssurer la veille (suivi des partenaires et concurrents, des blogs et influenceurs du marché et des tendances et développements technologiques)Configurer, mettre en place et suivre les résultats des annonces Social AdsPiloter les créateurs de contenus, les briefer par rapport aux idées et stratégiesGérer la stratégie d’InfluenceMontage vidéo et appétence pour la photo sont un plus
Compétences : Vous avez une excellente maîtrise des réseaux sociaux, de la Suite META et des annonces Social Ads. Vous faites de la photo / vidéo et vous connaissez la suite Adobe sont un plus. Rigueur, réactivité, autonomie, dynamisme, et un grand sens de l’organisation.Vous possédez d’excellentes qualités rédactionnelles et une orthographe irréprochable.Vous êtes à l’aise en anglais et pouvez traduire aisément des publications.
Vous serez amené à vous déplacer régulièrement sur les différents sites d’activité du groupe afin de capter des « moments » pour créer du contenu vivant.
 Candidature avec portfolio obligatoire.

description.text:
Who You’ll Work With

Nike Energy Marketing drives connections with those that are culturally impacting today’s most discerning youth communities and puts forward new ideas to explore with them the intersections of sports and culture (fashion, music, art, design…).

As part of the Paris Energy team, you will work fluidly across the Paris/France Marketing Team, to foster strong relationships with cultural talents in the city/country. You will also work cross-functionally in the Paris office with key partners such as the Nike Brand Team and Sports Marketing in service of our athletes. You will work closely with the EMEA Energy Marketing Team and the Men’s/Women’s Consumer Construct (Marketing) teams in EHQ.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a talented experienced marketing expert who is extremely well connected with Parisian youth cultural emerging scene and with a strong connection to fashion and a strong network with the community. An inventive marketing talent with an ability to imagine stories that can inspire the next generation to move, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, find new strategic approaches as well as lead end-to-end project and keen to partner with crucial marketplace partners to turn their ideas into a reality on the ground.

A marketing talent willing to move forward in an experimental approach, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, a testing ground to push the limits strategically, incubate, test and learn to imagine and build a new space for Nike and sport, when others do not see the looming opportunity. A collaborator with interest, open-mindedness and limitless passion, translating visionary language into something unique in its modernity.

What You’ll Work On

As the Lead Professional, Energy Marketing Runway, Paris/France, you will be a part of the Paris/France Marketing Team, reporting directly to the Director, Energy Marketing, Paris/France. This role will be responsible for balancing relationship management & marketing execution through our key talent relationships across the Paris cultural ecosystem.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying and managing a network of cultural catalysts in Paris to boost the brand priorities and create the future of sport, in alignment to our global strategyProviding exceptional service and brand management to all talent relationshipsCreating visionary marketing concepts aimed at pushing the intersections of sports and culture through creativity with strong resonance among the youth in ParisLeading product collaborations projects with external partners & Global teamsFeeding relevant key catalyst relationships strategically into Geo & Global campaigns work to advance our position within our key sports territories Driving key Energy campaigns through pinnacle marketplace ecosystem in collaboration with our store partnersBriefing and managing external agencies Identify, gather and formulate structured insights about forward-thinking customers to enable us to better serve creative youth on the ground in Paris, and providing feedback to EMEA/Global teams to support long-term concepts 

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike’s position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike’s position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.

description.text:
Descriptif du poste

Publicis France recherche un Social Media Manager en CDI pour l'une de ses agences créatives.

En tant que social media, vous interviendrez sur un grand compte pour la production de contenus fil rouge & temps forts, sur les principales plateformes Social Media de notre client (+ de 2M followers cumulés).

Missions

En Tant Que Social Media Manager

Vous élaborez les recommandations de Stratégie éditoriale : prise de brief client, rédaction du brief créa, suivi de prod. jusqu’à la mise en ligne.Vous assurez le suivi & relationnel client et vous contribuez à la mise à jour quotidienne de notre calendrier de production édito. en fonction des A/R.Vous produisez des bilans pertinents sur la base des datas collectées. Vous organisez et vous consolidez les enseignements pour enrichir la stratégie. éditoriale de notre client.

Qualifications

Compétences recherchées

Expertise Social Media significative et validée.Vous savez rédiger et présenter des recommandations stratégiques et opérationnellesVous êtes créatif.ve, vous savez proposer et défendre vos idéesEn veille permanente sur les innovations digitales, marketing & communication et bien sûr plateformes et formats Social Media.

Ce que vous avez en plus 

L’autonomie et l‘efficacité de vos contributionsL’expression écrite et oral irréprochableLa relation client : la base !L’état d’esprit bienveillant, au service du collectifL’anglais courant

Informations complémentaires

Viva La Différence !

Cette philosophie de Publicis Groupe témoigne depuis toujours de notre engagement pour la diversité et de la conviction que nos talents sont notre plus grande richesse et notre meilleur atout.

Nous valorisons ainsi toutes les singularités, sans distinction d’âge, de sexe, de couleur de peau, d’origine sociale, de religion, ou d’orientation sexuelle… seules la compétence et l’énergie comptent ! Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures qualifiées et seront ravis d’accompagner tout au long du processus de recrutement, de manière personnalisée un.e candidat.e en situation de handicap qui en ferait la demande.

Publicis France est engagé pour l’égalité des chances et l’équité d’opportunités pour tous et toutes.

description.text:
Description

Build your Career with an Industry Leader

For over a century, Multi-Color Corporation (MCC) has crafted premium labels for the world’s most iconic and recognizable brands. Our labels elevate emotional connections with consumers and help brands stand out in competitive markets. With more than 12,000 teammates in 25+ countries, we come together to make our industry-leading work possible and bring our True Colors to life. Join us at MCC, where every product is Labeled with Care. Learn more at mcclabel.com.

We’re looking for two CI Leads to spearhead our journey toward world-class operational excellence. This high-impact role offers the opportunity to shape the future of our business by embedding Lean principles, aligning strategy with execution, and building a culture of continuous improvement in our European sites. As one of our two CI Leads, you’ll drive enterprise-wide transformation initiatives that deliver measurable business impact.

Your Mission


Lead tactical CI initiatives across multiple sites within our Europe region, ensuring alignment with strategic goals.Implement and sustain Lean tools like visual management, daily tiered accountability, and Kaizen activities.Coach and inspire teams to identify and eliminate waste, solve problems at the root, and take ownership of performance.Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure CI efforts are embedded in daily operations and deliver measurable results.


Your Impact


Deliver projects on time, within scope, and to high operational standards.Establish and maintain CI systems that drive efficiency and reduce waste.Develop KPIs and dashboards to track progress and ensure sustainability.Foster a mindset of continuous learning and improvement across all levels.


What You Bring


Bachelor’s degree in Manufacturing, Engineering, Business, or related field.Proven experience leading Lean, CI, or OpEx initiatives in manufacturing or supply chain.Strong facilitation and coaching skills with a hands-on, Gemba-first mindset.Ability to influence and manage change across diverse teams and cultures.Willingness to travel frequently (up to 75%) to our manufacturing sites spread throughout Europe.Experience in multi-site, multi-country environments.Fluency in a second language relevant to the region.


Why Join Us?


Be part of a global leader in FMCG packaging with a strong commitment to sustainability and innovation.Work in a role that blends strategic thinking with hands-on leadership.Collaborate with passionate professionals across borders.Make a tangible impact on how we operate and grow.


Additional Information

We are looking to fill two roles and candidates can be based in Italy, France, Germany, Poland, Spain or the UK. To apply for this role you must already have the right to live and work in one of these countries and have the ability to travel unrestricted within the wider EMEA region. Visa sponsorship is not provided.

This role undertakes extensive European travel. Preference will be given to candidates who meet the required criteria for this role and who live close to a major international airport with comprehensive connections.

We are a multi-national company where collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. As such, English is our main language of communication and, as such, all applications must be made using the English Language.

Diversity & Inclusion

At MCC, we believe what makes us unique, makes us better. We embrace & care deeply about creating a workplace where our people feel valued and empowered. We are committed to providing an environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We consider our people our best asset and understand the importance of bringing different perspectives. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity/expression or ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We encourage & welcome all genders, people of disability, LGBTQI+ community, refugees & people from culturally & linguistic diverse backgrounds to apply.

detailed_info.title: CI Lead (Europe)
detailed_info.formattedLocation: Couëron, Pays de la Loire, France

description.text:
About Remote

Remote is solving modern organizations’ biggest challenge – navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.

We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.

If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!

What you bring

A solid understanding of payment networks, the mechanics behind payments settlement andExperience working within the bounds of regulatory and compliance requirementsExperience integrating third party payment service providersDemonstrated ability to operate effectively in intense startup or scale-up environments, navigating ambiguity and driving clear outcomesStrong track record of influencing and improving company-wide business metrics through strategic product decisions.A flair for user experience design - you build things beautifully, and they delight customersExecution-oriented, ambitious, and ready to scale your career with RemoteA high agency, low ego mindsetWrites and speaks fluent EnglishIt's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus


Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize global payroll payments solutionsCollaborate with Design and Engineering to create intuitive and user-friendly payment flowsWork with product teams across Remote to ensure salary payments happen on time, every timeEnsure seamless integration with third-party payment providers.Partner with compliance and legal teams to ensure all payment features meet regulatory requirementsFunction effectively across teams, working closely with stakeholders in Operations, Risk, Tax, Legal


Practicals

You'll report to: Group Product ManagerTeam: Payments - Payroll PaymentsTeam size:Location: For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritise applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify: EMEA, APACStart date: As soon as possible


Remote Compensation Philosophy

Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $45,750 - $128,650. USD. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Application process

Interview with recruiterInterview with future managerInterview with team members (no managers present)Bar Raiser InterviewPrior employment verification check 


Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

The annual salary range for this full-time position is

$45,750—$128,650 USD

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

description.text:
🛥️ Who we are
Click&Boat is the leading European boat rental platform. Our marketplace aims to make boating accessible around the world, and to provide private and professional boat owners with additional income from boat rentals.
So far, we are opened for business in more than 50 countries and 600 destinations, and we are also a diverse team of 200 employees from 20 different countries.
Our headquarters are based in Paris on a barge moored on the Seine River, and we also have a second office of 100 people based in Barcelona.
🤘 How do we do it?
At Click&Boat, we believe in empowering our developers to build the company's strategy and shape the future of boating. People joining Click&Boat are always delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:
Product-Focused: Our focus is on delivering exceptional products that truly benefit our users.Data-Driven: We prioritize data-driven decisions to ensure our products meet user needs.Tech for Purpose: We believe technology is a means to solve real problems, not an end.Full Empowerment: Our developers are not just coders; they are strategic partners who have a direct impact on our product roadmap and company objectives.Full Transparency: You'll have access to the entire company strategy and be a key player in achieving our OKRs.Boring architecture: we are always seeking the simplest solution for our complex challenges… and that is not simple! (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=msnQbIQFsw4 if you want to know more).Diversity : We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace, where all individuals are valued and respected.
⭐️ The Engineering Team ⭐️
Our engineering team is composed of 4 agile squads, each responsible for a functional scope. We build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our users (boat owners, customers renting boats, and Click&Boat internal teams).
By joining Click&Boat, you’ll meet a team of talented, committed, and passionate engineers with a lot of product interactions. You'll have the opportunity to take ownership of projects quickly, whilst being mentored by talented senior engineers who have made significant contributions at renowned companies like Doctolib (VP of Engineering, Engineering Director & Principal Engineer) and ManoMano.
We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems! Being a developer at Click&Boat means more than just coding. Our developers are also responsible for preparing their features, collaborating with product managers and designers, monitoring and validating features once in production.
Our stack includes up-to-date Angular, PHP, MySQL, Symfony, and we push to production twice a day!
Click here if you to know more about us!https://www.welcometothejungle.com/fr/companies/click-and-boat-group/teamhttps://www.linkedin.com/company/click-&-boat/posts/?feedView=videos
⭐️ Are you the one we’re looking for? ⭐️
To support the opening of a new squad, we are looking to recruit an experienced engineering manager.
You're a Great Fit at Click&Boat if:You enjoy delivering features that impact the company's KPIs ;You have solid experience delivering high-quality feature ;You have at least 2 years of experience managing a technical team ;You enjoy supporting and coaching your individual contributors, providing regular feedback to help them grow in line with company-wide objectives ;You feel comfortable working with various stakeholders across the company ;You’re a clear and effective communicator with your teammates.
What We Value :Customer Focus: Understanding our customers and fully embracing our mission will make your journey with us exciting and fulfilling.Curiosity Acumen: We seek individuals who are curious and eager to learn.Diversity and Inclusion: We value and actively promote gender diversity and inclusion. We appreciate candidates with diverse backgrounds.Boat Interest: We appreciate candidates with a background or interest in boating. If you share our passion for the industry, it's a significant advantage.
Make sure to highlight these qualities during your interviews.
🙌 Perks & Benefits
At Click&Boat, we believe that enjoying your work is essential. This is why Click&Boaters are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy and efficient, and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.
Therefore, we offer:Remote policy: As a developer, you'll have the opportunity to embrace remote work with our remote-friendly policy. To foster team synergy and maintain strong connections, we request that developers come to our Paris houseboat for three consecutive days each month.Competitive Salaries: We believe in recognizing and rewarding the talent and dedication of our team members.Professional Growth: Beyond technical skills, we'll support your growth as a strategic thinker and decision-makerBoating Perks: We offer a free boat license and often organize boat trips with the team.Benefits: Enjoy lunch vouchers (Swile), private insurance (Alan), and 8 extra days off.Have Fun at Click&Boat: we make the most of our in-office days by enjoying meals together on our fabulous houseboat, organizing after-work events, and holding annual team-building events. It’s not a coincidence that we have been awarded the “Happy at Work!” badge.
Ready to take the helm and drive our success? Join Click&Boat and be part of a team where your voice truly matters. Let's navigate the future of boating together!

So far, we are opened for business in more than 50 countries and 600 destinations, and we are also a diverse team of 200 employees from 20 different countries.
Our headquarters are based in Paris on a barge moored on the Seine River, and we also have a second office of 100 people based in Barcelona.
🤘 How do we do it?
At Click&Boat, we believe in empowering our developers to build the company's strategy and shape the future of boating. People joining Click&Boat are always delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:
Product-Focused: Our focus is on delivering exceptional products that truly benefit our users.Data-Driven: We prioritize data-driven decisions to ensure our products meet user needs.Tech for Purpose: We believe technology is a means to solve real problems, not an end.Full Empowerment: Our developers are not just coders; they are strategic partners who have a direct impact on our product roadmap and company objectives.Full Transparency: You'll have access to the entire company strategy and be a key player in achieving our OKRs.Boring architecture: we are always seeking the simplest solution for our complex challenges… and that is not simple! (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=msnQbIQFsw4 if you want to know more).Diversity : We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace, where all individuals are valued and respected.
⭐️ The Engineering Team ⭐️
Our engineering team is composed of 4 agile squads, each responsible for a functional scope. We build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our users (boat owners, customers renting boats, and Click&Boat internal teams).
By joining Click&Boat, you’ll meet a team of talented, committed, and passionate engineers with a lot of product interactions. You'll have the opportunity to take ownership of projects quickly, whilst being mentored by talented senior engineers who have made significant contributions at renowned companies like Doctolib (VP of Engineering, Engineering Director & Principal Engineer) and ManoMano.
We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems! Being a developer at Click&Boat means more than just coding. Our developers are also responsible for preparing their features, collaborating with product managers and designers, monitoring and validating features once in production.
Our stack includes up-to-date Angular, PHP, MySQL, Symfony, and we push to production twice a day!
Click here if you to know more about us!https://www.welcometothejungle.com/fr/companies/click-and-boat-group/teamhttps://www.linkedin.com/company/click-&-boat/posts/?feedView=videos
⭐️ Are you the one we’re looking for? ⭐️
To support the opening of a new squad, we are looking to recruit an experienced engineering manager.
You're a Great Fit at Click&Boat if:You enjoy delivering features that impact the company's KPIs ;You have solid experience delivering high-quality feature ;You have at least 2 years of experience managing a technical team ;You enjoy supporting and coaching your individual contributors, providing regular feedback to help them grow in line with company-wide objectives ;You feel comfortable working with various stakeholders across the company ;You’re a clear and effective communicator with your teammates.
What We Value :Customer Focus: Understanding our customers and fully embracing our mission will make your journey with us exciting and fulfilling.Curiosity Acumen: We seek individuals who are curious and eager to learn.Diversity and Inclusion: We value and actively promote gender diversity and inclusion. We appreciate candidates with diverse backgrounds.Boat Interest: We appreciate candidates with a background or interest in boating. If you share our passion for the industry, it's a significant advantage.
Make sure to highlight these qualities during your interviews.
🙌 Perks & Benefits
At Click&Boat, we believe that enjoying your work is essential. This is why Click&Boaters are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy and efficient, and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.
Therefore, we offer:Remote policy: As a developer, you'll have the opportunity to embrace remote work with our remote-friendly policy. To foster team synergy and maintain strong connections, we request that developers come to our Paris houseboat for three consecutive days each month.Competitive Salaries: We believe in recognizing and rewarding the talent and dedication of our team members.Professional Growth: Beyond technical skills, we'll support your growth as a strategic thinker and decision-makerBoating Perks: We offer a free boat license and often organize boat trips with the team.Benefits: Enjoy lunch vouchers (Swile), private insurance (Alan), and 8 extra days off.Have Fun at Click&Boat: we make the most of our in-office days by enjoying meals together on our fabulous houseboat, organizing after-work events, and holding annual team-building events. It’s not a coincidence that we have been awarded the “Happy at Work!” badge.
Ready to take the helm and drive our success? Join Click&Boat and be part of a team where your voice truly matters. Let's navigate the future of boating together!

description.text:
Description Du Poste

Overview :

On ne cherche pas un chef de projet standard – on cherche un vrai chef d’orchestre. Un profil ultra-organisé, capable de cadrer les besoins, structurer les projets, coordonner les équipes, et livrer à temps. Quelqu’un de rigoureux, autonome, à l’aise dans un environnement rapide, et qui a un oeil créatif pour donner des retours à nos créatrices de contenu.

Pourquoi rejoindre Reach :

REACH est un accélérateur e-commerce spécialisé dans l'hyper-croissance. On emmène les marques de 1M€ à 30M€+ de chiffre d'affaires par an avec un modèle 100% à la performance.

Notre expérience est dans la production de contenu publicitaire (UGC) et organique pour les marques avec des clients comme Respire, Embryolisse, Hygée et Epycure.

Après 8 ans d'expérience aux États-Unis et 50 millions d'euros dépensés en publicités, on a développé un playbook unique pour scaler des marques DTC.

Quelques résultats récents :

 De 100K€ à 1.9M€ par mois en 90 jours De 10K€ à 800K€ par mois en 9 mois De 200K€ à 600K€ en 6 mois

Pourquoi on a besoin de toi :

REACH s’est développé rapidement et on entre dans une nouvelle phase de croissance. On cherche un Chef de Projet Créatif capable de coordonner la production de 100+ concepts vidéos par mois, échanger avec les créatrices de contenu, coordonner avec les Scriptwriters et les Monteurs, et s'assurer de la qualité du contenu produit.

Tu travailleras en direct avec Ryan, notre Creative Ops Manager, ainsi que Alessandro, notre CEO C’est l’opportunité de travailler avec la meilleure équipe e-commerce de France.

Tes missions :

 Gestion des créatrices de contenuAssurer une communication fluide avec les créatrices tout au long des projets.S’assurer que les créatrices respectent les deadlines fixés et relancer si nécessaire.Vérifier que les contenus livrés respectent les briefs fournis (ton, style, objectifs).Faire des retours constructifs et demander des modifications ou des refontes si la qualité ou les attentes ne sont pas atteintes. Coordination des campagnes UGCPlanifier et organiser la production des contenus en suivant les plannings établis.Assurer le suivi opérationnel des projets et garantir le respect des échéances.Gérer les différents livrables pour chaque projet et centraliser les retours avant validation.Suivi de la qualité des contenusContrôler les contenus pour garantir qu’ils répondent aux standards de la marque.Veiller à la cohérence des productions avec l’identité visuelle et le storytelling définis.Faire un suivi rigoureux pour éviter toute incohérence ou erreur dans les livrables.
Profil recherché :

Minimum 3 ans d’expérience en gestion de projetPossibilité de se déplacer à Paris lors de tournages vidéosIdéalement : Expérience UGC / TikTok / vidéos publicitaires ou organiquesOptionnel : Expérience en e-commerce ou agence

Rémunération :

Rémunération : 40 000 € à 50 000 € brut par an*Bonus de performance annuelLa rémunération est ajustable en fonction du profil.

Ce rôle est pour toi si :

 Tu as déjà démontré des compétences exceptionnelles en coordination, gestion de projet ou production créative  Tu es rigoureux·se, clair·e, transparent·e : pas de bullshit, que des résultats  Tu es très fort(e) dans un environnement rapide, exigeant, ultra-compétitif  Tu veux voir l’impact concret de ton travail dans la croissance des marques qu’on accompagne  Tu incarnes l’organisation, l’exécution et la culture REACH au quotidien – même sous pression 

Opportunités de développement :

Reach accélère fortement et il y aura un besoin d'un deuxième Creative Ops Manager :

Recruter et manager 2-3 Chef de Projet CréatifsGagner en responsabilités en gérant une équipe de 10 à 15 monteursCollaborer directement avec le Head of Growth et le CEO sur des sujets créatifs stratégiques

Étapes de recrutement

 Entretien vidéo via Workable pour avoir plus d'informations sur ton parcours et ton profil Appel de 30 minutes avec Ryan, Creative Ops Manager, et Antoine, Head of Ops, afin d'être sûrs que nos attentes sont bien alignées Entretien de 30 minutes avec Alessandro, notre CEO, pour discuter en détail de ton background, tes motivations, tes ambitions et répondre également à tes questions

description.text:
As a Client Relationship Manager at Designity, you will drive strong client relationships, ensuring satisfaction while identifying opportunities to upsell services that align with client goals. You'll be the primary point of contact from day one, helping clients get the most out of their experience while playing a direct role in Designity’s growth.
You will also leverage AI-powered tools to enhance client management, improve communication, and support a seamless service experience. Your ability to anticipate client needs, identify growth opportunities, and collaborate cross-functionally will be key to delivering lasting value.
Designity is a Creative-as-a-Service (CaaS) platform that empowers businesses with a flexible, high-quality, and scalable alternative to traditional agencies and in-house teams.
Our unique model connects marketing and creative leaders with the top 3% of US-based creative and marketing talent, all led by experienced Creative Directors, Project Managers, and Marketing Strategists. Through our collaborative platform, we streamline the creative process, ensuring fast, high-impact execution without the inefficiencies of hiring in-house or the high costs of traditional agencies.
Brands like Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels trust Designity to handle their design and marketing needs—proving that there's a better way to scale creativity. Unlike in-house hiring, which is expensive and skill-limiting, or marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr, which lack reliability and creative oversight, Designity delivers a seamless, results-driven approach that makes creative collaboration effortless.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:Set clients up for success by aligning account setup, project scope, and services with their specific goals and business needsProactively identify signs of client dissatisfaction and resolve them with thoughtful, creative solutionsIdentify upselling opportunities based on client needs, usage patterns, and business goalsBuild long-term client relationships by maintaining strategic alignment and consistent communicationAnalyze client health metrics to reduce churn and maximize lifetime valueBuild a client satisfaction tracking system to monitor engagement and sentiment over timeTrack and report on client satisfaction and engagement levelsFacilitate communication between clients and internal teams to preempt and solve problemsOnboard new clients and handle day-to-day requests from current clientsLeverage AI tools to support client insights, communication, and service optimization
REQUIREMENTS:5+ years in client-facing roles such as customer success, account management, or relationship managementProven ability to identify upselling opportunities and expand client engagementExperience working with marketing or design firmsExperience using AI-powered platforms or tools as part of a modern client management workflowStrong problem-solving skills with a commitment to follow-through on all communicationsExcellent communicator with strong sales instincts and interpersonal skillsProactive relationship-builder who collaborates well with internal teams and clientsHighly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple accounts simultaneouslyThrives in fast-paced, high-growth environments (especially startups)Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field
BENEFITS:Join a company at the perfect moment! Career making opportunity.Work remotely full-time, within a virtual office environment.Unwind during the flexible PTO (available after 90 days), and company holidays.Professional growth opportunities and ongoing training.Enjoy dedicated focus times designed to boost your productivity and creativity.Competitive salary plus performance-based incentives.Fast-moving, values-driven, globally distributed team.
In order to be considered for this position, you need to complete the application process at www.designity.com/careers/client-relationship-manager
Please do NOT follow up on your application. We will be in touch within 2-3 weeks if you're qualified. At Designity, employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, valuing diversity in culture, perspectives, skills, and experiences, which strengthens our team, clients, and products. Be cautious when applying. Official communications from Designity will come only from the Designity.com domain. We will never request payment details. Beware of scammers using fake domains like Designity.team to attempt fraud.

basic_info.title: Chef de projet Marketing Généraliste H/F

description.text:
Fnac Darty, un leader européen de la distribution omnicanal.

Acteur omnicanal et européen, spécialisé dans la distribution de produits techniques et d'électroménager, de biens culturels et de loisirs, et leader du service après-vente présent dans 13 pays, avec 1010 magasins dans le monde, 11 millions d'abonnés/adhérents et 27 millions de visiteurs uniques cumulés par mois sur nos sites marchands.
Nos 25 000 collaborateurs sont notre meilleur atout. Ils font vivre la raison d'être du Groupe au quotidien, qui consiste à « s'engager pour un choix éclairé et une consommation durable », auprès de nos clients.

Fnac Darty recrute partout en France des talents aux profils, formations et expériences très diverses, que ce soit pour ses magasins, mais aussi dans les domaines de la logistique, de la réparation et service après-vente, de la livraison, de la relation client ou encore pour ses fonctions support. Votre prochain emploi vous attend chez Fnac Darty !
 
 Au sein de la Direction Marketing, le/la Chef(fe) de projet Marketing Généraliste joue un rôle clé dans la coordination, la priorisation et la mise en oeuvre des actions marketing en lien avec la Marketing Factory (équipes Print & Webdesign). Il/elle agit comme un point de contact central entre les équipes métiers, les partenaires internes et externes, et les équipes de production.

Missions principales :
- Arbitrage et priorisation des demandes
- Collaborer avec l'Animco et les équipes concernées pour arbitrer et prioriser les demandes adressées à la Marketing Factory.
- Évaluer la pertinence, l'impact et la faisabilité des demandes en fonction des ressources disponibles et des objectifs commerciaux.
- Cadrage des besoins
- Cadrer et challenger les besoins exprimés par les équipes émettrices (investissements, volume de supports, délais).
- Instruire les demandes internes afin d'évaluer leur niveau de priorité et les ressources nécessaires à leur réalisation.
- Coordination avec la Marketing Factory (Publicis)
- Briefer le Lead Marketing Factory sur les besoins identifiés afin de projeter le bon niveau de ressources
- Assurer le suivi du budget avec le Lead Marketing Factory
- Participation aux instances de pilotage
- Participer activement aux réunions hebdomadaires d'animation commerciale et aux points mensuels avec la Direction Commerciale.
- Gestion de la relation avec les partenaires externes
- Cadrer la relation commerciale avec les prestataires externes en lien avec les métiers Print & Webdesign.
- Garantir la qualité et la ponctualité des livrables produits par la Marketing Factory. 
 
 Profil recherché :

- Vous avez obligatoirement une expérience sur un même type de poste et environnement de 7 à 10 ans.
- Excellentes capacités de coordination, d'analyse et de priorisation.
- Aisance relationnelle et sens du travail en équipe.
- Connaissance des environnements Print & Webdesign appréciée.
- Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement dynamique et multi-interlocuteurs.
 Ref : 26420088

basic_info.title: CDD _ Responsable créatif - Studio créa et photo Marketing

description.text:
Rattaché(e) au Département Contenus, la personne travaille en coordination quotidienne avec : Responsable Contenus Édito & Social Media, PAC Com, équipe CRM, e-commerce, agences partenaires (créa, média, social, prépresse, déclinaisons…),… et tous les autres « clients » internes.

 La personne encadre : le studio créa : webdesigners, DA, maquettistes, alternants/stagiaires, freelances le studio photo : coordination de l’activité et management de Laurence et de son équipe (alternante, freelance) PILOTAGE CRÉATIF & COHÉRENCE VISUELLE Porter une vision créative cohérente avec l’identité de Monoprix, en veillant à la qualité visuelle et à la justesse éditoriale des contenus produits (forme + fond) Proposer des partis-pris graphiques et éditoriaux différenciants pour nourrir les contenus de la marque (media, e-com, print…) Participer à la construction créative des temps forts, opérations 360 et shootings, en lien avec les autres pôles Être capable de prendre le relais ou d’ajuster une direction créative fournie par l’agence, notamment si elle nécessite d’être enrichie, réinterprétée ou recentrée MANAGEMENT DU STUDIO CRÉA & DU STUDIO PHOTO Organiser et prioriser la charge de travail du studio créa (briefs, plannings, rétroplannings, validations) Encadrer les talents internes (DA, webdesigners, maquettistes, alternants…) et assurer leur montée en compétences si besoin. Coordonner les freelances selon les besoins. Coordonner les missions confiées aux prestataires externes (déclinaison de masters) Superviser l’activité du studio photo piloté par Laurence, en assurant le bon niveau de qualité des productions visuelles (shootings, packshots, ambiance) Piloter les budgets alloués à chaque studio, en lien avec le contrôle de gestion et les priorités du département Contenus Garantir un bon niveau de qualité, de réactivité et d’optimisation dans la production interne


3. RELATION AGENCES & PARTENAIRES

 Être le point de contact créatif auprès : de l’agence créa/com sur les grandes campagnes (en tant que référent interne et garant de cohérence) de l’agence média/social pour les formats paid (VOL, social ads, bannières…), en lien avec les formats spécifiques au média des agences partenaires pour les déclinaisons des masters,… Traduire ou adapter les concepts agences en supports opérationnels, tout en préservant l’identité de la marque Garantir la cohérence créative entre les productions internes et externes INNOVATION & EFFICIENCE CRÉATIVE Mettre en place des outils et process d’optimisation (templates, automatisation, bibliothèques créatives, workflows) Explorer les opportunités offertes par l’IA générative (visuelle, motion, sound design…) et les intégrer dans les pratiques du studio Porter une logique d’efficience : produire mieux, plus vite, sans sacrifier la qualité créative Industrialiser certains formats pour les besoins récurrents (e-commerce, retail, réseaux


Profil De Candidat Recherché

 Curiosité créative, appétence forte pour l’innovation et les nouvelles technologies (dont IA) Leadership positif, esprit d’équipe, capacité à encadrer des profils créatifs variés Exigence esthétique, culture de marque et goût pour le détail Organisation, agilité, autonomie et rigueur dans la gestion des projets Excellent relationnel Expérience confirmée (+ 8 ans) en direction artistique, et management de studio Culture visuelle lifestyle / retail / beauté / mode Solide expérience dans des environnements pluridisciplinaires (agence ou studio intégré) Vision stratégique, capacité à créer, à produire et à piloter Forte appétence pour les nouveaux usages, la création agile et les outils IA

 Maîtrise des supports multi-canaux : print, digital, e-commerce, motion, social paid Grande expérience en direction artistique et en conception créative 360 : idées, mots, image Solide culture graphique et sens du branding Bonne connaissance des o

description.text:
Title: Account Executive – Aviation SoftwareLocation: Remote (Europe-based)Salary: Open and flexible depending on the right candidateJob Type: Full-time
Are you passionate about aviation and skilled in building long-term client relationships? We'relooking for an experienced Account Executive to manage and grow a portfolio of aviation customers across Europe. This is your chance to work with a high-growth group of aviation software businesses, delivering innovative solutions to top-tier clients.
About the RoleIn this key role, you’ll be responsible for managing approximately 40 existing accounts in the aviationsector, driving retention, growth, and satisfaction. You'll play a strategic part in upselling and cross selling a suite of cutting-edge aviation software products across multiple business units. The role isremote, but candidates must be fluent in French and English, and based in Europe.
What We’re Looking For• Must be fluent in both French and English, written and spoken.• Must have a strong understanding of SaaS or aviation-related software.• Must have solid aviation experience, ideally in maintenance or technical services.• Demonstrated success managing complex, consultative accounts.• Comfortable working remotely and across time zones.

description.text:
Rejoindre INTERSPORT, c’est bien plus qu’un job : c’est vivre une aventure sportive humaine et passionnante !

Chez nous, le sport ne se vend pas, il se partage. Depuis plus de 100 ans, notre mission est claire : rendre le sport accessible à tous, plus solidaire, plus durable, et surtout plus vivant.

INTERSPORT, c’est une coopérative unique en France : 938 magasins, 300 entrepreneurs engagés, et plus de 19 000 collaborateurs qui placent le collectif, la passion et l’engagement au cœur de tout ce qu’ils font.

Notre force ? Un ancrage territorial fort qui nous permet d’apporter les plus grandes marques de sport aux quatre coins de la France, de soutenir plus de 12 000 clubs locaux et de fabriquer les vélos de demain avec la Manufacture Française du Cycle, 1er assembleur de cycles en France.

Tu parles mode, marge et merchandising ?

Tu apprécies les challenges et tu aimes travailler dans un cadre de travail qui rime avec bonne ambiance, entraide et partage ?

Tu es à l’aise entre un plan de collection, une négociation fournisseur et un tableur Excel ?

Tu as envie de t’éclater dans ton futur poste ?

Alors ce poste est fait pour toi ! On cherche notre prochain Jedi Category Manager (H/F) qui veut prendre les rênes d’une catégorie mode qui ne demande qu’à exploser.

Tes Responsabilités

Sous la responsabilité du Directeur des Achats, ton objectif est simple : structurer, organiser et négocier, tout ça dans l’esprit INTERSPORT et en adéquation avec la stratégie commerciale.

Tes responsabilités comprennent des missions achats et commerciales dans l’objectif de proposer une offre attractive, rentable et adaptée aux envies des clients comme à la réalité du terrain.

Tes missions achats : Tu construis une stratégie d’achat en lien avec ton Directeur, proposant une offre cohérente, tendance et avec des budgets adaptés par segment.Tu trouves les bons produits et les bons fournisseurs, que ce soit pour les collections ou les fins de série.Tu conçois l’offre produit : assortiment, capacité marchande par magasin, modules d’achats, etc.Tu négocies les achats : prix, délais, conditions de reprise, garanties, etc. que ce soit en central ou en direct.Tu suis de près les conditions fournisseurs, qu’elles viennent de la centrale ou de tes propres négociations.Tes missions commerciales : Tu analyses les ventes et tu pilotes la dynamique commerciale, en lien avec ton Directeur, pour que les rayons soient toujours attractifs.Tu assures une gestion des stocks constante et bien pensée (les ruptures ou les invendus c’est terminé).Tu négocies les produits catalogues et les promos qui peuvent faire LA différence.Tu fais du benchmark sur le marché, la concurrence, les tendances, les innovations, et tu proposes des idées novatrices.Tu es proactif et tu te déplaces dans les magasins ; l’objectif sera de les faire adhérer à ta vision produit et volume.Tu assures un reporting clair et tu pratiques aux RDV achats & Journées d’Achats.

Ton Profil

Ce que l’on cherche :Tu es titulaire à minima d’un BAC+3 dans le domaine des achats / du commerce.Tu justifies d’une première expérience réussie en category management, achat ou merchandising (retail, mode, textile, multisport – loisir).Tu es motivé par le challenge et les responsabilités. Parler performance fait partie de ton ADN.Tu sais travailler en équipe, créer du lien facilement. Tu es à l’aise avec les fournisseurs, les collègues, les échanges en mode direct et efficace.Tu es résistant à la pression et force de proposition.Tu es organisé, rigoureux, avec un bon esprit d’analyse et de synthèse.Tes compétences : Tu es à l’aise avec les chiffres (analyse, interprétation, résultats, etc.) et tu maîtrises Excel (tableau croisé dynamique, formules, graphiques, etc.).Tu justifies d’un bon niveau d’anglais (commercial).Tu disposes d’une bonne vision produit et une sensibilité mode.Tu connais les attentes des consommateurs.Tu es doté d’un bon sens commercial, tu sais convaincre tes interlocuteurs, défendre tes choix; la négociation ne te fait pas peur.

Ton petit plus ? Connaître le logiciel Nosymag.

Ce Qu’on Te Propose

Un Groupe en pleine transformation, agile et ambitieux.Un cadre de travail avec des collègues sympas et passionnés par le produit et toujours open aux nouvelles idées.Des bureaux modernes et des moments de convivialité.Le développement de tes compétences.Rémunération à définir selon profil, tickets resto, mutuelle et prévoyance, réductions pour des achats dans nos magasins, prime annuelle (sur objectifs).

Tu veux un job qui a du sens ? Tu veux faire bouger les lignes ?

Alors, viens mouiller le maillot avec nous. Chez INTERSPORT, on gagne ensemble.

Bienvenue dans la Team Andali (16 magasins) !

description.text:
iMerit is looking for experienced and dedicated bilingual Language Leadsto manage remote teams of language experts working on diverse annotation projects within theGenerative AI space. The Language Lead will ensure linguistic accuracy, context relevance,and ethical compliance in language-specific annotation tasks, contributing to high-qualitydatasets.
Role Responsibilities: Lead and supervise remote bilingual teams responsible for linguistic annotations and content quality reviews.Oversee the annotation quality, providing linguistic and cultural insights specific to the target language.Conduct regular linguistic quality assessments, provide feedback, and implement improvements.Collaborate closely with project managers, solution architects, and training teams to effectively translate, understand, and communicate guidelines, standards, and objectives.Generate and interpret linguistic analysis reports and deliver actionable insights for quality enhancements.Assist in quality assurance processes, ensuring alignment with ethical standards and project requirements.Facilitate team meetings and foster an inclusive, collaborative environment for remote contributors.
Skills & Competencies:Excellent bilingual communication skills, including native proficiency in the target language and professional proficiency in English.Strong analytical and linguistic skills, including identifying ambiguity, inaccuracies, and linguistic nuances.Demonstrated leadership and team management capabilities, especially with remote and multicultural teams.Highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks effectively.Ability to quickly adapt and navigate new annotation platforms and software tools.Proactively updated on Generative AI, NLP, and linguistic annotation methodologies advancements.
Requirements:Native-level proficiency in the target language and professional working proficiency in English.Bachelor's degree in Linguistics, Cognitive Science, Foreign Languages, or related fields.Minimum 2-3 years of experience in linguistic annotation, data annotation, or similar roles.Previous experience in managing remote teams or projects.Proven experience working with data annotation tools.Ability to commit to the duration of specific project contracts, including onboarding and training periods.
What We Offer:Collaborative and dynamic international work environment.Opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge AI projects.Competitive compensation with flexible working arrangements.Continuous professional development opportunities.
Join iMerit and contribute to the forefront of linguistic innovation in Generative AI. If you arepassionate about language, technology, and leading diverse remote teams, we welcome yourapplication!

description.text:
DIRECTOR OF INTERNATIONAL SALES – BASED IN EUROPE
On behalf of our client, Power Technologies, we are seeking a results-driven Director of International Sales to join their team in Europe (remote position). The ideal candidate can speak either German or French (or both), and will have a demonstrated ability to set up distribution, lead channel development initiatives, manage partner relationships, and drive revenue growth through effective sales execution and team collaboration.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Power Technologies designs and markets high-quality products that support the smart charging, network management, and security of mobile digital devices. Mobile devices are continuously evolving and transforming the workflows and operating models of every industry. Our products enable organizations to deploy critical digital tools to their teams with confidence that the devices are ready for use, resulting in increased performance and productivity. At Power Technologies, we bring technology and connection to life. Company website: https://powertechnologies.com/
POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Chief Sales & Marketing Officer, who is based in the U.S, this role is responsible for managing and expanding our international sales operations across distribution, reseller, and end-user channels within the Education and Commercial sectors (including manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare).This position includes direct management of the international sales team, providing leadership, coaching, and performance oversight to ensure alignment with international sales objectives. The Director will coordinate regional sales strategies, monitor team KPIs, and foster a high-performance culture across geographically dispersed markets. In addition, the role will oversee partner enablement, deliver ongoing training, and ensure consistent execution of go-to-market plans.This position has a requirement of having direct experience in the EdTech market, working with distributors and resellers.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide day-to-day leadership and direction to international sales team members, setting clear priorities, coaching for performance, and fostering a culture of accountability and collaboration in alignment with international sales goals.Translate high-level business strategy into measurable goals and KPIs, ensuring alignment across team members, partners, and internal stakeholders.Develop and execute international sales strategies and tactical plans aligned with annual revenue and profit targets, to expand distribution, reseller, and end-user partnerships, with a strong emphasis on EdTech, ICT, and commercial markets.Manage the international sales and expense budget, tracking performance monthly and adjusting tactics to stay on target.Plan and conduct regular business reviews with distribution partners, ensuring alignment on product updates, brand strategy, marketing activities, and performance metrics.Collaborate with distribution leadership and sales reps to ensure effective lead capture, deal closure, and account management that supports market share growth.Design and implement regional sales and marketing plans, tailored to international markets, to increase visibility and penetration within value-added distributor networks.Ensure the sales team and channel partners are fully trained and equipped with product knowledge, application expertise, and the ability to effectively communicate value to customers and partners.Identify and drive cross-sell and upsell opportunities within the distribution channel to maximize revenue per account.Partner with marketing teams to co-develop impactful campaigns, track ROI, and apply insights to optimize future initiatives.Manage the end-to-end order process, including reviewing WSD purchase orders and coordinating with internal teams to ensure timely fulfillment and communication.Provide weekly report of pipeline, forecast, and activities within NetSuite CRM, including but not limited to sales-driven activities and communication associated with channel partners and end users, forecast, manage, and report on ongoing sales and pipeline activity.Leverage regional data and analytics to understand international customer behavior and refine sales strategies accordingly.Identify and communicate regularly with CSMO on new business and product opportunities within international education and commercial markets, contributing to product development and innovation.Deliver compelling product demonstrations and presentations, showcasing technical knowledge and market-specific benefits of the Power Technologies product line.Represent the company at international trade shows and exhibitions, supporting brand visibility and lead generation efforts.Support the creation of tailored sales tools and presentations, enabling partners to effectively position and sell Power Technologies solutions.Coordinate cross-functionally with internal departments (Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives and customer satisfaction.Participate in building and reinforcing company culture consistent with company purpose and values.Hold self and others accountable to conduct business in a manner compliant with Power Technologies’ policies and procedures and internal controls applicable to their role.Other duties as assigned.
CANDIDATE PROFILE:
The successful candidate will bring energy, initiative, and a collaborative mindset to the role. We are looking for a confident, competitive, and goal-oriented professional with a track record of building strong partnerships, managing remote teams, and delivering measurable results. This role requires a proactive approach to business development, with a focus on expanding global channel relationships and supporting the growth of the company’s product lines in international markets.
EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA, BS degree is required.5+ years related sales or experience leading multi-person, multi-region international sales teams with demonstrated ability to navigate complex reseller and distributor organizations, build distribution through Warehouse Stocking Distributors and Resellers specifically within EdTech market is required.Excellent sales skills and sales leadership capabilities; exceptionally strong negotiation and consultation skillsAbility to deliver results against sales targets, with a proven record.Proven ability to engage in middle, senior, and C-level management structures.An articulate and effective communicator with demonstrated negotiation skills across multiple services and functions.Experienced in functioning effectively in an international environment.Ability to respond and work well under pressure and change.Proactive, highly organized, and detail-oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively, supporting multiple channel partners.Excellent presentation skillsStrong computer skills – specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.CRM experience required; NetSuite experience is a bonus.Proficient in English and German, multilingual a plusAbility to travel up to 60% internationally.

and penetration within value-added distributor networks.Ensure the sales team and channel partners are fully trained and equipped with product knowledge, application expertise, and the ability to effectively communicate value to customers and partners.Identify and drive cross-sell and upsell opportunities within the distribution channel to maximize revenue per account.Partner with marketing teams to co-develop impactful campaigns, track ROI, and apply insights to optimize future initiatives.Manage the end-to-end order process, including reviewing WSD purchase orders and coordinating with internal teams to ensure timely fulfillment and communication.Provide weekly report of pipeline, forecast, and activities within NetSuite CRM, including but not limited to sales-driven activities and communication associated with channel partners and end users, forecast, manage, and report on ongoing sales and pipeline activity.Leverage regional data and analytics to understand international customer behavior and refine sales strategies accordingly.Identify and communicate regularly with CSMO on new business and product opportunities within international education and commercial markets, contributing to product development and innovation.Deliver compelling product demonstrations and presentations, showcasing technical knowledge and market-specific benefits of the Power Technologies product line.Represent the company at international trade shows and exhibitions, supporting brand visibility and lead generation efforts.Support the creation of tailored sales tools and presentations, enabling partners to effectively position and sell Power Technologies solutions.Coordinate cross-functionally with internal departments (Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives and customer satisfaction.Participate in building and reinforcing company culture consistent with company purpose and values.Hold self and others accountable to conduct business in a manner compliant with Power Technologies’ policies and procedures and internal controls applicable to their role.Other duties as assigned.
CANDIDATE PROFILE:
The successful candidate will bring energy, initiative, and a collaborative mindset to the role. We are looking for a confident, competitive, and goal-oriented professional with a track record of building strong partnerships, managing remote teams, and delivering measurable results. This role requires a proactive approach to business development, with a focus on expanding global channel relationships and supporting the growth of the company’s product lines in international markets.
EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA, BS degree is required.5+ years related sales or experience leading multi-person, multi-region international sales teams with demonstrated ability to navigate complex reseller and distributor organizations, build distribution through Warehouse Stocking Distributors and Resellers specifically within EdTech market is required.Excellent sales skills and sales leadership capabilities; exceptionally strong negotiation and consultation skillsAbility to deliver results against sales targets, with a proven record.Proven ability to engage in middle, senior, and C-level management structures.An articulate and effective communicator with demonstrated negotiation skills across multiple services and functions.Experienced in functioning effectively in an international environment.Ability to respond and work well under pressure and change.Proactive, highly organized, and detail-oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively, supporting multiple channel partners.Excellent presentation skillsStrong computer skills – specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.CRM experience required; NetSuite experience is a bonus.Proficient in English and German, multilingual a plusAbility to travel up to 60% internationally.

basic_info.title: Assistant(e) marketing et Communication en Alternance

description.text:
Description du poste
Êtes-vous à la recherche d'une opportunité d'alternance dans le domaine du marketing et de la communication à TOULOUSE (31) ?
L'école Talia vous propose une formation diplômante reconnue par l'État en marketing et communication, vous permettant d'obtenir un Bac à Bac+5.
Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un(e) alternant(e) pour occuper un poste polyvalent au sein de notre équipe marketing et communication. Vos missions consisteront à :
Participer à la conception et à la mise en œuvre de stratégies marketing ;Contribuer à l'élaboration de campagnes publicitaires et promotionnelles ;Analyser les données du marché pour identifier des opportunités ;Gérer les contenus sur les plateformes en ligne et les réseaux sociaux ;Collaborer avec les équipes internes pour assurer la cohérence de la communication.
Nous recherchons des personnes motivées, créatives, dotées d'un esprit analytique et ayant un intérêt marqué pour le domaine du marketing. Si vous êtes disponible immédiatement, cette opportunité est faite pour vous !
L'entreprise partenaire prendra en charge les frais de votre alternance, et vous serez rémunéré(e) pour votre travail sur place. Rejoignez notre équipe pour développer vos compétences dans le domaine du marketing et acquérir une expérience professionnelle solide.
N'attendez plus, postulez dès maintenant pour cette opportunité de formation et d'emploi en alternance !

description.text: Flight Attendant | Full-Time | Remote Onboarding (EMEA Region)We are a trusted recruitment partner dedicated to connecting exceptional talent with world-class organizations. On behalf of a leading international airline, we are seeking motivated and service-oriented Flight Attendants to join a global team known for delivering excellence in aviation. This is a full-time opportunity, open to candidates across the EMEA region, with remote onboarding and training provided.About the RoleAs a Flight Attendant, you will play a vital role in creating a safe, comfortable, and memorable travel experience for passengers. You will be part of a diverse and dynamic crew, ensuring safety standards are upheld while providing outstanding service that reflects the airline’s global reputation. This role is ideal for individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy working with people from different cultures, and are passionate about delivering exceptional service.Key ResponsibilitiesEnsure compliance with all in-flight safety regulations, procedures, and protocols.Deliver professional, attentive service to passengers while anticipating and responding to their needs.Conduct safety demonstrations and assist passengers during boarding, in-flight service, and disembarkation.Handle in-flight challenges, including passenger concerns or medical situations, with calmness and professionalism.Maintain cabin standards, monitor equipment, and complete all required reports and documentation.Represent the airline’s values and brand with cultural awareness and professionalism.Work collaboratively with the crew to provide a seamless travel experience for all guests.QualificationsPrevious customer-facing or hospitality experience is required; aviation experience is a strong advantage.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a warm and professional demeanor.Fluency in English is essential; additional languages are highly valued.Ability to remain composed, adaptable, and polished under pressure.Willingness to work flexible shifts, including weekends, evenings, and international schedules.Must meet global airline requirements for physical fitness, height, and safety compliance.Valid passport with the ability to travel freely without restrictions.What’s OfferedFull-time contract with remote onboarding and training for EMEA-based candidates.Competitive salary, allowances, and travel benefits.Opportunity to travel extensively and work on international routes.A diverse, inclusive, and global workplace culture.Career growth and promotion opportunities within one of the world’s leading airlines.Apply NowIf you are passionate about aviation, enjoy delivering exceptional service, and are ready to represent a world-class airline, we invite you to apply and begin your journey in global aviation.
