basic_info.title: Chef de projet Marketing Généraliste F/H

description.text:
"Fnac Darty, un leader européen de la distribution omnicanal. Acteur omnicanal et européen, spécialisé dans la distribution de produits techniques et d'électroménager, de biens culturels et de loisirs, et leader du service après-vente présent dans 13 pays, avec 1005 magasins dans le monde, 11 millions d'abonnés/adhérents et 29 millions de visiteurs uniques cumulés par mois sur nos sites marchands. Nos 25 000 collaborateurs sont notre meilleur atout. Ils font vivre la raison d'être du Groupe au quotidien, qui consiste à « s'engager pour un choix éclairé et une consommation durable », auprès de nos clients. Fnac Darty recrute partout en France des talents aux profils, formations et expériences très diverses, que ce soit pour ses magasins, mais aussi dans les domaines de la logistique, de la réparation et service après-vente, de la livraison, de la relation client ou encore pour ses fonctions support. Chez Fnac Darty, nous recrutons sur les compétences, en accordant de l'attention à toutes les candidatures. Nous nous engageons à promouvoir la diversité, sans distinction d'origine, d'âge, de handicap, de genre ou d'orientation sexuelle, … dans un environnement respectueux de chaque personne. Votre prochain emploi vous attend chez Fnac Darty !",

Au sein de la Direction Marketing, le/la Chef(fe) de projet Marketing Généraliste joue un rôle clé dans la coordination, la priorisation et la mise en œuvre des actions marketing en lien avec la Marketing Factory (équipes Print & Webdesign). Il/elle agit comme un point de contact central entre les équipes métiers, les partenaires internes et externes, et les équipes de production.

Missions Principales

 Arbitrage et priorisation des demandes Collaborer avec l’Animco et les équipes concernées pour arbitrer et prioriser les demandes adressées à la Marketing Factory. Évaluer la pertinence, l’impact et la faisabilité des demandes en fonction des ressources disponibles et des objectifs commerciaux. Cadrage des besoins Cadrer et challenger les besoins exprimés par les équipes émettrices (investissements, volume de supports, délais). Instruire les demandes internes afin d’évaluer leur niveau de priorité et les ressources nécessaires à leur réalisation. Coordination avec la Marketing Factory (Publicis) Briefer le Lead Marketing Factory sur les besoins identifiés afin de projeter le bon niveau de ressources Assurer le suivi du budget avec le Lead Marketing Factory Participation aux instances de pilotage Participer activement aux réunions hebdomadaires d’animation commerciale et aux points mensuels avec la Direction Commerciale. Gestion de la relation avec les partenaires externes Cadrer la relation commerciale avec les prestataires externes en lien avec les métiers Print & Webdesign. Garantir la qualité et la ponctualité des livrables produits par la Marketing Factory.

Profil Recherché

 Excellentes capacités de coordination, d’analyse et de priorisation. Aisance relationnelle et sens du travail en équipe. Connaissance des environnements Print & Webdesign appréciée. Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement dynamique et multi-interlocuteurs.

Et une expérience sur un même type de poste et environnement de 7 à 10 ans.

description.text: Nous recherchons pour la direction marketing, pour le département marketing produits « véhicules », un(e) chef(fe) de département (H/F) en CDI. Ce poste est basé au siège social situé à 25 minutes de Nation, dans le secteur en plein développement de Noisy-Champs, au pied de la future inter connexion Grand Paris (RER A au pied du bâtiment)🚨 La mission du chef de département marketing produits est de proposer la stratégie marketing d’offres sur un secteur de produits/services, de piloter leur déploiement, promotion et animation dans une démarche commerciale multicanale en collaboration avec les différentes directions concernées, d'élaborer et animer une politique marketing services et de manager une équipe en charge de sa mise en œuvre.🛠️Les missions principales sont :- Fédérer et mobiliser les équipes autour d'objectifs communs ;- Analyser les évolutions potentielles des marchés et identifier les axes de développement marketing des offres, en fonction des typologies de clientèles ;- Conseiller et intervenir en tant qu'expert métier au sein de projets transverses (après qualification par la directrice) ;- Intervenir auprès de clients stratégiques, en soutien à la direction des partenariats et à la direction du réseau, à la présentation de l'offre de produits/services dont le groupe est en charge- Superviser l'ensemble des actions marketing particulièrement sensibles pour l'UGAP.⭐ Rejoindre l'UGAP, c'est accéder à des avantages qui font toute la différence ! Intéressement, 6 semaines de congés payés, politique de parentalité avantageuse, télétravail… Pour en savoir plus rendez-vous sur Ugap.fr rubrique "Nous rejoindre".

description.text:
About Us

SharkNinja is a global product design and technology company, with a diversified portfolio of 5-star rated lifestyle solutions that positively impact people’s lives in homes around the world. Powered by two trusted, global brands, Shark and Ninja, the company has a proven track record of bringing disruptive innovation to market, and developing one consumer product after another has allowed SharkNinja to enter multiple product categories, driving significant growth and market share gains. Headquartered in Needham, Massachusetts with more than 3,600+ associates, the company’s products are sold at key retailers, online and offline, and through distributors around the world.

Overview

The role will play a key part of our French Marketing Organization, focusing on Category Marketing in Country & Channel for our beauty brand. The Category Marketing function will be responsible for bringing our product to market, including channelization, product range planning /assortments, scenario planning, promotional calendar (in collaboration with Trade Marketing), in-market NPD launch plans, product positioning etc

What You'll Do

Be a local market expert: pro-actively communicate local nuances to plans, and provide updates on local competitorsProvide insights, context and narrative behind any suggested changes in countriesRange planning and local retailer strategy (channelization)Co-owner of sales out marketing plan, Co-ad budget, executional trade marketing planDelivers country reports to Regional for consolidationOwns in country execution and number

In More Details

GTM planningResponsible for Channelisation and Scenario planning ie big bets/risksResponsible for supporting local Sales & Trade Marketing teams with retailer sell in presentations and meetings including Product demonstrationsCountry retailer activation plans communication (Trade Marketing will own this however Category Marketing should report back to Regional once collated)GTM execution & monitoringResponsible for new product launches within local marketServe as a thought-leader in product launch alongside critical sales and brand marketing leaders – ensure that the “triad” of product, marketing, and sales execution comes together for every new launch.Support with the build of local joint business plans with retailersForecasting marketshare based on sell in/sell outProduct ranging and pricingResponsible for the Country Retailer assortments and SKUs assortment and channel strategy (by retailer) Co-Responsible with Trade Marketing for the Country Promotional Calendar and responsible for Pricing strategy – partnering closely with the Regional CP&A, Regional Marketing and Product DevelopmentNew product developmentProvide feedback on NPD inputs (consolidate Country insights / feedback and share with Regional)Product roadmap & assortment (including RRP)Responsible for channel strategy to achieve sales forecastResponsible for the Country Product Range & Roadmap locally from concept to shelfPartner closely with Regional Marketing and Product Development to bring roadmap to life.Oversee a rolling 6–24-month pipeline of new products within categories to launch within local market.Product testingProvides feedback on claimsConsult on product review and feeback (see consumer validation)Supports in-market testing for concept and packaging
What You'll Bring

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field.Fluent French and English4+ years of experience in Marketing (brand or Trade), preferably in the Beauty industryDecisive and action oriented.Proven ability to work with multiple agencies and suppliersProven leadership and influencing abilities.Strong presentation, written and verbal communication skillsData analysis skills.Ability to use Microsoft applications.Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions.Evidence of good attention to detail.Budget spendings tracking and managementEarger to learnAt ease in dynamic and agile environment

Our Culture

At SharkNinja, we don’t just raise the bar—we push past it every single day. Our Outrageously Extraordinary mindset drives us to tackle the impossible, push boundaries, and deliver results that others only dream of. If you thrive on breaking out of your swim lane, you’ll be right at home.

What We Offer

We offer competitive health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, employee stock purchase options, wellness programs, SharkNinja product discounts, and more. We empower your personal and professional growth with high impact Learning Programs featuring bold voices redefining what’s possible. When you join, you’re not just part of a company—you’re part of an outrageously extraordinary community. Together, we won’t just launch products—we’ll disrupt entire markets.

At SharkNinja, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are vital to our global success. Valuing each unique voice and blending all of our diverse skills strengthens SharkNinja’s innovation every day. We support ALL associates in bringing their authentic selves to work, making an impact, and having the opportunity for career acceleration. With help from our leadership, associates, and our community, we aim to have equity be a key component of the SharkNinja DNA.

Learn More About Us

 Life At SharkNinja

Outrageously Extraordinary

SharkNinja's Candidate Privacy Notice can be found here: https://www.sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/

For candidates based in China, please visit: https://sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/china/

For candidates based in Vietnam, please visit: https://www.sharkninja.com/candidate-privacy-notice/vietnam/

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other class protected by legislation, and local law. SharkNinja will consider reasonable accommodations consistent with legislation, and local law. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact SharkNinja People & Culture at accommodations@sharkninja.com

companyResolutionResult.name: INSECOGO® Worldwide Search & Executive Consultants GmbH

description.text:
GLOBAL NETWORK PARTNER@INSECOGO® (m/f/d) remote in Europe, Middle East and Africa!
Excellent Opportunities and outstanding Perspectives! … for top
⏩ Executive/Business Consultants,⏩ Interim Experts/Managers,⏩ Headhunters/Executive Search, and⏩ Trainers/Coaches!
We are a Group of Companies active in three business fields in top HR & Management Consulting, developed from over 20 years of highly specialized and international experience in organizational and process optimization as well as in the development and management of complex companies & groups of companies. Our headquarter is in the Dusseldorf/Cologne region in Germany.
With our brand INSECOGO® we are a worldwide Partners Network of legally independent and qualified partners in their respective countries in the business segments Worldwide Interim Experts & Managers, Headhunting and Executive & Business Consulting. With our two other brands, we are mainly active in the German-speaking countries (Germany, Austria, Switzerland): with INSEMACO® in the Headhunting/Executive Search, Interim Experts & Managers as well as Personal Expert & Leader Branding business segments and with INQIMACO® in the Leadership and HR Management Consulting & Development business segments.
In addition to our high standards of professional consulting, the DNA of our group also includes our high social & ethical standards. We want real sustainability in terms of business in harmony with people, nature and animals, which we promote!
This makes our „we-brand” concept unique worldwide, innovative and successful, with a real USP.
We are the original worldwide. We are THE 1st ADVISORY & ETHICS GROUP©
This and much more makes us one of the 1st Addresses when it comes to top Experts and Executives for cross-generational solutions!
In the course of our rapid development we are looking for further professionally and personally highly qualified Global Network Partners@INSECOGO® (m/f/d) remote in Europe, Middle East and Africa.
YOUR EXPERTISE & QUALIFICATIONSProfessional Executive/Business Consultant, Interim Expert/Manager, Headhunter or Trainer/Coach (m/f/d),entrepreneurial and self-employed in your country,degree and additional qualifications,very good English language skills,expertise in industries, functions and methods,many years of consulting experience,experience as an expert and executive in top positions (C-level) on the client side,task understanding and solution skills,high quality of verifiable references,winning personality with sovereignty, communication and sales strength,passion for high quality and for working in contact worlds and networks,sympathetic, humorous and authentic person, as well asidentifications with our high quality, performance and social standards as well as our social commitment.
YOUR ADVANTAGES & ADDED VALUES as GLOBAL NETWORK PARTNER@INSECOGO®We live entrepreneurship, responsibility and community on the basis of a value system that is binding for us. Our corporate culture is characterised by trust, partnership, professionalism, passion, diversity, variety of skills and ideas, etc.We use one of the world's leading AI-powered software solutions in HR consulting and invest in state-of-the-art system technologies required for top performance.Our leopard is our brand motif. We associate it with self-image, positioning, added values and uniqueness. It fascinates and inspires us. It is probably the most persecuted big cat in the world. That is why we also support leopards in particular.You get an extremely lucrative partner model with excellent future prospects.You are an entrepreneurial and self-employed network/affiliated Partner at eye level in a network with USP.Each Partner has his/her specialisations in certain sectors, functions, search methods, etc.With your individual specialisations, you are exclusively the 1st contact person for your clients in your country resp. your region.The individual entrepreneurial performance of each Partner is protected in the best possible way for him/her.You are split-fee Partner for international cross-border projects.The Partners involved in a cross-border project divide the fee between themselves into a share for the acquiring Partner and a share for the implementing/placing Partner in the respective country.You will receive synergies through our group of companies and our partnerships, such as specialised knowledge and innovative approaches to solutions, cross-selling of a comprehensive portfolio of the group, etc.We only work exclusively (as the only personnel consultancy) for our clients.We only offer top quality: each Partner only accept a project if he/she or we have the necessary skills to carry out the project successfully.We offer our clients sustainability as well as the highest quality, performance and social standards, with guarantees and an excellent price-performance ratio.In case of Headhunting/Executive Search we only work with retainer fee.Each Partner is exclusively and professionally presented and positioned on the INSECOGO® website in the near future.Every active Partner is supported with our social media marketing and selling to secure and increase his/her contacts and turnover.Each Partner influences its success through its own activities with clients and within our partnership and group of companies.
All this makes INSECOGO® an ideal Partner when it comes to professional international projects.
And besides all professionalism, we want to be sympathetic and humorous people.
We will be happy to tell you more about the advantages and added values of a partnership with us in a personal and confidential conversation.
Professionalism and absolute discretion are a matter of course for us!
YOUR PERSONAL CONTACTThomas Timothé BehnckeCEO/Managing Partner
He looks forward to hearing resp. reading from you. Please send him your message with your profile/CV, in English language, here on LinkedIn.
BECOME PART OF THE SUCCESS!
For future-oriented information, thoughts and ideas, please simply activate the "bell" at the top right of Thomas Timothé Behncke's LinkedIn profile.
BE A PERSONALITY OF THE 21TH CENTURY!©#personality21century
For reasons of better legibility, the simultaneous use of gender-specific language forms is dispensed with.

description.text:
OUR STORY:

🇪🇺 Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !

Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.

Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.

With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing €3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.

Every day, thanks to our rich catalog of products and services (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves 38,000 private and public sector clients, from Photoroom to Mistral AI, Golem AI, and ADEME.

📍 Our offices are located in Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Bordeaux, Rouen, Rennes and Lyon.

At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.

All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.

We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.

basic_info.title: Recruiter Search Consultant Entry Level Remote

description.text:
gpac offers an excellent work-life balance in a fast-paced work environment. There is tremendous earning potential with no cap. As a part of our team, you will be surrounded by passionate teammates pushing each other to exceed their own goals. This is a position that allows you to help transform people's lives by placing them in their ideal positions with our clients while transforming your life as well.

We have a tried-and-true recipe for success that has allowed us to become an industry leader and one of the largest and most successful executive search firms in the country, with an extensive and ever-growing network of search consultants.

We do not require previous recruiting experience because we provide the proper training, tools, resources and support to reach your individual earning goals. We also have continuous coaching and guidance once you join our team.

REMOTE POSITION MX - This is a commission-driven position with the opportunity to earn between 15-75% of your production.

Key Areas Of Responsibility

Organize a sufficient number of interviews to generate an average monthly billing of USD $21,667 (twenty-one thousand six hundred sixty-seven dollars 00/100).Build and maintain relationships with clients, hiring managers, and candidates.Collaborate with clients to help fill urgent positions.Connect clients with qualified candidates, resulting in successful placements.Competently use recruitment tools and materials.Make cold calls, qualify, screen, and prepare candidates and clients for interviews, and assist in job offer negotiations.Conduct reference checks on candidates.Effective negotiation skillsConsistently perform high outbound activity to source clients and candidates

Qualifications And Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills. - Advanced English LevelMust be comfortable building relationships over the phone.Act with integrity, confidentiality, and an ethical mindset.Effective negotiation skills.Consistently perform client and candidate prospecting activities.Successful completion of gpac training and all training requirements.

Education And Experience

A university degree is preferred but not required.Advanced level of English (Minimum TOEFL iBT 72-94, TOEFL ITP 543-627, CEFR B2, IELTS Score 5.5-6.5).If the candidate does not have standardized test scores to certify their English level, they may be evaluated by gpac personnel through oral interviews via video call.

What We Offer

Exceptional training programSocial SecurityVacation bonusChristmas bonus (30 days)Electricity and internet allowanceMajor medical expenses insuranceCompetitive commission structureCompany equipment

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who has an entrepreneurial mindset, is goal-oriented, has a competitive spirit, and thrives on the opportunity to have unlimited earning potential in a commission-driven position.

We believe we have one of the most unique and gratifying opportunities, both personally and professionally, while providing a company culture that is unmatched! If you are serious about finding a life-changing career opportunity, gpac is the place for you! gpac is rapidly growing and currently in the process of interviewing to add new partners to the team. There is no time like the present.

The Employer will pay the Employee a monthly salary (with a commission quota) of $15,000.00 (fifteen thousand pesos 00/100 Mexican Currency), minus any applicable deductions.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

Come join the Pac!

Email me at itzel.diaz@gogpac.com

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States since 1990. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

description.text:
Job Description

trying to find a good LLM approach to organize and summarize all the insights of 450 blog posts. it would be great if the solution organized the content into a new web page where the content was grouped/clustered by topic.

basically i cant read 400 blog posts but thinking if content is grouped into a new website easier to read it all

description.text:
Our client is a global leader in surgical innovation, focused on advancing technologies that improve outcomes for both patients and providers. They are seeking a Senior Regional Marketing Manager to drive downstream marketing strategy and execution across the region.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing marketing strategies, leading product launches, supporting field execution, and ensuring the commercial success of a highly technical product portfolio.
The position requires a balance of strategic thinking, hands-on execution, and cross-functional collaboration with sales, product management, and clinical teams.

Key responsibilities Develop and implement comprehensive downstream marketing strategies and tactics aligned to business objectives and commercial targets, based on market research and competitor analysisLead regional product launches in close collaboration with upstream product management, driving launch strategies, generating marketing materials, and executing commercialization programs including sales readiness trainingPartner with Marketing Communications to manage and enhance brand presence through marketing campaigns, convention strategy, and tailored collateral with clear product positioning and messagingProvide strategic and prioritized direction to the sales organization through marketing plans, training presentations, and ongoing communicationStay connected to customer needs and market trends by building relationships with KOLs, customers, and industry stakeholders to inform product launch plans and regional strategiesDevelop and deploy customer engagement programs, including advocacy initiatives, congress activities, and experience eventsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including sales, professional affairs, market development, and regulatory affairs to drive market expansion strategiesAct as a subject matter expert on the product portfolio, championing and communicating the value proposition internally and externallyEnsure marketing activities comply with industry regulations and company standardsTravel to customer sites to support clinical cases, training programs, and key industry eventsManage the departmental budget, ensuring efficient resource allocation
Key Requirements Minimum of five years of product marketing, clinical or marketing, or field sales experience within medical devices or capital equipment with highly technical productsProven experience in downstream marketing including scaled product launchesStrong ability to analyze market and financial data and translate insights into actionable strategyAbility to establish credibility quickly with customers, KOLs, and internal stakeholdersExcellent communication, presentation, and influencing skillsCustomer-focused mindset with a strong drive for resultsTrack record of working effectively in cross-functional and multidisciplinary teamsTravel across Europe ~20%
What Our Client OffersA mission-driven culture with a clear focus on improving surgical outcomesCollaborative colleagues who value teamwork and integrityThe chance to work on breakthrough technologies that directly impact patients’ livesOpportunities to develop your strengths, follow your passion, and advance your careerA flexible, engaging work environmentA competitive benefits package
If you’re interested in learning more please apply below!

basic_info.title: Expert Crédit Sénior et Mentor H/F - Team Full remote

description.text:
🎯 Nous rejoindre en tant qu'Expert Crédit Sénior et Mentor chez Pretto
L'entité Full-Remote de Pretto poursuit sa croissance rapide et pour accompagner cette dynamique, nous recherchons un(e) Expert Crédit Sénior / Mentor basé en France métropolitaine. Le poste mêle une forte contribution opérationnelle (4/5ème) et un temps dédié au mentorat d'une petite équipe junior (1/5ème). L'objectif affiché est d'évoluer sur un poste de Team Lead à moyen-terme mais il est aussi possible de rester sur un poste opérationnel. 
🌟Ton rôle
- Convertir un fort volume de flux entrant très qualifié via notre simulateur- Gérer un portefeuille et générer 25% de son chiffre d'affaires via le parrainage- Accompagner les clients dans la construction de la meilleure solution de financement dans le cadre de leur projet immobilier et savoir les fidéliser- Négocier avec les banques- Contribuer à l'amélioration continuelle de nos outils et technologies au contact d'une équipe Tech/Produit de folie- Accompagner la progression opérationnelle et suivre les performances de 1 à 3 Experts Crédits 
👫 Ton profil
- Tu as une expérience en Sales significative d'au moins 4/5 ans : tu te considères expert dans le développement commercial, idéalement sur du produit complexe- Si tu as de l'XP dans le courtage en crédit immo, ce sera bien évidemment un plus, mais ce n'est pas nécessairement un pré-requis !- Tu cherches une entreprise où il y a un fort volume d'activité à gérer, tu veux des journée qui filent à 100 à l'heure et beaucoup de clients à gérer en simultané !- Tu as une expérience significative en full-remote et tu sais maintenant que c'est comme ça que tu veux bosser (et pas autrement !)- Tu as déjà formé/mentoré/coaché des commerciaux apprenants et tu prends beaucoup de plaisir à le faire- Tu es avant tout drivé par une vraie soif de commerce : tu cherches à atteindre et dépasser des objectifs ambitieux- Tu cherches à devenir un manager engagé, qui inspire par l’exemple et crée un collectif soudé autour de lui- Tu es à l’aise avec les outils (CRM, solutions métier), et tu comprends que la tech est un levier fort de performance- Tu es rigoureux(se), structuré(e), avec un excellent relationnel et une communication irréprochable (écrite comme orale) 
🔥 Rejoins la team Sales parce que :
On t’offre un accompagnement en interne avec les meilleurs standards (formation coaching, culture de l’entraide et transmission de bonnes pratiques)On te propose un plan de carrière qui te permettra de grandir chez nousLa culture du feedback : chez Pretto tout le monde a droit de donner son avis et proposer des solutions, c'est même recommandé ! 
🎁 Les avantages à travailler chez Pretto
💰 Un package salarial avantageux : carte ticket restaurant Swile, mutuelle prise en charge à 50%🌟 Des primes attractives : vacances, cooptation pouvant aller jusqu'à 2000€, intéressement, naissance🍻 Des moments partagés entre collègues : onboarding avec ta promo, rituels d’équipe, offsite...💚 Prise en charge de 4 séances/an sur moka.care👥 Un parrain ou marraine référent(e) pour te permettre de t’intégrer et de t’épanouir chez Pretto
🤝 Notre processus de recrutement
Un entretien d'une heure en visio avec Charles ou Lorane - Team Talent AcquisitionPuis un entretien en visio avec Hélène, Head of Sales du bureau Full-remote, à la suite duquel nous te demanderons de nous communiquer une prise de référenceUn dernier échange en visio avec Pierre, CEO de PrettoFélicitations, nous te rappelons pour te faire une offre 🥳Bienvenue chez nous ! 🎉

detailed_info.title: Expert Crédit Sénior et Mentor H/F - Team Full remote

- Tu as une expérience en Sales significative d'au moins 4/5 ans : tu te considères expert dans le développement commercial, idéalement sur du produit complexe- Si tu as de l'XP dans le courtage en crédit immo, ce sera bien évidemment un plus, mais ce n'est pas nécessairement un pré-requis !- Tu cherches une entreprise où il y a un fort volume d'activité à gérer, tu veux des journée qui filent à 100 à l'heure et beaucoup de clients à gérer en simultané !- Tu as une expérience significative en full-remote et tu sais maintenant que c'est comme ça que tu veux bosser (et pas autrement !)- Tu as déjà formé/mentoré/coaché des commerciaux apprenants et tu prends beaucoup de plaisir à le faire- Tu es avant tout drivé par une vraie soif de commerce : tu cherches à atteindre et dépasser des objectifs ambitieux- Tu cherches à devenir un manager engagé, qui inspire par l’exemple et crée un collectif soudé autour de lui- Tu es à l’aise avec les outils (CRM, solutions métier), et tu comprends que la tech est un levier fort de performance- Tu es rigoureux(se), structuré(e), avec un excellent relationnel et une communication irréprochable (écrite comme orale) 
🔥 Rejoins la team Sales parce que :
On t’offre un accompagnement en interne avec les meilleurs standards (formation coaching, culture de l’entraide et transmission de bonnes pratiques)On te propose un plan de carrière qui te permettra de grandir chez nousLa culture du feedback : chez Pretto tout le monde a droit de donner son avis et proposer des solutions, c'est même recommandé ! 
🎁 Les avantages à travailler chez Pretto
💰 Un package salarial avantageux : carte ticket restaurant Swile, mutuelle prise en charge à 50%🌟 Des primes attractives : vacances, cooptation pouvant aller jusqu'à 2000€, intéressement, naissance🍻 Des moments partagés entre collègues : onboarding avec ta promo, rituels d’équipe, offsite...💚 Prise en charge de 4 séances/an sur moka.care👥 Un parrain ou marraine référent(e) pour te permettre de t’intégrer et de t’épanouir chez Pretto
🤝 Notre processus de recrutement
Un entretien d'une heure en visio avec Charles ou Lorane - Team Talent AcquisitionPuis un entretien en visio avec Hélène, Head of Sales du bureau Full-remote, à la suite duquel nous te demanderons de nous communiquer une prise de référenceUn dernier échange en visio avec Pierre, CEO de PrettoFélicitations, nous te rappelons pour te faire une offre 🥳Bienvenue chez nous ! 🎉

basic_info.title: Director of Product and R&D Operations

description.text:
About the Role

We are hiring a Director of R&D Operations to build and lead a team focused on operational excellence across Engineering, Product and Design “EPD”. This role is foundational in shaping how our organization scales, bringing strategic alignment, collaboration, and operational efficiency to our 40+ cross-functional teams. Reporting to the VP Engineering, you'll be the connective tissue across EPD—developing the systems, rituals, and culture that allow innovation to thrive while enabling our teams to deliver impactful, customer-centric solutions.
At PandaDoc, we believe in creating world-class products and world-class ways of working. As Director of R&D Ops, you’ll help us scale with intention—bringing clarity, efficiency and autonomy to the teams that build our software. You’ll shape not just how we operate, but how we grow.
 
In this role, you will:
Strategic Leadership

Establish and oversee the EPD Ops function: Develop a unified strategy for Engineering, Product and Design Operations at scale, supporting 40+ teams.
Drive alignment at scale: Ensure EPD operations are aligned with the organization's strategic goals, even as the teams grow and evolve.
Lead cross-functional initiatives: Oversee large, cross-functional programs that span multiple teams, ensuring efficiency and seamless delivery.

Operational Excellence

Streamline workflows: Create and refine processes that support a high-performing, interconnected organization of 40+ teams, as well as partnership with cross-functional teams such as Sales and Support.
Foster shared accountability: Design frameworks that promote ownership and collaboration across Product, Design, and Engineering teams at scale.
Measure success: Define KPIs to track the effectiveness of EPD operations across multiple teams, focusing on outcomes like time to market and team satisfaction.

Systems, Tooling & Data

Evaluate and implement tools: Identify, evaluate and implement tools that enhance EPD planning, efficiency, collaboration and reporting at scale.
Drive continuous improvement: Lead the development of scalable processes and systems to optimize EPD delivery and collaboration.
Knowledge management: Maintain a centralized knowledge hub of operational best practices, onboarding resources, and documentation.


About you:

10+ years of experience in product/EPD operational roles in fast-paced environments, with 4+ years leading and scaling high-performing teams.
Proven success managing complex cross-functional programs with structured execution and stakeholder alignment.
Demonstrated ability to own initiatives end-to-end while empowering teams to drive outcomes collaboratively.
Track record of successful change management—bringing durable process and tooling improvements to scaling teams.
Deep empathy for internal users (PMs, designers, engineers) and a customer-first mindset.
Systems thinker with a knack for solving ambiguous challenges and building alignment across functions.
Experience implementing and evolving operating models at scale.
Excellent communication and storytelling skills—confident presenting to executive stakeholders and mentoring team members.

 
Company Overview: 
PandaDoc empowers more than 60,000 growing organizations to thrive by taking the work out of document workflow. PandaDoc provides an all-in-one document workflow automation platform that helps fast-scaling teams accelerate the ability to create, manage, and sign digital documents including proposals, quotes, contracts, and more. For more information, please visithttps://www.pandadoc.com.
Company Culture: 
We're known for our work-life balance, kind co-workers, & creative virtual team-bonding events. And although our Pandas are located across the globe, we stay connected with the help of technology and ensure that everyone on our team feels, well, like a team.
Pandas work best when they're happy. We retain our talent by upholding our values of integrity & transparency and selling a product that changes the lives of our customers. Check out our LinkedIn to learn more.
Benefits:

An honest, open culture that emphasizes feedback and promotes professional and personal development;
An opportunity to work remotely— our team is distributed worldwide, from Warsaw to Lisbon, from Florida to California. However, we have offices in Lisbon, Warsaw, and Kyiv and you’re welcomed to work from them and meet with other pandas in person;
6 self-care days;
A competitive salary;
And much more!

basic_info.title: Director of Marketing Intelligence & Research Integrity

description.text:
Location: Remote AnywhereReports to: Executive Director/CCODepartment: Executive Leadership – Research & Intelligence
Collectivus Holdings oversees the most prestigious brands in the Collecting, Trading Card Game, and Hobby industries. With a century of combined expertise in pioneering products, delivering exceptional quality, and enhancing customer experiences, Collectivus is synonymous with excellence. Our portfolio includes Beckett, Dragon Shield, Southern Hobby, and Merchant Guild— four brands with decades of expertise and dedication to elevating the collecting experience for enthusiasts and businesses alike.
About Us:Welcome to Merchant Guild, where passion meets purpose!We are a consulting and support agency dedicated to empowering the trading card game (TCG) and tabletop gaming industry.Our mission is not just to grow sales but to ignite the spirit of adventure within the hobby ecosystem, helping local game stores thrive.Through tailored strategies, market insights, and hands-on support, we equip retailers, distributors, and publishers to embrace the exciting future of gaming.Join us in shaping an industry where collaboration, creativity, and opportunity drive lasting success.
Role OverviewThe Director of Market Intelligence & Research Integrity is a senior executive responsible for setting the vision, strategy, and execution of Merchant Guild’s global research, analytics, data quality, and service pricing structure. This role merges the strategic foresight of market insight collected through the Retail Consultant network with the rigorous oversight of research integrity, while also driving the pricing strategy for Merchant Guild packages and pricing its services for maximum industry impact based on a strong insight into the global competitive landscape.
As the Guild’s top authority in market intelligence, this leader ensures that every data-driven product — from market reports to custom research engagements — delivers high-value insights built on uncompromising accuracy. At the same time, they develop and manage a pricing framework that aligns Merchant Guild’s offerings with industry demand, competitive positioning, and revenue objectives.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic LeadershipDefine and execute Merchant Guild’s research, analytics, and pricing strategy, ensuring alignment with long-term organizational goals.Collect information from the Retail Consultant to identify market trends, industry shifts, and competitive landscapes.Lead the production of flagship reports, market forecasts, and member intelligence briefings.
Market Insights & AnalyticsDirect the design of market research projects, including quantitative, qualitative, and hybrid methodologies.Oversee predictive analytics, scenario modelling, and competitive benchmarking.Ensure insights are effectively visualized, communicated, and actionable for varied audiences.
Research Quality & IntegrityEstablish and maintain rigorous quality assurance standards for all research outputs.Audit methodologies, validate data sources, and oversee peer review processes.Ensure compliance with ethical research practices and relevant data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA).
Pricing Strategy & Commercial OversightDevelop and maintain a dynamic pricing framework for Merchant Guild’s research products, memberships, and consulting services.Conduct market-based pricing analysis to ensure competitive positioning while maximizing value and revenue.Collaborate with partnership managers to tailor pricing for custom projects, partnerships, and tiered service offerings.Monitor pricing performance and adjust strategies based on market feedback, demand trends, and profitability targets.
Qualifications8+ years in research operations, data governance, or analytics quality assurance.Strong track record in methodological design, data validation, and compliance.Strong understanding of pricing models, elasticity analysis, and value-based pricing approaches.Expertise in statistical techniques, sampling, and error mitigation.Familiarity with international data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA) and ethical research practices.Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.Proficiency with analytics tools and quality-checking processes.
Performance Metrics & Success Indicators
Research & Insights Delivery98%+ on-time delivery rate for research projects and reports.Zero critical accuracy errors in published research outputs.Stakeholder satisfaction scores of 8/10+ for relevance, clarity, and actionability of insights.
Data Quality & IntegrityAnnual methodology audit pass rate of 100% with no compliance breaches.Reduction in data discrepancies and errors year-over-year.Full compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and internal ethics standards.
Pricing & Revenue ImpactRevenue growth from research services of X% YoY (target set annually).Pricing model adoption rate across at least 90% of product/service lines.

#LI-Remote

basic_info.title: Coordinateur - renfort purges DACP et industrialisation du processus (IT) / Freelance

description.text:
Dans le cadre de cette mission, nous recherchons non seulement un profil disposant des compétences techniques requises, mais également une personne dynamique, dotée d’une bonne capacité d’expression orale et écrite, capable d’interagir efficacement avec les différents interlocuteurs.

La mission consiste à recetter le module de purge installé par l’agence web sur WordPress, cadrer et mettre en œuvre le système de notification relatif aux campagnes « avant suppression des DACP », puis en assurer le recettage. Il faudra également former les utilisateurs à l’usage du module ainsi qu’à celui de la campagne, participer activement à la mise en production de l’ensemble, et accompagner les équipes métier dans la prise en main du module et du processus associé.

Profil candidat:

Savoir gérer un chantier multi acteur de A à ZComprendre le contexte et cadrer le besoin avant de lancer des actionsProfil technico-fonctionnel capable d’animer un chantier comprenant de nombreux interlocuteurs (métier comme DSI) et de rythmer les travaux sur plusieurs équipesOrganisation et suivi des tâches + suivi régulier (daily)Maîtrise de l’approche « parcours utilisateurs » / UXConnaissance des enjeux RGPD/une expérience sur un chantier approchant est un plusConnaissance de WordPress et / ou Salesforce Marketing Cloud est un plus

basic_info.title: Senior Business Manager - Food Compliance Services

description.text:
Senior Business Executive – Food Compliance Services (Continental Europe)
My client, an international regulatory consulting group, is looking for a Senior Business Executive to spearhead business development for their Food Division across Continental Europe. This is a key strategic hire, building the bridge between European clients and a well-established global team, with a focus on supporting companies navigating novel food ingredients and regulatory compliance.
The Food Division is one of the fastest-growing areas of the business, with global flagship projects spanning GRAS notices, EU novel food applications, Chinese NHC registrations, South Korean submissions, and regulatory pathways in Australia and New Zealand. In this role, you’ll be responsible for identifying new opportunities, securing high-level client engagement, and driving tailored compliance solutions across the European market.
The role You’ll take ownership of expanding market presence by:Defining and executing clear plans for European growth in food compliance and novel food ingredients.Building relationships with senior decision-makers, understanding their regulatory challenges, and converting these into long-term partnerships.Acting as a trusted consultant to clients on food compliance, regulatory, and testing requirements.Enhancing visibility in the market through conferences, industry events, and targeted networking.Collaborating with an experienced global team to deliver end-to-end client solutions.
What you bringDegree in food science, biology, microbiology, or a related discipline.5+ years of experience in food regulatory compliance or business development within the novel food ingredients sector.Strong knowledge of global food regulations, ideally with direct exposure to novel food frameworks in the EU or internationally.Excellent communication skills in English; fluency in another European language is a plus.A proactive, solution-driven approach with the ability to shape and deliver strategic market initiatives.
Why joinA pivotal role in expanding a global consultancy’s European footprint.Well-structured training and career development pathways.Exposure to cutting-edge areas of food regulation, including EU novel foods and FDA GRAS.Competitive package including salary, holiday bonus, pension, health insurance allowance, and team activities.Remote role with flexibility, ideally based in Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, or France.
Confidential application If you’re looking to make an impact in food regulatory affairs and want to drive growth across Europe, get in touch for a confidential discussion. You can also email Abid Kanji on a.kanji@nonstopconsulting.com

basic_info.title: Web 3 Co-Founder / Head of Growth (100 % remote) (m/f/d)

description.text:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.
We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul Müller (founder Adjust, €1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, €8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build €1B+ companies.
We offer:

A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to €500k in funding.
Community: Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors
Personal Development: Weekly coaching with unicorn-founders
Funding: Support in securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > €2M after our Grand Pitch)
Talent: Hiring support through our network (over 50,000 professionals)
Distribution: Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine

Highlighting just one of many success stories, one of our fellows set a record for Europe’s largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a €12M pre-seed investment.
Tasks

You will build, and run your own startup in fields such as Web 3
You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management
You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs
You will receive coaching in making your startup “investible”, i.e. ready to raise millions in funding
You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing empire respectively

Requirements

Based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate
Willingness to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to €100M+ in revenues
Excellent communication skills and English language

Join us and build a €1B+ company with us!

basic_info.title: Institutional Sales Manager - Funds and Asset Managers

description.text:
About BitMEX
BitMEX stands as a globally leading exchange for crypto derivatives, offering traders a professional-grade trading platform. Since its inception in 2014, BitMEX has maintained an impeccable security record with “no coin lost, ever!”.
Our platform caters to cryptocurrency derivatives traders by providing low latency, deep liquidity, and maximum availability. Currently, BitMEX offers more than 100 derivatives contracts, 16 pairs for spot trading, and an easy covert function between 30+ different cryptocurrencies.
In 2015, BitMEX revolutionised the market by inventing the Perpetual Swap, which has since become the most widely traded crypto product. Demonstrating a commitment to transparency, since 2021, BitMEX has been among the first exchanges to regularly publish its on-chain Proof of Reserves and Proof of Liabilities, ensuring that the funds available exceed the total client balances."
For more information on BitMEX, company initiatives and our products, please visit the BitMEX Blog or www.bitmex.com, and follow LinkedIn, Discord, Telegram and X.
Overview
The Institutional Business Development team is responsible for the coverage and growth of Corporate and VIP clients, identifying new business opportunities, conducting competitive market analysis and enhancing the BitMEX brand in the institutional space.
As an Institutional Sales Manager you will build relationships and drive revenue generating activities with institutional sales clients. You will work closely with other teams to provide insight and feedback from clients about products and features on the platform and manage your customer portfolio with the ultimate end goal of generating more volume and revenue on the BitMEX platform.
Your key focus will be to onboard and oversee the coverage of new Hedge Fund and Asset Manager clients, particularly those with a background in traditional electronic derivatives markets. Your input will help define the strategy and to refine the BitMEX product to be successful in this client segment.
Key Responsibilities
Identify new prospect clients, guiding them through onboarding and initial trading phases.Deliver best-in-class coverage and support to our Institutional and individual VIP clients, fostering deep relationships to drive increased trading volumes, liquidity, and loyalty.Promote available tools, products, and strategies to empower clients in maximizing their trading potential on the BitMEX platform.Serve as the primary point of contact for our Institutional customers, owning all direct communications.Gather, analyse, and regularly report on client feedback, including issues, recommendations, and criticisms, linking them directly to trading activity.Collaborate closely with BitMEX Product and Engineering teams to explain the priority of client issues and craft effective solutions, including writing specific improvement proposals.Maintain a thorough understanding of the BitMEX trading platform, current and future product/service offerings, and their impact on the client base.Clearly articulate the BitMEX value proposition and tailor it to diverse client segments.Suggest and implement process enhancements to boost team efficiency and elevate coverage quality.Maintain a current awareness of industry-related developments and competitive landscapes.Represent BitMEX at relevant industry conferences (occasional travel required) to stay abreast of developments, enhance brand image, and solidify relationships.
Qualifications
Minimum of 5 years of direct experience engaging with Hedge Fund and Asset Manager clients within the financial services industryProven track record of achieving sales KPIs and successfully expanding client bases.Existing client relationships within the client sector and the cryptocurrency industry are highly desirable, but not requiredExperience of managing electronic trading relationships with the target client group is strongly preferredStrong understanding of digital currencies and a genuine passion for the crypto space.Trading experience with Bitcoin or other digital asset classes is preferredExceptional client-facing communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, with a proven ability to engage professionally with high-value clientsStrong strategic thinking capability to map out client universe and understand and address complex client needsEnjoy networking and building rapport in professional settingsAn entrepreneurial mentality with a strong sense of personal accountability and ownershipAbility to thrive under pressure and excel with limited directionA collaborative team player with strong interpersonal skills, showcasing leadership potential and ambition
Why BitMEX?
BitMEX offers a dynamic environment that blends intense work, a vibrant culture, and diversity. We actively recruit across time zones to meet growing demands and attract top global talent.
We're seeking determined, responsible, and collaborative individuals to join us in building a leading cryptocurrency ecosystem. We value meticulousness, agility, and simplicity. As a 24/7 global exchange, we look for adaptable team players who can excel in a diverse, cross-market environment.
We provide flexible arrangements to our remote contract talents with:Work from home to help you find the perfect balance between work, family and personal lifePaid holidays and leave so you won’t miss out any important eventsTeam building & offsite events to bring our global team closerDon’t forget the advantage of our Beyond Border Remote Working policy, where you get to work away from your home countryOption to choose to be paid in fiat or crypto currency, providing the flexibility to shape your financial freedom
Does this sound like the type of working culture you can thrive in? Apply online now!

Why BitMEX?
BitMEX offers a dynamic environment that blends intense work, a vibrant culture, and diversity. We actively recruit across time zones to meet growing demands and attract top global talent.
We're seeking determined, responsible, and collaborative individuals to join us in building a leading cryptocurrency ecosystem. We value meticulousness, agility, and simplicity. As a 24/7 global exchange, we look for adaptable team players who can excel in a diverse, cross-market environment.
We provide flexible arrangements to our remote contract talents with:Work from home to help you find the perfect balance between work, family and personal lifePaid holidays and leave so you won’t miss out any important eventsTeam building & offsite events to bring our global team closerDon’t forget the advantage of our Beyond Border Remote Working policy, where you get to work away from your home countryOption to choose to be paid in fiat or crypto currency, providing the flexibility to shape your financial freedom
Does this sound like the type of working culture you can thrive in? Apply online now!

description.text:
À propos du poste :COMIN, la première solution de VTC et taxi proposant un modèle équitable, transparent et durable, recherche une personne en alternance ou stage en Sales & Marketing pour accélérer notre développement commercial. Ton objectif ? Signer des partenariats stratégiques et vendre notre solution aux entreprises. Un rôle clé pour faire grandir COMIN et structurer notre croissance.
Missions :Identifier et prospecter des hôtels, entreprises et autres partenaires stratégiquesContacter des prospects (appels, emails, rendez-vous) et convertir en clientsGérer l’ensemble du cycle de vente, de la prise de contact à la signatureMettre en place des offres adaptées pour les partenairesParticiper à la stratégie de croissance et d’acquisition clientsAssurer la veille concurrentielle et identifier de nouvelles opportunités de marchéContribuer à des campagnes marketing pour promouvoir notre solution
Compétences et qualifications requises :Étudiant(e) en école de commerce, université ou formation équivalenteGoût prononcé pour la vente et la négociationAisance relationnelle et excellente communication en français (anglais est un plus)Autonome, proactif(ve) et prêt(e) à relever des défis dans une startup en forte croissanceUne première expérience en Sales, Business Development ou Growth est un plus
Pourquoi rejoindre COMIN ?Un rôle à responsabilité avec un vrai impact sur le développement de COMINUne rémunération attractive avec une part variable en fonction des ventesUn environnement stimulant chez Station F, au cœur de l’écosystème startupUne mission porteuse de sens dans la mobilité durable et équitable
Informations supplémentaires :Date de début : ASAPRémunération : 700€ à 1500€/mois (selon profil) + bonus pouvant aller jusqu’à 1000€/moisEnvoyez votre candidature directement par email à : hello@wearecomin.com
À propos de COMIN :⚡COMIN est la 1ʳᵉ solution de transport VTC et taxi proposant un modèle équitable, transparent et durable.Notre mission : redonner du pouvoir aux chauffeurs, passagers et entreprises en proposant une alternative aux plateformes traditionnelles. COMIN garantit une expérience haut de gamme, une rémunération juste et un modèle qui remet l’humain au centre.Déjà plus de 50 000 utilisateurs et 8 000 chauffeurs ont rejoint la communauté COMIN.COMIN⚡ est basée à Station F à Paris et soutenue par Bpifrance et la Ville de Paris.
Pour en savoir plus, veuillez visiter notre site web : www.wearecomin.comRejoignez COMIN pour façonner l'avenir de la mobilité urbaine équitable et durable!

description.text:
Our client is currently seeking an experienced Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO) to join their team.
Key ResponsibilitiesOversee and manage the daily implementation and monitoring of AML risk-based proceduresEnsure full compliance with all applicable legal and regulatory obligations, and disseminate AML policies, procedures, and risk assessments across the organizationPromote awareness and understanding of AML obligations among employees through regular training and clear communicationProvide staff with clear guidance on identifying and reporting suspicious activitiesClearly communicate the procedures in place to help employees understand their obligations under the Money Laundering RegulationsReview, assess, and approve the onboarding of politically exposed persons (PEPs)Monitor and enforce adherence to AML processesLog and evaluate internal Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) and determine the appropriate course of action, including whether to terminate the relationship or escalate to the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU)Submit external reports to law enforcement or regulatory bodies when necessary, providing supporting information and reasoning for any suspicions raisedRequest consent from the FIU where required, ensuring all transactions are legally compliantMaintain detailed records of all decisions made in response to suspicious activities, including the rationale for taking or not taking specific actionsServe as the primary point of contact with all relevant authorities, including gaming regulators, police, financial institutions, insolvency agencies, and legal representativesOperate independently and objectively, without undue influence from senior management when necessaryManage the staff AML training program and maintain a comprehensive employee training logConduct risk assessments of the company’s compliance systems and practicesPerform regular random transaction reviews and assess supporting documentationEvaluate risks related to new products against existing AML policies and proceduresReview external SARs and Data Protection Assessments (DPAs) for emerging trends and patternsCompile and present an annual report to the group board on the effectiveness and development of AML policies and procedures
RequirementsA university degree in Law, Economics, Finance, Administration, or a related fieldA minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in a compliance or AML role within the iGaming industryStrong understanding of Maltese regulations pertaining to payments and financial institutionsIn-depth knowledge of local laws, directives, and regulations related to AML, KYC, virtual assets, and evolving iGaming compliance standardsExcellent command of the English language, both written and spoken

description.text:
We’re looking for a Casino Manager for a fast-growing iGaming business. 
You'll be at the heart of the product, evaluating new game titles, curating the best mix for players, and constantly refining the content strategy through data and player behavior. Whether it’s reviewing game mechanics, analyzing hit rates, or testing themes, you’ll help define what great looks like in the casino lobby.
This is a role for someone who lives and breathes casino content — someone who wants to build structured, scalable processes while staying close to the games that make players come back.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Reviewing upcoming games and assessing their potential fit for our playersUsing data to spot trends, player favorites, and untapped opportunitiesCreating repeatable systems for content launches, tagging, and localizationWorking with Product to ensure content and features go hand in handBuilding relationships with providers to secure standout titles and exclusives

description.text: Location: Remote (Europe) | Travel Required: ~25–30%  Dragon Shield is a high-growth company, renowned for creating premium accessories that protect and elevate the games and collectibles we cherish. You probably know us for our card sleeves, the go-to choice for protecting trading card game decks around the world. Now, we're expanding our mission to support the backbone of the TCG community: local game stores (LGSs). We're launching a new direct-to-retailer sales program, and we’re looking for the right person to help us build it from the ground up.  About the RoleAs one of the first team members in this exciting new program, you’ll work directly with hobby shops, LGSs, and event organizers to bring Dragon Shield products straight to the people who need them most. You’ll be building relationships, sharing what’s new, and helping stores curate the perfect product mix for their community.  What You’ll Be DoingHelp launch and scale our direct-to-retailer sales initiative across North America.Build and manage relationships with local game stores, hobby retailers, and event organizers.Introduce new product lines, share promotions, and offer merchandising/display recommendations.Collaborate with our internal sales team to develop outreach strategies, set targets, and refine tools and processes.Represent Dragon Shield at trade shows, conventions, and regional gaming events.Gather field feedback to help shape future products, promotions, and programs. Who You AreYou have experience in sales or account management, ideally in the gaming, toy, collectible, or lifestyle brand space.You’re a TCG fan at heart—you know the difference between Commander and Standard, and you’ve probably helped organize (or at least played in) a few events.You’re a great communicator, organized, and not afraid to pick up the phone, drop into a store, or follow up a few times. You’re a self-starter who thrives in a startup-like environment and can work independently.You’re based in North America and open to travel up to 30%. Bonus Points If You…Have worked in or with a local game store before.Already know (and love) Dragon Shield products.Speak more than one language (Spanish or Canadian French is a big plus!). What We’re OfferingCompetitive base salary plus commissionFlexible remote work environmentTravel opportunities and access to major events/conventionsFree product samples and employee discountsA real voice in shaping the future of Dragon Shield’s direct-to-retailer presence This is your chance to be part of something new and meaningful in the tabletop gaming world—while working with one of the most trusted brands in the industry.  #LI-Remote

description.text:
About White Hat GamingWhite Hat Gaming is a state-of-the-art iGaming platform providing a secure, scalable and flexible modular Casino and Sportsbook Player Account Management solution.
We offer operators choice, from our proprietary Player Account Management (PAM) to a full white-label solution. WHG provides market-leading content including Kambi Sportsbook, CRM tools, all payment options, and more than 3000 games from 120 leading games providers.
With over 500 talented colleagues from around the world, we offer a dynamic, collaborative environment where your ideas can flourish alongside industry leaders. Join us and be at the forefront of iGaming innovation!
In Summary:
We need a Product Owner to join our growing team and help us to continue delivering exceptional Casino experiences across a range of devices. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in compliance within the gaming industry, particularly in B2C or B2B2C environments and will form part of the Product Team at White Hat Gaming.
As a Product Owner in the compliance space, you will play a key role in enhancing our compliance products and integrations, ensuring that our platforms adhere to industry regulations and standards.
Your day to day:Leading an Agile team in delivering and enhancing compliance products and integrations.Working closely with the Scrum Master in establishing and developing frameworks, processes, and tools to build and improve the focus on Iterative Product DevelopmentContinually prioritising and enhancing the Product roadmap, as part of WHG’s Company RoadmapConstantly prioritising incoming work to balance various regulatory, stakeholder and technical inputsDocumenting stories and requirements clearly, concisely and appropriately Being an active part of a Scrum team, consisting of Product Owner, Scrum Master, Developers, QA and Integrations Engineers; preparing for and contributing fully in all scrum ceremonies to ensure effective delivery of the roadmap 
What we are looking for:In-depth knowledge of compliance within the gaming industry, with particular focus on KYC/Verification regulations across UK, Europe, Canada and the USA.Experience working with Casino operationsA collaborative approach and used to working with different Product VerticalsStrong analytical skills to interpret complex regulatory requirements and translate them into actionable product features4 years plus of compliance experience within iGaming, preferably in the B2C spaceAbility to translate company and business strategy into the WHG product visionAbility to identify and mitigate compliance risks associated with product development and implementationA value-focused product approach with a focus on enriching the productsDriving innovation, encouraging creativity, and collecting ideas for new propositions to strengthen and develop the product portfolio for the assigned product area whilst also adding business value as well as meeting the customers’ & market's needsAbility to translate B2C thinking, features and functionality into a packaged B2B offeringWorking together with other Product Owners, Product Managers and Head of Product to ensure alignment across various strategic dependenciesClearly communicate the product area strategies, roadmap, and planned deliveries to internal and external stakeholdersProvide insight to stakeholders and provide insights on key differentiatorsManage and own the profitability and commercial success of the designated product area
Nice to have:
Understanding of SDLC and, preferably, experience with provider integrationsKnowledge/experience of the Scrum frameworkExperience using Jira/Confluence and similar toolsFamiliarity with APIsProject or Product Management Certification (PMP, PSM or other)Experience and knowledge of Responsible Gambling regulations across UK, Europe, Canada, and the USA.
How we approach things:Dynamic Medium-Sized Environment: We have a can-do ethos, where innovation is encouraged, and action is valued.Core Values at Heart: We live by Teamwork, Innovation, Trust, and Integrity in everything we do.Results-Oriented Focus: We prioritize getting things done while supporting each other to reach both collective and individual goals.Open Collaboration: Our open-door policy fosters collaboration across all levels and departments, where ideas flow freely.Global Team: We are truly a global team with people from various counties and cultures contributing to our success.
What we offer:A remote and flexible working schedule. Generous time off varied based on the country of residence.Discretionary annual performance bonusTraining and other learning & development opportunities to support you through your career progression.Hardware & Software allowance or work equipment is provided to make sure you have all the right tools to get the job done.Various well-being programmes and initiatives.
Everything about WHG won't fit into a job ad, want to find out more about working with us? Apply to get the conversation started. 
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.
By submitting your application, you agree that we process your data in accordance with our Privacy Policy for the management of your candidature to any of the positions we offer.
